Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Mrs. Phan M. is a single mother caring for five children. Three of them are single and attend the local school. The other two are married and are employed in different jobs. She was married years ago, but divorced her husband. She is a sacrificing and determined woman who tries to earn money to ensure her family lives a proper life. Mrs. Phan M. owns a big farm that she inherited from her grandmother. She grows various crops on it by receiving helps from her daughter, but now she can not plow in her farmland. 

In order to solve this problem, Nak Sina would like to borrow a loan to hire a tractor to plow her farmland so she can plant crops. Mrs. Phan M. was not available the day of the photo, so her daughter is in the photo instead.

loans.use: To hire a tractor to plow her farmland so she can plant crops.

loans.name: Jovens

texts.en:
Jovens B. is from the city of Labo Ozamiz City. He is 31 years old. Jovens is married and has 1 infant-aged child. To make a living, Jovens owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating a tricycle transport services. Jovens has been engaged in his business for over 1 year and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jovens joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jovens is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jovens from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Sari Makmur Group

texts.en:
Ni Komang A. S. is a 26-year-old woman living in the town of Melaya - Bali.  She  is the group leader of a 10-member group loan offered by MUK.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Sari Makmur (PK-10338).

Ni Komang A. is married and has two young sons.  To make a living, Ni Komang A. owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale.  Ni Komang A. has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 200,000 IDR a month from these activities.

In 2010, Ni Komang A. joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Ni Komang A. is requesting a loan from MUK for the first time.    She is now requesting a loan of 1,500,000 IDR which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.  Ni Komang A. plans to put the profits of her business venture toward savings. She dreams that her family will one day have a house of their own. Currently, she lives with her in-laws. In addition, Ni Komang A. plans to save for her children's education. Her formal education ended after elementary school, and she hopes that her two boys will attain a high educational level.

About MUK:The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives.

Ni Komang A. S. merupakan 26 tahun wanita.  Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Melaya - Bali.  Ni Komang A. adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 10 anggota.  Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar.  Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah Sari Makmur (PK-10338).

Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual.  Ni Komang A. sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 2 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Komang A. menghasilkan sekitar 0,200 IDR.  Dalam 2010, Ni Komang A. bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  Ni Komang A. meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari MUK.    Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1.500.000 IDR.

Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 1st pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK.

Tentang MUK:

Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Leonilyn

texts.en:
Leonilyn C. is from the village of Kinangay Norte Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 22 years old. Leonilyn is single. To make a living, Leonilyn owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating a motor transport service. Leonilyn has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 5500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Leonilyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonilyn is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Leonilyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her  family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Arnoldo

texts.es: Arnoldo O. U. de 40 años de edad, reside en el pueblo de San Juan Opico, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad, en donde vive junto a su esposa quien se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y junto a dos hijos menores de edad. Arnoldo posee una parcela en la cual se encarga de criar ganado y luego comercializarlo. Gracias a sus excelentes estándares de calidad, Arnoldo cuenta con muchos clientes, esto ha pesar de que cuenta con poco tiempo de dedicarse a este trabajo como propietario de su negocio, aunque posee mucha experiencia debido a que se ha dedicado toda su vida a este oficio junto a su padre. Arnoldo solicita un préstamo con el fin de poder comprar mayor cantidad de alimentos para su ganado, y así mismo comprar dos vacas lecheras, para comercializar la leche y así mismo para consumo de la familia. Arnoldo espera mejorar su negocio y de esta forma brindarle una mejor vida a sus hijos y su esposa.
texts.en: Arnoldo O. U. is 40 years old and lives in the town of San Juan Opico, in the department of La Libertad.  He lives with his wife, who looks after the household chores, and their two young children.  Arnoldo owns a small farm in which he raises cattle to sell.  Thanks to his excellent quality standards, Arnoldo has many customers in spite of the fact that he hasn't been in charge of running this business for very long.  However, he has a lot of experience since he has been in the business alongside his father for his whole life.  Arnoldo is requesting a loan in order to be able to buy more feed for his cattle and also so that he can buy two dairy cows to sell their milk and use for his own family's consumption.  Arnoldo hopes to improve his business and therefore be able to provide his wife and children with a  better life.

loans.use: To buy two dairy cows

location.town: San Juan Opico, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Zoila Mariza

texts.es: Zoila Mariza G. D. P. D. 43 años D. edad, es una madre D. familia muy responsable, la cual se dedica por completo a su familia. Ella es madre soltera D. tres pequeños D. 3, 12 y 15 años D. edad, D. los cuales los dos mayores se dedican a trabajar, y junto a los cuales resiD. en el departamento D. Sonsonate. Zoila se gana la vida comercializando fruta pelada, y preparada con chile, limón y sal, así mismo comercializa tostadas D. yuca y sodas. El negocio se encuentra en la chochera D. su casa, en donD. se encuentra a la vista D. muchas personas. Sus ventas son bastante estables sobretodo porque se encuentra cerca D. una escuela, cuyos alumnos compran a diario sus productos. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad y variedad D. fruta, así mismo para comprar sodas y bolsas plásticas. D. esta forma Zoila espera poder estar muy bien equipada en su negocio y brindar un mejor servicio y D. esta manera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Zoila Mariza G. D. P. is 43 years old.  She is a very responsible mother who is completely devoted to her family.  She is a single mother and has three children aged 3, 12 and 15.  The eldest two children work and the family lives together in the department of Sonsonate.  Zoila earns her living selling fruit which she peels and prepares with chile, lemon and salt, she also sells yuca tostadas and soda.  Her business is located outsiD. her house where she is visited by many people.  Her sales are quite stable, above all because she is lives near a school whose students buy her products every day.  She is requesting a loan so that she can buy a bigger and more varied quantity of fruit, as well as soda and plastic bags.  In this way, Zoila hopes to be able to have her business well stocked, proviD. better customer service and thereby improve her income.

loans.use: To buy a variety of fruit and soda to sell

loans.name: Nuruypa

texts.en:
Nuruypa A. is married and lives in Vozesenovka village with her family. She was born in a large family of farmers and from early childhood was engaged in looking after cattle.  She graduated from medical college and worked as a nurse at the local hospital. In 1994, Nuruypa got married and soon gave a birth to two children. In order to find additional means of subsistence for her family, she decided to begin her business in cattle breeding. Owing to wide experience in this activity, Nuruypa managed to maintain the farm with two milk cows, two calves, one bull and five sheep.   In order to enlarge the number of cattle, she obtained two loans from Bai Tushum and repaid them without any delays. With the revenues, Nuruypa was able to reconstruct one of the rooms in her house into a small shop with groceries and to buy a used car for the family The car was  then adapted to taxi transportations by her husband. Unfortunately, in 2009, her husband met with a car accident and needed expensive medical treatment, which was paid through selling cattle. 

Now Nuruypa is applying for a loan of 100,000 Kyrgyz Soms to buy tree bull-calves and purchase goods to enlarge inventory in her shop. Nuruypa is optimistic woman and believes that her tireless efforts will lead her family to a new prosperous life.  
 
Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and supplies

loans.name: Rosa Angélica

texts.es: Rosa Angélica E. D. G. D. 43 años D. edad, resiD. en Santa Tecla, ubicado en el departamento D. La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como motorista y junto a tres hijos. Rosa posee una tortillería desD. hace 15 años, en el cual ha trabajado arduamente por el bienestar D. sus hijos, ya que Rosa es una madre  muy dedicada a su hogar y que cuenta con enormes deseos D. salir adelante. Rosa solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda compra maíz para la elaboración D. las tortillas, esto debido a que cuenta con muy buena clientela, y ella desea poder atender a más clientes, puesto que en muchas ocasiones por falta D. masa no ha podido atender a mas personas, es por ello que solicita el préstamo el cual le permita comprar más materia prima y así vender más y obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en: Rosa Angélica E. D. G. is 43 years old and lives in Santa Tecla, in the department of La Libertad.  She lives with her husband, who works as a driver, and their three children.  Rosa has had a tortilleria (tortilla bakery) for 15 years in which she works very hard for the well-being of her children.  Rosa is a mother who is devoted to her family and who has an enormous desire to get ahead.  Rosa is requesting a loan so that she can buy corn to make her tortillas.  Rosa has a lot of very good customers and she would like to be able to serve even more since quite often she can't serve any more people as she doesn't have enough dough.  This is why she is requesting the loan as it will enable her to buy more supplies and thereby be able to sell more and make more profits.

loans.use: To buy corn to make tortillas

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
The woman and man shown in the picture are Mrs. Kong L. and her husband, who live in the province of Kompong Cham. This couple has spent their lives cultivating crops. This is a skill they learned from their grandparents when they were young. They have five school-age children. 

Mrs. Kong L. and her husband are able to plant the crops at least twice a year following both rainy and dry seasons. Usually this family generates around $4 of profit a day to meet the needs of their family. This is currently the harvesting season. Mrs. Kong L. needs capital to purchase many sacks of rice and peanuts to store. She will sell them when the rice and peanuts are commanding the highest price.

loans.use: To purchase many sacks of rice and peanuts to store.

loans.name: Luis Roberto

texts.es: Luis Roberto F. A. de 36 años de edad, es un hombre soltero, el cual vive junto a sus padres, quienes son de muy avanzada edad y que dependen de Luis. Él posee una librería en la que comercializa: cuadernos, libros, lapiceros, libretas, diferentes tipos de papel y todo lo relacionado con esto. El negocio se encuentra en su casa de habitación, en San Juan Opico, en el departamento de La Libertad  y es muy estable. Luis solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad de papelería, cuadernos, lapiceros, mochilas y todos los accesorios necesarios para surtir la librería, Luis desea hacer esto en esta tiempo del año ya que en enero es la temporada de regreso a clases y él espera poder obtener todo lo que necesita a precios más bajos debido a que en diciembre y enero los precios se incrementan.
texts.en: Luis Roberto F. A., 36, is single.  He lives with his elderly parents who depend on Luis' income.  He operates an office supply store where he sells: notebooks, books, pens and pencils, diaries, a variety of paper supplies and related items.  He operates the business from his house in San Juan Opico, a town in the Salvadoran "departamento" of La Libertad, and the business is doing well.  Luis is applying for a loan so that he can buy bulk supplies of paper, notebooks, pens and pencils, backpacks and other merchandise to stock his business.  He wants to increase his inventory now because the next school year starts in January and he wants to stock up before the costs of the products that he sells go up in December and January.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for paper supply store.

location.town: San Juan Opico, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es: Francisco Antonio S. A. de 50 años de edad, vive junto a su madre de 78 años de edad, quien se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar. Francisco posee una venta de medicina natural, la cual esta ubicada en la Plaza Bendición de Dios, y en donde gracias a todos los años que cuenta de tenerlo en la misma locación, es muy conocido por las personas que compran en esta plaza. Francisco depende por completo de las ganancias generadas por este negocio, ya que es la única fuente de ingresos que posee por lo que es de mucha importancia poder mejorarlo. Es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar más medicinas y así atender a más clientes los cuales le hacen diferentes tipos de pedidos. De esta forma Francisco se asegura obtener mayores ganancias las cuales sean de gran bendición para su hogar.
texts.en: Francisco Antonio S. A., 50, lives with his 78-year old mother who takes care of their house.  Francisco has operated a business selling herbal medicines in Plaza Bendicion de Dios for many years.  So many years, in fact, that he's very well known among the people who regularly come to the plaza to shop.  Francisco depends on the business for virtually all of his income so being able to grow and improve it is very important to him.  That's why he's applying for this loan: he will use it to buy more inventory so that he can better serve his customers and provide the kinds of products they want to buy.  He expects to be able to increase his income, as a consequence, and better provide for his family.

loans.use: Buy merchandise to resell.

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Matilde Del Carmen

texts.es: Matilde del Carmen H. de 36 años de edad, es madre de dos pequeños de 10 y 7 años de edad, junto a los cuales vive en el departamento de Cuscatlán, así mismo vive junto a su esposo quien se dedica a la agricultura. Matilde posee una tienda de productos de primera necesidad como comestibles y productos de uso diario en el hogar, muchos productos poseen una gran demanda por parte de las personas, las cuales Matilde desea mucho poder aumentar, ya que le permitirán tener mayores ganancias lo cual es muy importante para ella, ya que es gracias a la tienda que tanto ella como su esposo poseen una vida estable. Matilde solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en la tienda comprando productos como leche en polvo, pan, golosinas y sodas, entre otro número de productos más. Matilde posee una gran ilusión de poder ver su negocio en mejores condiciones y de esta manera salir adelante.
texts.en: Matilde del Carmen H., 36, has two young children, 10- and 7-years old, respectively.  They live in the Salvadoran "departamento" of Cuscatlan, along with Matilde's husband, a farmer.  Matilde operates a business selling everyday commodities, the food and other products that people use at home every day.  Demand among her customers for some of her products is greater than for others and Matilde wants to increase her inventory of the products in more demand so that she can, in turn, increase her income.  Increasing her income is important to her because the family budget depends as much on her income as on her husband's.  Matilde is applying for a loan so that she can buy merchandise--powdered milk, bread, snacks and sodas, among other things--that she will then resell.  Matilde feels empowered by the success of the business and sees it as a way to move ahead.

loans.use: Compra de productos perecederos.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es: Laura L. V. de 45 años de edad, reside en el departamento de La Libertad, junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como pescador, y así mismo vive junto a dos hijos mayores de edad, de los cuales el mayor le ayuda con el negocio, ya que Laura no sólo trabaja en su casa vendiendo mariscos y cócteles, sino que también se dedica al cuidado de su hijo menor quien es especial. Laura trabaja arduamente durante toda la semana, comercializando diferentes tipos de mariscos, sus ventas sus muy estables ya que se encuentra en el puerto de La Libertad en donde hay una gran afluencia de turistas que visitan el lugar. Laura solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar más mariscos y de esta forma mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Laura L. V., 45, lives in the Salvadoran "departamento" of La Libertad with her husband, a fisherman, and their two grown children, the oldest of whom helps with the business.  Laura not only manages the family business--seafood sales--but also takes care of the couple's younger, special-needs child.  Laura works very hard during the week, selling different kinds of seafood, and sales are steady.  The business is located in the port area of La Libertad and the business can depend on the large number of tourists who come here.  Laura is applying for a loan that she will use to increase her inventory and, in turn, her income.

loans.use: Buy merchandise to resell.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane P. is from the village of Katutungan, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 37 years old. Mary Jane is married and has five school-age children. 

Mary Jane owns a specialized retail store where the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use and personal products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She is also retailing and distributing NATASHA and AVON products.   Mary Jane has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Mary Jane joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Jane has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI. She is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be the 9th loan taken out by Mary Jane from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to continue to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Lito

texts.en:
Lito G. Jr. is from the village of Katutungan, Wao, Lanao del Sur. He is 30 years old. Lito is married and has one school-age child. 

Lito owns a business in which the main source of income comes from providing motorcycle or habal-habal services to local community members. Lito has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 5,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Lito joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lito has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase materials needed to provide his service. Lito is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the motorcycle. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the motorcycle

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa P. is from the village of Poblacion 4 Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 56 years old. Teresa is married and has five adult children. 

Teresa owns a general store which sells a variety of different products such as soap powder, biscuits, sugar, rice, and salt to the local community. Teresa has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Teresa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. Teresa is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Teresa from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to continue to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Inocensia

texts.en:
Inocensia B. is from the city of Gango Ozamiz City. She is 54 years old. Inocensia is married and has three adult children.

Inocensia owns a business venture in which she provides boarding house (lodging house for students) services in the local community. Inocensia has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 11,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Inocensia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Inocensia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC.  Inocensia is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide her service. This loan will be the 10th loan taken out by Inocensia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to continue to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.en:
Zoraida P., from the village of Western, Wao, Lanao del Sur, is 54 years old, married, and has four grown children. To make a living, Zoraida owns and operates a water-refilling station offering various-sized containers in the local community. She also runs a sari-sari store selling snack foods. Zoraida has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Zoraida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI that was used as working capital and to purchase additional inventory, she is requesting a new loan of 13000 PHP to invest in expanding the business and buy tools for the maintenance of the water station. This will be Zoraida's fifth loan from HSPFI, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business and to buy tools for the maintenance of the water station

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace N. is from the village of Eastern Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 27 years old. Grace is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business providing motorcycle or habal-habal services to local community members, with her husband as the driver. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $163 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Grace joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service. 

Grace is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools for the maintenance of the motorcycle. This will be her 5th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools for the maintenance of the motorcycle

loans.name: Gema

texts.en:
Gema S. is from the village of Poblacion 3, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old. Gema is married and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, she owns and operates motorcycle transport services. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Gema joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This will be her 1st loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Divina Gracia

texts.en:
Divina Gracia C. is from the village of Katutungan, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 34 years old. Divina Gracia is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, junk foods and biscuits in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately $175 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Divina Gracia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Divina Gracia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 9th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Maria Lorna

texts.en:
Maria Lorna L. is from the village of Katutungan, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 27 years old and single. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, noodles and junk foods in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $150 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Maria Lorna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel S. is from the village of Villa M Tejero, Liloy, Zamboanga Del Norte. She is 26 years old. Liezel is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $214 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Liezel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Liezel is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which again will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 5th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

In 2010, Rodulfo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Regina C. is from the village of Villa M Tejero, Liloy, Zamboanga Del Norte. She is 37 years old. Regina is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $190 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Regina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Regina is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which again will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 5th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

loans.name: Suraiya's Group

texts.en:
Suraiya is a 56-year-old housewife who prefers to stay at home and take care of her household responsibilities. She lives in Gujranwala, which is an industrial city in Pakistan. She lives there in a two-room brick house in the housing colony named Rana colony.
 
Her husband, M. M., has a dairy business. He has a buffalo at his home from which he gets milk that he sells through his shop. Due to the quality of his milk he has a good number of clients.
    
Suraiya has given birth to five children. Her eldest son works in the factory. He left his education after completing 10th grade and started this job to support his family financially. Her second son operates a grocery store in the market. He has been operating this business for over ten years.  
 
Suraiya has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, for her son’s grocery store business. With the loan he will buy groceries in bulk quantities for his store and thus increase his sales.  Suraiya is hopeful that this loan investment will bring positive changes to her son’s business and that his daily income will grow.   
 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 4th loan application. In previous loan years, she has  maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.  
  
Note: In the photo, Suraiya is the lady who has a book in her hands (called the Asasah Passbook).

loans.use: To buy groceries for her son's grocery store

loans.name: Pal

texts.en:
Pal P. is a 48-year-old woman, married to Toun Lai, age 61, and he appears in the picture. This old couple lives with seven children and earns a living by planting various crops on their farmland. Pal P. currently plants a potato crop, which she will harvest when the potatoes are mature. The family typically generates revenue of about $3 each day. 

Pal P. said that she depends on the income from her daughter, who works in the garment industry. Her daughter always needs to hire a taxi to go to work because she has no vehicle. Pal P. wants to encourage her child, but her savings account is insufficient. To overcome the obstacle, Pal P. would like to request a loan for her daughter to purchase a used motorcycle for driving to work.

loans.use: To purchase a used motorcycle for her daughter to drive to work.

loans.name: Serina Wambui

texts.en:
Serina has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last five years.  She is 33 years old, married to Amos M. and they have three children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the cash to buy fertilizer and potato seedlings for planting.

In the future, Serina hopes to buy more land and practice large scale farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and potato seedlings.

loans.name: Perveen Muhammad Javed's Group

texts.en:
Perveen M. J. is a seamstress by profession. She started this business a few years ago to financially support her husband, whose business of driving a rickshaw was not enough to fulfill the basic needs of the family. She has become known in her area as an excellent seamstress, and she receives regular orders every month. 

Perveen lives in a city called Gujranwala, which is famous for its sweetmeats and is located in Punjab, Pakistan. She lives in a two-room brick house in an area called Asghar colony. 

She has given birth to four sons and three daughters. Her first three sons couldn’t complete their education because of the family's poor financial conditions and started doing work. They all do different work to financially support their family. Now, due to their work, Perveen is able to enroll her younger children in school so they can get an education and make their future bright. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son, who operates a business of selling ceiling fans. He will invest the loan in purchasing ceiling fans in larger quantity to fulfill the demands of clients and to make more income. 

nPerveen is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In the previous loan year, she paid her installments in a timely way and attended every meeting.

loans.use: To buy ceiling fans in larger quantity for reselling

loans.name: Roqiya Shabnam Group

texts.en:
Sakina D. A. is a member of Roqiya Shabnam's group. She is married with four children and lives in 13th district of Kabul, Afghanistan. Her children are students and their education is very important to her.
.
Sakina has a tailoring business and she has been involved in this business more than seven years. She needs the loan to purchase a new sewing machine and other important items for her business. She is thankful that this effective process supports her work.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine and other important items

loans.name: Batsuren

texts.en:
Batsuren S., 23, lives with her husband and one child in Suhbaatar province, Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her husband's sibling owns livestock in the countryside. Batsuren and her family used to live a nomadic lifestyle in the countryside herding livestock. Her husband is currently unemployed and uses his own van to move his home from place to place. They currently live in her father's yard. Her three-year-old child is in kindergarten.

Batsuren started her own meat-trading business in 2007 and has gained significant experience. She is now planning to operate a clothing retail business. In the future she hopes to have her own business and improve her family's standard of living. She is requesting a 1500000 MNT loan to import clothing from China in order to start her clothing retail business.

loans.use: To import clothing

loans.name: Guljazi

texts.en:
Guljazi H. is 38 years old and lives with her husband and five children, in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent home, in the Bayan-Ulgiy province of western Mongolia. Her oldest three children, ages 16, 14 and 12, all attend secondary school. 

Her husband works as an assistant driver with a monthly salary of 80000 MNT. In 2006, Guljazi worked in a cafe as an assistant cook. Later, she worked as a salesperson in a clothing market for a year. Then, in 2008, she began to operate a retail clothing business in her local community with working capital of 800000 MNT. 

Her business has not reached a sustainable level yet. Guljazi hopes to expand her business and also wants to be able to pay for her children to go to university so that they can get a good education. She is requesting a 1500000 MNT loan to import more clothing from China to sell.

loans.use: To import more clothing for resale

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah R. is 38 years old. She is married to Wilson, and they have seven children from 5 to 15 years old. Sarah has been running a kiosk for about five years. She earns monthly income of KES 2,000. 

She is applying for her first loan of KES 10000 from KADET Ltd. She will use the loan to expand the business and she will invest the anticipated profit back into the business. She dreams of having a big business and a well-managed family.

loans.use: Use to purchase business stock

loans.name: Munhbat

texts.en:
Munhbat E. is 26 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His eldest child attends a local secondary school.
Munhbat's wife operates a grocery trading business while Munhbat drives a taxi to supplement the family income. His wife sells flour and rice from a shipping container at the local market. They started this business in 2008 by first renting the container and then purchasing it with their business revenues. Over the years they have worked hard to build a stable business operation and their working capital has reached up to 5,000,000 MNT. With their business profits, they have been able to buy a a new car, which is used as a taxi. In the future, they plan to increase their working capital and improve the car. Munhbat is a very open-minded and friendly man and is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more flour and rice to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more flour and rice

loans.name: Dashdeleg

texts.en:
Dashdeleg T. is 62 years old and lives with his wife in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. He and his wife live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His wife herds their livestock in the countryside during the summer months. Dashdeleg makes furniture in his own shop near the family home.
Dashdeleg worked for a government organization from 1970 to 2006; he started his carpentry business in 1980 to supplement his family's income. He is retired now and focuses on his woodwork. He usually produces a variety of wooden products according to his customers' orders. Dashdeleg wants to own a stall in the central market one day where he can expand his customer base, sell more furniture and further improve his family’s financial situation.
Dashdeleg is a talkative and open-minded man. He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more wood and furniture-making supplies (which will cost 500,000 MNT). He will send the rest of the money to his wife in the countryside in order to purchase and transport dairy products to sell at the local market.

loans.use: To purchase wood and furniture-making supplies

loans.name: Joseph Muchiri

texts.en:
Joseph has been operating a motorcycle transportation business in Naivasha town for the last five years. He uses his motorbike to transport people and goods from one place to another. He is 23 years old, married to Eunice Wambui, and they have one child.
Joseph was introduced to Kiva partner, KADET, by his friend and this will be his second loan. He paid his first loan of 67,500 KES well and in good time. He plans to use this loan as capital to set up a salon for his wife in Naivasha town.

loans.use: To open a salon for his wife in Naivasha town

loans.name: Mendbayar

texts.en:
Mendbayar S. is 36 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. They live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her two daughters, aged 8 and 12, both attend a local secondary school.
Mendbayar operates a food trading business with the help of her husband. They began their grocery trading business in 2003 selling a variety of foodstuffs from a rented stall. Since 2007, they have been traveling through the countryside to sell both grocery products and consumer goods for profit. Over the years of successful operation, Mendbayar has managed to increase her working capital to a level exceeding 1,000,000 MNT. She has been saving her earnings to reach 3,000,000 MNT.
Mendbayar plans to buy a new truck for her husband to operate a transportation business to supplement the family's income. Moreover, she would like to keep growing her business as a stable operation and have her own workplace. Mendbayar is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan, which she will put with her own savings of 3,000,000 MNT, in order to purchase a new truck at 4,000,000 MNT for her husband's business.

loans.use: To purchase a new truck for her husband to establish a transportation business

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
At 50 years of age, Fe C. never feels tired of doing things to make money to support everyday living. Sometimes Fe's five children who are independent and have their own jobs (Mary Ann, Mary Jane, Alife, Alexander and April) have given her money from their salaries. However, Fe does not stop there because she knows her children need their incomes for their own families in the future. Fe wants to be the one who who helps her children's families, especially her youngest daughter, Alinie, who is a college student and still dependent on her. That’s why Fe decided to join Kiva field partner, Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), to borrow capital that she needs to run her rice retail venture.
Now, her business is still running, but Fe need additional funds to expand the business. She wants to increase her stock of rice that she sells from her house. This will make her business grow.
Fe has a simple dream of ensuring that her family do not experience hard things. To be able to do this will make her happy, and that’s why she will never get tired of helping them, even in little ways. If this dreams happens, Fe also hopes to extend a helping hand to others, especially her relatives who also need support. Fe is very glad for the inspiration and encouragement that give her strength to continue dreaming of the best in life.

loans.use: To finance her rice retail business

loans.name: Mussarat's Group

texts.en:
Mussarat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of her husband’s business selling plastic beans (which are used in making plastic bags). Utilizing the loan money, he will buy a bulk quantity of plastic beans, which will help him fulfill larger orders on time. He mainly receives orders from factories.
  
Mussarat performs her duty as a seamstress to help her husband in meeting the financial needs of the family. She works for neighboring clients and receives good orders every month. 

She lives in a two-room brick house with her family in the area named Rana colony, in the city of Gujranwala. It is an industrial city of Pakistan. She has three daughters and a son. Her son is the eldest one, and he is a motor mechanic. He couldn’t get an education because he didn’t show any interest in it. But her daughters are enrolled in a school and are getting an education. 

Mussarat is a regular loan user of Asasah, and this is her second loan application. In her previous loan year, she established good credit behavior and attended every meeting.

loans.use: To buy plastic beans in bulk for reselling

loans.name: Sop Aladji Bara Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOP ALADJI BARA est créé le 28 mars 2007. Il est composé de 09 femmes qui habitent le même village. Elles se sont organisées par proximité et par affinité. Le groupe fait partie du Banc villageois de THIECKENE-LOUGA.

Madame Dieumb D. debout à droite de la photo est responsable du groupe de solidarité. Elle est âgée de 25 ans. 

Elle est mariée sans enfant. Elle fait de l'embouche ovine depuis son accession dans le Banc Villageois.

Avec son nouveau crédit de 200.000 francs CFA elle va acheter 05 moutons et de l'aliment de bétail pour engraisser les sujets avant de les revendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires de sa localité.

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la maison
texts.en:
The SOP ALADJI BARA solidarity group was created on March 28, 2007. It is composed of nine women living in the same village. They came together through proximity and affinity. The group belongs to the Banc Villageois THIECKENE-LOUGA.

Mrs. Dieumb D., standing at the right of the photo, is the head of the group. She is 25 years old, and married without children. She started the activity of sheep fattening when she first joined the Banc Villageois. 

With her new loan of 200,000FCFA, she plans to buy five sheep and some livestock feed to fatten the animals prior to resale at the local weekly markets.

Her goal is to support her husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: Buying a pair of sheep for fattening

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina G. is from the village of Kinangay Norte, in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 41 years old. Gina is widowed and has four school-age children. To make a living, Gina raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting bananas to sell. Gina has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2010, Gina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Gina is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Gina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe H. is from Capucao, Ozamiz City. She is 40 years old. Fe is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Fe owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting corn and coconuts for sale. Fe has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Fe joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Fe is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the second loan taken out by Fe from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Manko Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de Solidarité MANKO est créé le 28 mars 2007. Il est composé de 06 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même village. Elles ont formé leur groupe par affinité et par proximité. Le groupe fait partie du Banc villageois de THIECKENE-LOUGA

Madame PENDA S. à droite de la photo, en écharpe bleue foncée, est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 58 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants.

Elle fait de l'embouche ovine comme activité principale. Et parallèlement elle fait de la transformation et vente d'huile d'arachide.

Avec son nouveau elle va acheter un bélier et des arachides pour mener ses activités.

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
The Manko Solidarity group was created on 28 March 2007. It is composed of 6 women, all of whom come from the same village. They formed their group through familial and local relations. The group is a member of the Village Loan fund of Thieckene-Louga.

Ms. Penda S., in the dark blue scarf on the right side of the photo, is responsible for the group. She is 58 years old, married, and has 5 children.

Her main activity is sheep-rearing. On the side, she also processes and sells peanut oil.

With this new loan, she is going to buy a ram and peanuts for her business.

Her goal is to support her husband in providing for the family.

loans.use: To buy and raise sheep

loans.name: Nao

texts.en:
Mrs. Nao R. (in the photo) and her husband, Mr. Vuthy Cheng, live in a small village near the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They married in 1987 and have four children--two sons and two daughters. One of them is married and lives separately, and the others are in school. 

Nao is a weaver and assists her husband’s businesses--raising pigs and producing rice wine. Nao has asked for a Kiva loan several times already. She is now requesting another loan of $1,000 to purchase silk materials to continue her weaving business and build a new pigpen and buy additional piglets to raise.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials and build pigpen and buy additional piglets

loans.name: Sotheavy

texts.en:
Mrs. Sotheavy M. (pictured at her grocery store) is 42 years old and her husband, Mr. Channy Chin, is also 42 years old. They live in a small village across the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1990 and have three children who are in school--one son and two daughters. The son is in university. 

Sotheavy is a weaver. Besides weaving, she also sells groceries at home. She is applying for her first loan of $1,000. She will use $400 of the loan to pay school fees for her son, $300 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business, and $300 to buy more grocery items for resale.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her son, purchase silk materials for her weaving business, and buy more grocery items for resale

loans.name: Gulnozkhon's Group

texts.en:
The current unemployment rate in Kyrgyzstan is extremely high. If educated citizens are in search of jobs, then unskilled workers have lost hope completely. Unfortunately, our nation cannot provide every citizen with a worthy job, so most workers have to be headed abroad. The Russian Federation is the best option for workers. First, the language is not a barrier. Kyrgyzstan as a former Soviet Union Republic still uses the Russian language as a second official one. Also, Russia is in great need of cheap labor, so this cooperation benefits both sides. In many families in rural areas of Kyrgyzstan, at least one member of the family is employed abroad. 

Gulnozkhon T., 44, is from a village called Aravan in Southern Kyrgyzstan. Her husband left to go to Russia in search of better opportunities to earn money. There, he works as  a construction builder.  Her older daughter is a seamstress and the family is getting ready for her upcoming wedding. Gulnozkhon’s second daughter and a son also help out about the house.  The family business is cultivating and selling cotton.  The purpose of the loan is purchasing a dowry for her daughter’s wedding, broadening her business by raising livestock also and making repairs in their house. 

Gavharoi R., 40, is involved in raising and selling bulls. Her husband and two sons work in Russia.  She plans to spend this loan on purchasing more livestock and broadening her business. She would like to spend her profit on finishing the construction of some of the rooms in her house. 

Takhir T., 39, raises poultry. The purpose of the loan is to start raising livestock and reselling it. He plans to spend the profit on developing his business and on repairing the house. 

Oktyabrkhon E., 43, raises livestock. She also does dairy farming. She needs this loan to finish the construction of her house and arrange weddings for her daughters.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to prepare the dowry for her daughter's wedding

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
Marcela S. is from the village of Yahong, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 69 years old. Marcela is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Marcela owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables like string beans and others for sale. Marcela has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marcela joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marcela has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Marcela is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the third loan taken out by Marcela from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Sarah Abaa Group

texts.en:
Sarah A. is from the village of Guba, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old. Sarah is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are each collectively responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if she is delinquent or defaults.

Sarah is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Sarah owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products such as soap, shampoo, sugar, salt, noodles and others in the local community. Sarah has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Sarah joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sarah has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Sarah is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Sarah from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The borrower is 44 years old, married, and has two children. He graduated from primary school. He will use this loan to purchase raw materials, plywood for the construction and a big saw. The borrower sells good quality at a reasonable price; many clients come to buy items for house construction from him. The borrower has a high reputation in the market. He can compete with other shops very honestly and humanely and that has made him keep a good business.

loans.use: purchasing a big saw and wood

loans.name: Ramonita

texts.en:
Ramonita B. is from the village of Purok -3, Solinog, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 56 years old. Ramonita is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Ramonita owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, sardines, dried fish, toothpaste and others in the local community. Ramonita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Ramonita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ramonita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Ramonita is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Ramonita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Not-Ayni

texts.en:
Mrs. Not-ayni S. (in the photo) is 35 years old and her husband, Mr. San Nan is 38 years old. They have been married since 1990 and have seven children--three sons and four daughters. The family lives along National Road Number Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Not-ayni and her husband are fishermen. They fish from the river and sell their catch in the village market. She is requesting her first loan of $900 to purchase new fishing gear because some of hers is broken and to repair the house where she lives.

loans.use: To purchase new fishing materials and repair the house where she lives

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophal T. (pictured above) and her husband, Mr. Senglay Kroeung, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They married in 1990 and have two daughters. 

Sophal is a silk weaver. In the past, she ran a grocery store. She is requesting a loan of US$ 500 to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Mary Lou

texts.en:
Mary Lou E. is from the village of Guba Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 24 years old. Mary Lou is married and has an infant child. Mary Lou owns & operates a motor transport service business. Mary Lou has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2010, Mary Lou joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Lou has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Mary Lou is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Mary Lou from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisher-folk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: vehicle repair

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The Kiva borrower is a 55-year-old married man and the father of three children. He lives in Lebanon. He has been working as a house builder for almost 25 years. He works on a freelance basis upon request of the clients. Due to his long history in this occupation, he has acquired good experience and a good business reputation.

Today, he has the opportunity to expand his business into other areas. He is asking to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a pick-up vehicle to move his tools and to facilitate his movements to the projects where he works. He is certain that with the help of the loan, he will be able to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase a pick-up vehicle

loans.name: Rany

texts.en:
Mrs. Rany S. (pictured with her grocery store) was married in 1999 and has one son and two daughters. Two of them are in school and the other is still young and stays at home. 

Rany has been selling groceries since 2006. She is a silk weaver as well. Rany has had several Kiva loans already. Now is requesting another loan of $300 to repair her grocery store.

loans.use: To repair her grocery store

loans.name: Sop Mame Diarra Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de Solidarité SOP MAME DIARRA est créé le 28 mars 2007. Il est composé de 11 femmes qui sont issues de la même localité et ont formé leur groupe par des liens de parenté. Le groupe de solidarité fait partie du Banc Villageois de THIECKENE-LOUGA

Madame Marèma D., debout à droite de la photo, de noir vêtue est responsable du Groupe. Elle est âgée de 43 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants en charge. 

Elle fait de l'embouche ovine comme activité principale. Elle fait aussi de la transformation et vente d'huile d'arachide. 

Avec son crédit elle va renforcer son activité afin d'accroitre ses revenus

Elle a comme objectif de soutenir son mari et de renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
The Sop Mame Diarra Solidarity group was created on 28 March 2007. It is composed of 11 women, all from the same locality, who formed their group through familial relations. The solidarity group is a member of the Village Loan fund of Thieckene-Louga.

Ms. Marèma D., dressed in black and standing on the right in the photo, is responsible for the group. She is 43 years old, married, and is the mother of 5 children who are in her care.

Her principal activity is sheep-rearing. She also processes and sells peanut oil.

With this loan, she is going to strengthen her business in order to increase her income.

Her goal is to support her husband and strengthen her savings.

loans.use: To buy sheep and peanuts

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This borrower is 38 years old, married, and has three children. He graduated from Industry School. He will use this loan to develop his shop repairing electronic automobile devices and players, and he will purchase some new DVD players used in cars. He will also do some decorating. The borrower is gaining lots of experience in repairing all categories of automobile devices. He has a high reputation in the market. Lots of clients come to him to repair their cars whenever they require it. The borrower has the capacity to raise the level of his family’s income. He has been working in this field for more than 20 years; he started his work as a hobby then it became a business.

loans.use: purchasing recorders, car DVD players, and doing some decorating

loans.name: Onn

texts.en:
Mrs. Onn V., 47, and her husband, Mr. Soeun Men, 42, live in a village along National Road Number Six about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Onn and her husband are fishermen. She used to be a construction worker as well. She is asking for her first loan of $250 to purchase a boat and fishing nets for her fishing business.

loans.use: To purchase a boat and fishing nets

loans.name: Burulbu's Group

texts.en:
The East has always been known for its colorful traditions and unique lifestyle. Central Asian countries are not an exception. The highest value for people is family ties. They are very strong and are kept tight for generations. Therefore, people always help out their children and their parents, both morally and financially in any kind of situation. 

Burulbu M., 53, is from the village of Aravan in southern Kyrgyzstan. Burulbu has been married for 27 years now and has two grown children. Her husband is a dentist. Her older son has chosen a military career and her younger son has decided to follow his father’s steps and become a professional dentist. 

Burulbu and her daughter-in-law are busy with raising and selling cattle. In ten years of being in business, the family already has managed to purchase a car and arrange a nice wedding for their older son. Burulbu plans to spend this loan on construction materials for building a temporary house. In the near future, she would like to adorn her house with new furniture and continue helping her younger son to get a good medical education.

Yulduzkhon A., 41, sells vegetables and fruits in the local market. Yulduzkhon plans to spend some part of the loan on broadening her business and the rest on purchasing construction materials. When she has the opportunity, she plans to open a small shop in the village.

Tojikhon H., 55, raises and sells sheep. Her business was started two years ago, and by now she has already made major repairs to her house. Tojikhon applied for this loan in order to get new furniture as a gift for her daughter’s wedding. 

Mavjuda E., 38, is a farmer. Thanks to her business she moved to a new house. She would like to spend this loan on buying new furniture for her daughter’s house. Also, with the profit from her business, she would like to repair her house. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135
