She runs the business in a very competitive environment but she is determined to make it in the business world.  She has requested a loan of 16,300 Kes to add more stock of clothes.

loans.use: To add stock of clothes

loans.name: Alba Nidia

texts.es: Alba Nidia tiene 3 hijos y trabajan de manera independiente. Esta no es la primera vez que realizaba financiamientos con Fundación. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es una pulpería, hace más de 14 años que se dedica a este negocio. Esto les ayudo como un ingreso adicional en su familia, poco a poco ella invirtió sus ahorros en arroz, pan, sopas y vitrinas para hacer más grande la tienda. Fue incrementando su capital y comprando más productos. El dinero que solicita será destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima. Pues todos los días busca la forma de darse apoyo para mejorar más.
texts.en: Alba Nidia has 3 children who all work. This is not the first loan which she has had with Fundación León.  Her business is running a small grocery store.  She has been in this business for 14 years.  It has helped her family by providing an additional income.  Little by little she has invested her savings in rice, bread, soup and display cases to make make her store bigger.  She has increased her capital and bought more products.  The money she is requesting will be used as working capital to buy supplies.  Every day she looks for ways in which to support herself in order to improve.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es: Fredy, de 27 años, es un hombre soltero, que cuida de su mamá Ida, de 48 años y de su padre, Marino, de 50 años, con los que vive en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Santa clara. A pesar de las diversas dificultades que encontró en la actividad agrícola, le gusta mucho sembrar papa, esa es su principal actividad. Todas las mañanas se dirige a sus terrenos agrícolas, donde cuida con esmero sus cultivos de las constantes enfermedades, que sufren producto del clima de la zona. Hace 8 años que se dedica a ello, tiempo suficiente para conocer las temporadas de mayor venta, en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de “Tarma”, por ello le molesta mucho, cuando insisten en bajar los precios. En adelante tiene pensado comprar sus propios terrenos agrícolas, con ello está seguro que podrá obtener más ingresos. Es el octavo crédito con MFP, y está contento de poder ahorrar con su banco comunal, “siempre tenemos que tener dinero para cualquier imprevisto”, menciona. Con el crédito que obtendrá, comprará remedios para purificar su cultivo de papa, de las variedades, “canchay”, “yungay” y “andina”, los que sembró en sus 5 terrenos de cultivo.
texts.en: Fredy is 27 years old.  He is single and looks after his mother Ida who is 48 and his father Marino who is 50.  They all live together in their own home in the town of Santa Clara.  In spite of the difficulties which he has faced in his farming business, Fredy really enjoys sowing potatoes which is his main business.  Every morning he heads for his plots of land where he looks after his crops with great care, fighting against the constant diseases which they suffer as a result of the region's climate.  He has been doing this for 8 years, time enough to get to know the best sales seasons in the wholesale market in the city of Tarma.  For this reason, he gets really annoyed when they insist on lowering prices.  In the future he would like to buy his own land as he is sure that this would help him to make better profits.  This is his eighth loan with MFP and he is happy to be able to save with his community bank.  “We must always have money for any unexpected events” he mentions.  With his loan he will buy remedies to protect his potato crop.  He grows 'canchay', 'yungay' and 'andina' potato varieties which he sows in his 5 plots of land.

loans.use: To buy remedies to protect his potato crops which he sows in 5 plots of land

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama H. smokes fish for sale at Asenadze near Abura. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a mason. She has been selling smoked fish for the past twenty years. She assists her husband in providing the basic needs of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to smoke for sale. She hopes to buy a plot of land from her additional income.

In this photo Ama is holding a piece of fish she is going to smoke.

loans.use: buy more fresh fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothes for men and women and Avon cosmetics in order to improve sales

loans.name: Eli De La Cruz

texts.es: Eli De La Cruz tiene 67 años, se dedica  a ofrecer el servicio de molino. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Tiene 6 hijos a su cargo pero todos trabajan de manera independiente. Esta es la única forma de poder sacar adelante a su familia y mejorar su nivel de vida, ya que además tiene más oportunidad de enseñarles a sus hijos como ganarse el pan de cada día. Poco a poco fue ahorrando hasta establecer lo que tiene hoy en día. Ya que en su comarca este negocio es muy rentable, además que el deposita mucho empeño en su negocio. El destino del financiamiento es para mejorar algunas maquinarias del molino.
texts.en:
Eli De La Cruz, age 67, provides milling services.  He has been doing this for over five years.  He has six children under his care, but they all work independently.

This is the only way to be able to get his family ahead and to improve their standard of living.  Also, he has more opportunity to teach his children how to earn their daily bread.  Little by little he was saving until he could establish what he now has.  This business is very profitable in his region, and he puts great effort into it.

The loan is to improve some of the mill’s machinery.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es: Ignacio, de 33 años, es un hombre trabajador, convive con Maribel, de 28 años, ambos tienen 4 hijos, todos ellos menores de edad, a los que crían y educan en su casa propia, ubicada en zona rural de “Santa Clara”. Cuando apenas era un niño, sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra, por ello, cuando estableció su propia familia, ya tenia experiencia en el cultivo de papa, y como padre responsable, en cada cosecha realizada, comercializaba su producción en el mercado central de la capital del país, donde pudo adquirir buenas ganancias y utilidades. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar y ver como la semilla crece poco a poco. Por ello para el futuro, está pensando ahorrar lo suficiente, para adquirir una camioneta con el que podrá trasladarse con mayor facilidad no solo a la capital, también a otras ciudades del país, ya que Ignacio quiere ser un comerciante mayorista de tubérculos. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP y como integrante de su banco comunal, agradece el apoyo ofrecido en los momentos difíciles que pasó. Con el crédito que obtendrá, comprará abono y guano (fertilizante natural), para nivelar su cultivos de papa de la variedad “pericholi” y “única”, que cosechará en estos meses.
texts.en: 33 year old Ignacio is a hardworking man who lives with 28 year old Maribel. They have four young children who they are bringing up and educating in their own home which is located in the rural area of Santa Clara. When he was just a boy, his parents taught him how to work the earth. This meant that when he started his own family he already had experience growing potatoes. As he is a responsible father, each harvest time he takes his crops to the central market of the country's capital and sells it there where he can get a good price and make a profit. What he likes about his work is sowing the crops and seeing how the seed grows little by little. For the future, he is thinking of saving enough to buy a truck that he can use to take his harvest not just to the capital, but also to other cities in the country. Ignacio wants to be a wholesaler of potato tubers. This is his fourth loan from MFP and, as a member of the community bank, he is grateful for the support offered to him in difficult times. He will use the loan that he is requesting to buy natural fertilizer to improve his crops of "pericholi" and 'única" variety potatoes, which he will be harvesting in the coming months.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to improve his potato crop

loans.name: G.s. Milagro De Jesus Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Milagro De Jesús está conformado por Maura de 32 años y Perfecta de 66 años por lo que juntas han sabido salir adelante, a pesar de las diferentes actividades económicas Maura se dedica a venta de refrescos y cerdos por lo que tiene más de 5 años de tener este negocio porque siempre se ha preocupado por proporcionarle a sus hijos los estudios necesarios, en el caso de Perfecta  se dedica a una abarrotería, pues tiene 12 años de tener esta actividad, por lo que no ha sido muy fácil mantener a su hijos y familia. Ambas son personas muy responsables por lo que están solicitando este financiamiento para capital de trabajo  para la compra de materia prima.
texts.en: The 'Milagro de Jesús' communal bank is made up of 32 year-old Maura and 66 year-old Perfecta who have known how to get ahead together in spite of the fact that they have different business activities.  Maura sells soft drinks and pigs.  She has been in this business for 5 years because she has always been keen to make sure her children pursue their studies.  Perfecta has a grocery store.  She has been in this business for 12 years and it hasn't been easy for her to support her children and family.  Both women are very responsible and they are requesting this loan to use as working capital, to buy supplies.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Aba Eyiba Cecilia

texts.en: Aba Eyiba Cecilia K. is married and has six dependents. Her husband is a farmer. She has been through junior high school. Aba sells fried fish at Abura. She uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Aba will use the loan to purchase more fresh fish to fry for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to provide her dependents with the best education.

loans.use: purchase more fresh fish to fry for sale

loans.name: María Lucila

texts.es: María Lucila D. 59 años de edad, reside en San Juan Opico, departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a dos hijos mayores de edad, quienes trabajan. María trabaja muy duro elaborando quesadillas, las cuales son un tipo de pan al cual se le coloca queso, estas poseen gran demanda, ya que son muy típicas de este país. Así mismo ella comercializa ropa para hombres mujeres y niños, las cuales vende de forma ambulante por diferentes colonias de San Juan Opico. María es una persona muy humilde, la cual desea salir adelante y poder contar con una vida mejor en la cual posee todo lo necesario para vivir. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar toda la materia prima para la elaboración de las quesadillas, y así mismo para comprar mayor cantidad de ropa y de esta forma aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
María Lucila D., age 59, resides in San Juan Opico in the Department of La Libertad. She lives with her two adult children who are working. María works very hard making quesadillas, which are a type of bread served with cheese in the middle. This type of food is in great demand since it is a traditional dish in this country. In addition, she sells clothing for men, women, and children as a street vendor throughout the different neighborhoods of San Juan Opico. María is a very humble person who wants to succeed and have a better life by acquiring the necessary things she needs to live.

She is requesting a loan so that she can buy supplies for making quesadillas. In addition, she will buy more clothing so that she can increase her sales.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for her food business & clothing to sell

location.town: San Juan Opico, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Ekua Atta Martha

texts.en: Ekua Atta Martha A. is married to a driver and they live together with their two children. She has not received any formal education. Ekua smokes fresh fish  for sale at Abura. Ekua will use the loan to purchase more fresh fish to smoke for sale. She assists her husband in taking care of the children. She hopes to reinvest her additional income.

loans.use: purchase more fresh fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Angela

texts.es: Ángela tiene 41 años, su actividad es la venta de cosméticos. Hace más de 3 años que tiene este negocio ella es una persona muy emprendedora. Inicia con ahorros propios pues la mayoría de sus clientes son vecinos y familiares y ciertas personas que recurren de su actividad. La mayoría de veces sale a vender todos los días los diferentes productos ya que tiene una gran variedad de encargos, pues la mayoría de sus clientes le solicitan por medio del catalogo es que ellos deciden lo que más les gusta.
texts.en: Ángela is 41 years old and has been selling cosmetics for more than three years.  She is a very enterprising individual.  Ángela started her business using her own savings.  Most of her customers are neighbors, relatives, and other people who do repeat business with her.  She sells different products every day since she keeps a wide variety.  Many customers place orders through the catalog since they must look through it until they decide what they like most.

loans.use: Operating capital to buy cosmetics

loans.name: Zahida Yaneth

texts.es: Zahida Yaneth G. D. de 25 años de edad, es una joven madre de familia muy responsable y trabajadora, vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos de 6 y 2 años de edad, junto a los cuales reside en el departamento de La Libertad. Zahida posee una panadería la cual esta ubicada en su propia casa. Ella se encarga de elaborar el pan y así mismo pasteles, que posteriormente comercializa en su casa de habitación, así mismo les entrega el pan a sus clientes en diferentes tiendas. Zahida es una persona muy responsable quien siempre entrega sus pedidos a tiempo, y quien hace pan de muy buena calidad, razón por la cual cuenta con muchos clientes. Zahida solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de harina, ya que en este momento ha aumentado de precio y ella desea contar con el dinero necesario para comprarla por mayor, así de esta manera podrá contar con provisiones, así también desea comprar manteca, levadura y azúcar, todo para la elaboración del pan y pasteles.
texts.en:
Zahida Yaneth G. D., age 25, is a young mother who is responsible and a hard worker. She lives with her husband and children (ages 6 and 2) in the Department of La Libertad. Zahida manages a bakery located in her house. She is in charge of making bread and pastries and then sells them from her home. In addition, she delivers bread to her customers at different stores. Zahida is a responsible person who always tries to deliver her orders on time and produce bread of high quality. This explains why she has many customers.

Zahida is requesting a loan so that she can buy a large quantity of flour. Since the price of flour has increased for the moment, she wants to have the necessary funds to buy in bulk so that she can be well-stocked. She will also purchase butter, yeast, and sugar for making bread and pastries.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for making bread & pastries

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Santos V. R. de 59 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Cuscatlán, en donde vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos de 22 y 16 años de edad, los cuales le ayudan con el negocio. Santos posee una venta de mariscos, la cual esta ubicada en el mercado de San Martín, lugar en el cual es muy conocida ya que se dedica a este tipo de negocio desde hace 23 años, por lo que es muy conocida en el lugar. Santos solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor variedad de mariscos como: pescado fresco y seco, camarones, conchas, y otros más. El mayor deseo de Santos es el poder mejorar su negocio, y de esta forma mejorar su estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Santos V. R., age 59, resides in the Department of Cuscatlán where she lives with her husband and two children (ages 22 and 16) who help her with her business. She sells seafood at the San Martín Market, a well-known place where she has been in operation for 23 years. Santos has become recognized in this area.

She is requesting a loan so that she can buy a wide variety of seafood such as fresh and dried fish, shrimp, shellfish, and other items. Her greatest wish is to improve her business so that she can have greater financial stability.

loans.use: Purchase a wide variety of seafood to sell

loans.name: Clara Berta

texts.es: Clara Berta tiene 26 años, su actividad es la venta de tortillas. Hace más de 3 años que tiene su negocio pues ella es una persona muy luchadora y trabajadora. Inicio su negocio por iniciativa propia pues necesitaba este negocio para mantener a su familia, ya que tiene 1 hijo menor de edad a su cargo. El mayor desafío que enfrenta es problemas de salud, ya que todos los días se levanta desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche y todo el día pasa de pie realizando su labor. Este crédito es para la compra de maíz, leña, comal entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Clara Berta is 26 years old and sells tortillas. She has been in this business for more than three years. Being a determined and hardworking person, Clara started her business of her own initiative because she needed to support her family. She has one young child under her care. Her greatest challenge has been health problems. Every day she wakes up at 5am and works until 7pm, working the entire day while on her feet.

This loan will be used to buy corn, firewood, and a grill among other items.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for making tortillas

loans.name: Jamineth

texts.es:
JAMINETH G. P.
La señora Jlamineth socia del banco comunal Pan D. Vida. Del distrito D. manantay  Departamento D. Ucayali, tiene 33 años D. edad  casada  con 4 niños menores.
Con los préstamos D. Manuela Ramos, se han dedicado a la crianza D. pollos y hacían parrilladas para así obtener  más ganancias.
La señora Jlamineth se dedica a la compra y venta D. ropa D. segunda, su esposo trabaja manejando el motocar que ambos compraron y el cual también les sirve como movilidad porque viven muy apartados D. la ciudad.
Su ultimo préstamo D. S/. 1,500.00 soles lo invertirá en la compra D. algunos repuestos para su motocar, comprara S/. 500.00 D. ropas con lo demás comprara algunas pinturas para hacer algunas aplicaciones a los polos para poder venderlos a mejor precio.
Jlamineth  está contenta porque tiene el apoyo que necesitaba departe D. Manuela Ramos para seguir trabajando y mejorando sus ingresos con el cual sustenta su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Jamineth is a member of the Communal Bank “Pan D. Vida” (Bread of Life), which is in the District of Manatay, Department of Ucayali. She is 33 years old, married, and has four young children.

With the loans from Manuela Ramos, she used the funds to raise chickens and then grilled them to earn more income. Sra. Jamineth buys and sells secondhand clothing. Her husband drives a motorcar that both of them purchased, which they also use for personal transportation since they live far from the city.

This latest loan of 1500 PEN will be invested in the purchase of spare parts for their motorcar. She will use 500 PEN to buy clothes and a few paints for making appliqués to polo shirts so that she can sell them at a better price. Jamileth is pleased because she has the assistance of Manuela Ramos so that she can continue working and improving her income to support her family.

loans.use: Purchase clothing, appliqué paints, and parts for her husband's motorcar

loans.name: Rayira

texts.en: Rayira is 50 years old. She is married and has eight children between the ages of 10 and 30. Her children go to school. Her husband is not employed. Rayira sells clothes. She has spent forty years in this business. With this loan she will buy more clothes to sell. With profits generated from this business, Rayira will provide for her family and reinvest some. Her business is successful because she sells at a reasonable price. In the future, she would like to own a commercial building.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Mercedes Olimpia

texts.es: Mercedes Olimpia G. C. de 55 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Soyapango, junto a su esposo. Ella posee su propio negocio el cual es una venta de ropa para hombres, mujeres y niños, la cual la comercializa en el mercado de San Martín, cada día Mercedes coloca la ropa en su automóviles  y se dirige al mercado en donde vende las prendas de vestir con sus diferentes clientes, así mismo este lugar es muy concurrido por personas, lo cual la beneficia en gran manera. Ella solicita un préstamo a Integral con el fin de poder comprar mayor cantidad de ropa en diferentes estilos, colores y tallas, lo cual le permita obtener mayor cantidad de clientes y de esta manera poder aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Mercedes Olimpia G. C., age 55, resides in the town of Soyapango with her husband. She has her own business selling clothing for men, women, and children at the market in San Martín. Each day, Mercedes loads her inventory into her car and brings it to the market where she sells clothes to different customers. At the market she has become well-known among the people, which is a great benefit.

Mercedes is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral so that she can buy a large quantity of clothes in different styles, colors, and sizes. This will enable her to attract more customers and increase her sales.

loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Monica

texts.es:
MONICA B. C.
Mónica es socia del banco comunal Las caseritas,  distrito de manatay departamento Ucayali, es casada y su esposo es trabajador independiente, tiene una hija menor de edad  y la  ilusión de progresar en su negocio.
Mónica lleva año y medio trabajando con los prestamos que Manuela Ramos realiza, el cual le ha servido para implementar la bodega que tiene en su casa. 
Su ultimo préstamo  de s/. 1,200 soles lo invertirán todo en su bodega para surtir con algunos productos que son muy consumidos este fin de año como son: 3 cajas de  chocolate en barra, 4 cajas de paneton,  2 cajas de leche,  1 saco de azúcar, 1 saco de arroz y 2 cajas de champan,  
Mónica  da las gracias a Manuela Ramos, por el apoyo que brinda a las mujeres que lo solicitan para iniciar sus proyectos, pequeños pero que los hacen con mucha ilusión y con todas las ganas de hacerlo crecer.
texts.en:
Mónica is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Caseritas”, which is located in the District of Manatay, Department of Ucayali. Her husband works independently. She has a young daughter and dreams of advancing her business.

Mónica has worked with loans from Manuela Ramos for a year and a half. She used the funds to establish the grocery store she manages in her home. This latest loan in the amount of 1200 PEN will be invested entirely in her store. Mónica will restock her business with a few products that are widely consumed toward the end of the year such as three cases of chocolate bars, four cases of panettones, one sack of sugar, one sack of rice, and two cases of champagne.

Mónica thanks Manuela Ramos for the support it provides to the women who ask for it so that they can start projects and small businesses. She is very excited and looks forward to making her business grow.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: José Alberto

texts.es: José Alberto M. de 45 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y tres hijos de 2, 8 y 10 años de edad, junto a  los cuales reside en el departamento de San Vicente. José es un hombre muy trabajador el cual vela por el bienestar de su familia, es por ello que se dedica de lleno a su negocio el cual es una tienda de productos perecederos, negocio el cual esta ubicado en su casa y recibe la ayuda de su esposa en donde juntos trabajan de lunes a domingo. Todo esto lo hace con el fin de poder obtener mayores ganancias y brindarle una vida mejor a sus hijos. José solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir su tienda, de manera que pueda tener mayor clientela quienes prefieran su negocio. Él es una persona que se destaca por ser muy trabajadora el cual siempre esta buscando una alternativa más para poder obtener mayores ganancias y así brindarle un mejor futuro a su esposa e hijos.
texts.en:
José Alberto M. is 45 years old and lives with his wife and three children (ages 2, 8, and 10) in the Department of San Vicente. He is a hardworking gentleman who looks out for the welfare of his family. For this reason, he devotes himself to his business managing a store where he sells perishable products. This business is located in his house. He has the help of his wife and together they work Monday through Sunday. All of their work is performed so that they can generate more income and provide a better life for their children.

José is requesting a loan so that he can restock his store. This will help him attract more customers who will choose his business. He is known for being a hard worker who always looks for better ways of generating more revenue and providing a better future for his wife and children.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for his store

loans.name: Raimundo

texts.es: Raimundo, de 53 años, es un hombre trabajador; está casado con Teresa, de 49 años, ambos tienen 5 hijos, pero solo vive con 3 de ellos, todos menores, a los que cuida y educa en su casa propia, ubicada en la zona rural de Santa Clara. A pesar de su edad, él se muestra con gran vitalidad. Sus 30 años en la agricultura, le demostraron que lo importante es mantener la convicción y el optimismo, trabajar duro y luchar por sus metas, ahora el desea comprar una casa en la ciudad de “Tarma”, por ello, en cada siembra de papa; está ahorrando mucho. Más de 5 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas que tiene, produce papa de diversas variedades, y cada mes le dejan grandes utilidades, con los que Raimundo  invierte para poder sembrar cada vez más. En su localidad es conocido por ser un agricultor a gran escala, pero sus nuevas metas son, incursionar en la siembra de maíz, arveja y olluco (productos agrícolas).  Es el noveno crédito con MFP y está orgulloso de ser el miembro más antiguo de su banco comunal, donde ayudó a las personas a salir adelante. Con el crédito que obtendrá; comprará abono orgánico, que esparcirá en sus sembríos de papa de la variedad “única”, la que dentro de algunos meses cosechará.
texts.en:
Raimundo is 53 years old and a hardworking gentleman who is married to Teresa, age 49. They have five children, but only the three youngest ones live with them since they still need to be cared for and educated. He has his own home in the rural area of Santa Clara. Raimundo still has great vitality despite his age. With thirty years of farming experience, he has demonstrated that the important things are to maintain conviction and optimism, work hard, and pursue your goals. Now he wants to buy a house in the city of Tarma. In order to do this, he saves much of his earnings from each potato harvest. Raimundo has more than five hectares of farmland on which he grows several varieties of potatoes. Each month he earns a large profit that he reinvests to achieve a larger harvest the following month. In his community, he is known as a large-scale farmer. However, his new goals are to start planting corn, peas, and ulluco (various agricultural products).

This is his ninth loan with MFP and he is proud to be the oldest member of his Communal Bank, where he has helped other people get ahead. With the loan he will receive, Raimundo will buy organic fertilizers to apply to his crop of potatoes of the “unique” variety, which will be harvested in a few months.

loans.use: Purchase organic fertilizers for his potato crop

loans.name: Leyla Isabel

texts.es:
Leyla es una mujer trabajadora, con una familia que tiene que apoyar, hoy en día tiene dos trabajos con el propósito de ganar más dinero.
 Trabaja en un sedei cuidando niños, y también su negocio de venta de ropa, y cosméticos en donde lleva muchos años en este negocio.
Iniciando con pocos productos, con ayuda de su esposo el cual labora como conductor.
Con este financiamiento invertirá en la compra de mercadería, de ropa de dama y  niño que es lo que más comercializa como los cosméticos.
Lo que más desea es poder poner una pequeña tienda en su casa y lograr mejor estabilidad en el comercio.
texts.en:
Leyla is a hard-working woman with a family that she has to support. Hoping to earn more money, she currently works two jobs.
She looks after children at a child development centre and has also run a business selling clothing and cosmetics for several years.
She started out with a few products with the help of her husband who works as a conductor.
She will use this loan to buy women’s and children’s clothing, which sells better than the cosmetics.
Her dream is to set up a small store in her home and to make her business more stable.

loans.use: Purchase women's and children's clothing

loans.name: Virginia Victoria

texts.es: Virginia Victoria se dedica a la venta de tortillas, leña y frijoles. Como toda madre responsable tiene que sacar adelante a sus 4 hijos que todavía dependen de ella. A pesar de tener este humilde negocio, busca la forma como mejorar los ingresos de su hogar la mayoría de sus clientes son vecinos, familiares y amigos pues conocen muy bien que las tortillas de Virginia son muy ricos y buenos. Ella inicio este negocio con muy pocos ahorros que tenia, pues ha sido muy difícil ya que poco a poco fue que creció y estableció también el negocio de leña y frijoles. Ahora solicita este crédito para la compra de materia prima como maíz, leña, frijoles, entre otros insumos necesarios.
texts.en:
Virginia Victoria sells tortillas, firewood, and beans.  Like all responsible mothers, she has to get her four children, who are still dependent upon her, ahead.

In spite of having this humble business, she is looking for ways to improve her household income.  Most of her customers are neighbors, relatives, and friends.  They know very well that Virginia’s tortillas are good and delicious.  She started this business with the very little savings that she had.  It has been very difficult.  Little by little the business grew, and she established the business of firewood and beans.

She is now requesting a loan to buy raw materials like corn, firewood, and beans, among other needed supplies.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Patricia De La Cruz

texts.es: Patricia D. La Cruz C. D. P. 43 años D. edad,  resiD. en el departamento D. San Vicente lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo, quien se destaca por ser un hombre muy trabajador, y así mismo junto a dos hijos. Patricia se dedica a la elaboración D. tamales, un platillo típico el cual esta hecho a base D. masa D. maíz, la cual se rellena con verduras y se envuelve en hojas D. huerta D. guineos, los cuales posteriormente comercializa D. forma ambulante, así mismo sus hijos le ayudan vendiendo algunos tamales en su casa D. habitación, Patricia solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar toda la materia prima para la elaboración D. mayor cantidad D. tamales, todo con el enorme deseo D. aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en: 43 year old Patricia lives in the department of San Vicente. She lives here with her husband, who stands out as a very hardworking man, and with their two children. Patricia makes tamales, a typical dish maD. from a corn dough which is filled with vegetables and wrapped in banana leaves. She then sells the tamales around town and her children help by selling some tamales from their home. Patricia is requesting a loan so that she can buy raw materials for making a greater quantity of tamales, all because she has an enormous desire to increase her income.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for making tamales

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan Carlos tiene 33 años, es casado y junto a su esposa tienen 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. El brinda el servicio de triciclo, desde hace 5 años que tiene esta actividad pues él es una persona responsable que disfruta de su trabajo ya que todos los días traslada a diferentes personas por la ciudad y municipios. El inicio con muy poco capital, pero con el paso del tiempo logro obtener algo de dinero y así pudo comprar s propio triciclo. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de pedales, cadena, llantas entre otras cosas necesarias para brindar un buen servicio.
texts.en: Juan Carlos is 33 years old, married and has two dependent children with his wife. He has operated a tricycle transportation service for 5 years. He is a responsible person who enjoys his work because every day he transports different people around the city and the municipalities. He started with a little capital, but over time he saved enough money to buy his own tricycle. He will use this loan to purchase pedals, chains, and tires, among other things he needs to provide good service.

loans.use: Tricycle parts

loans.name: Blanca Yesenia

texts.es: Blanca Yesenia T. D. S. D. 31 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Soyapango, junto a su esposo y dos hijos D. 12 y 5 años D. edad, quienes se dedican a estudiar. Blanca posee un comedor en el mercado municipal D. San Martín, en el cual elabora y venD. desayunos y almuerzos, así mismo comercializa bebidas frías y calientes. Debido a que ya posee muchos años D. tener este negocio, cuenta con una amplia clientela, la cual asiste a su comedor ya que la consideran como una persona D. mucha confianza, así mismo les agrada el buen trato que ella les brinda. Blanca solicita un préstamo con el deseo D. poder aumentar sus ventas, ya que ella espera poder comprar, verduras, arroz, frijoles, maíz y una mayor cantidad D. bebidas. Esto debido a que ella cuenta con la ilusión D. aumentar sus ventas en este fin D. año, es por ello que desea poder brindarles un mejor servicio D. comida a sus clientes y así mismo obtener nuevos clientes.
texts.en: 31 year old Blanca lives in the town of Soyapango along with her husband and two children of 12 and 5 years of age who are in school. Blanca has a cafeteria in the municipal market of San Martín where she cooks and sells breakfasts and lunches and also sells hot and cold drinks. Because she has had this business for many years, she has many customers who come to her cafeteria and who consider her to be a very reliable person and they also appreciate the good treatment she gives them. Blanca is requesting a loan so that she can increase her sales. She hopes to buy vegetables, rice, beans, corn, and a greater quantity of drinks. This is because she wants to increase her sales during the end of the year and she wants to be able to offer a better food service to her customers and in this way also gain new customers.

loans.use: To buy grains, fruits, and more, to supply her business.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es: Eduardo, de 26 años, es un hombre alegre y trabajador, que convive con Cecilia, de 22 años, ambos tienen 2 hijos, Sarai, de 5 y Tany, de 2 años, los cuatro viven en su casa propia ubicada en la zona rural de Santa Clara. Sus planes futuros, son adquirir terrenos agrícolas propios, por ello, hace 5 años que viene trabajando con ahínco en sus terrenos alquilados, donde siembra, papa, arveja, habas y demás hortalizas, las que después de cada cosecha las comercializa, en el mercado central de la ciudad de “Tarma”. Cada cosecha, producto del esfuerzo, de Eduardo, le brinda buenas utilidades, con las que, gracias al apoyo de su banco comunal, cada día esta ahorrando y ya le falta muy poco para obtener su propio terreno, con ello augura tener más ganancias y poder comprar muchos más. Es el sexto crédito con MFP, y agradece las enseñanzas bridadas por los miembros de su entidad, los que le impulsaron a salir adelante y pensar en el futuro. Con el crédito que obtendrá, comprará abono orgánico, que esparcirá en la papa de la variedad “arenosa”, que cosechará en estos meses, asimismo comprará semillas de arvejas.
texts.en: 26 year old Eduardo is a cheerful and hardworking man who lives with 22 year old Cecilia. They have 2 children, 5 year old Sarai and 2 year old Tany, and the four of them live in their own home located in the rural area of Santa Clara. Their future plan is to acquire their own farm land. For 5 years they have been working hard on rented land where they sow potatoes, peas, beans, and other vegetables which, after each harvest, they sell in the central marked of the city Tarma. Each harvest is a result of Eduardo's hard work and brings him good profits which, thanks to the support of the community bank, he is saving up. In very little time he will be able to buy his own land. He predicts that this will bring him greater income and he will be able to buy much more. This is his sixth loan from MFP, and he is grateful for the lessons offered to the bank members which motivate him to be successful and think of the future. He will use this loan to buy organic fertilizer which he will apply to his "arenosa" variety potatoes which he will be harvesting in the coming months. He will also buy pea seeds.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer and pea seeds.

loans.name: Eddy Alexis

texts.es: Eddy Alexis es un joven de 22 años, que se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado. Hace más de 3 años que tiene este negocio pues ha sido un joven muy emprendedor. Tiene 1 hijo de 2 años a su cargo el se encarga de trabajar para proporcionarle a su hijo y esposa lo necesario. Su Papa fue quien le enseño este medio de vida para que el lograra salir adelante en un futuro con su familia, así fue como Eddy se encargo del negocio, actualmente el tiene su propios clientes. Pero está solicitando el crédito para la compra de ganado ya que se acercan meses muy buenos como noviembre y diciembre que son muy buenos.
texts.en:
Eddy Alexis is a young man (22 years old) who buys and sells cattle.  He has had this business for more than three years because he is an enterprising young man.  He has a two-year-old son in his care, and he works to provide for the needs of his wife and son.

Eddy's father taught him this way of life so that he could have a comfortable future with his family.  That is how Eddy began in the business, and now he has his own customers.

He is asking for the loan to buy cattle since November and December, which are very good months for him, are approaching.

loans.use: Purchase cattle

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 29 years old. She is married and has three children between the ages of one and seven. Two of her children go to school. Her husband works as a businessman, and Esther sells shoes. She has had this business for fifteen years. With this loan, she expects to buy more shoes to sell. She will save some of the profits from her business and reinvest some back into her business. She says that her business is successful because she sells nice shoes. In the future she would like to increase her profits.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Luis Simeon

texts.es: Luis es un hombre trabajador y luchador que goza de tener a su esposa y 3 hijos menores de edad viviendo con él. Su actividad es una pulpería, negocio que inicio hace 5 años por iniciativa propia ya que necesitaba un medio para generar ingresos a su hogar y mantener a sus hijos, a pesar de que su mayor desafío ha sido organizar su tiempo, pues tiene que atender el negocio y realizar ciertas tareas del hogar para ayudar a su esposa. Es por eso que solicita este crédito con el fin de comprar golosinas, detergentes, granos básicos y jugos.
texts.en: Luis is a hardworking, determined man who enjoys living with his wife and three young children.  He runs a general store which he began five years ago on his own initiative because he needed a way to earn income to support his children.  His greatest challenge is organizing his time since he has to take care of the business and do some housework to help his wife.  That is why he is asking for this loan to buy snacks, detergents, basic grains and juices.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Hannah Ekua Awotwe

texts.en: Hannah Ekua Awotwe O. sells smoked fish at Asenadze near Abura. Hannah has junior high educational background. She is married and has four children. She has been selling smoked fish for five years. The loan will be added to her initial capital to expand her business. She plans to build a house from the additional income from the loan received.

loans.use: additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Rosa Enriqueta

texts.es: Rosa Enriqueta tiene 66 años, esta emprendedora Señora se dedica a una pulpería. No es la primera vez que solicita créditos con fundación, pues ha sido necesario para que su negocio avance. Hace más de 9 años que todos sus clientes llegan a su vivienda en donde está ubicado el negocio, por lo que tiene que levantarse temprano para atender a todos sus clientes que llegan en busca de diferentes productos. Inicio con muy poco capital pero la buena administración que ella realiza ha logrado tener lo que posee. Este crédito es para la compra de materia prima como golosinas, refrescos, galletas, detergentes, fideos, sopas fósforos entre otros.
texts.en:
Rosa Enriqueta is 66 years old.  This enterprising lady runs a general store.  This is not the first time she has asked for a loan with Fundación, since it has been necessary to help build her business.

For more than nine years all her customers have come to her house, where the business is located.  For this reason, Rosa must wake up early to take care of all her customers, who come looking for different products.  She began with very little capital, but her good business administration has allowed her to earn what she now has.

This loan is for purchasing resources like snacks, soft drinks, cookies, detergents, pasta, soups and matches, among other items.

loans.use: Business capital to buy snacks, soft drinks, cookies, detergents, pasta, soups, matches, etc.

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es: Viviana, de 35 años, es una mujer trabajadora, esta casada con Gregorio, de 35 años, ambos tienen 5 hijos, de los cuales 4 son menores y estudian, como una familia unida, ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Santa Clara. “Hace 20 años que me dedico a sembrar, pero pareciera que fue ayer”, afirma. Su vida se centra en el cuidado de sus terrenos, en los que pasa la mayor parte del día. Sus principales cultivos son de papa de las diferentes variedades. Además el buen carácter que tiene le ayuda en la comercialización de sus productos en el mercado central de la ciudad de “Tarma”, en donde sus clientes son bueno pagadores y saben de la calidad de su producción. Lo que le disgusta de la siembra es cuando, la rancha y gusanera se apodarán de los tubérculos, ocasionándole grandes pérdidas, pero eso no la desanida, por ello desea comprar sus terrenos agrícolas, limpios y sanos. Es el octavo crédito con MFP, y está agradecida por todo este tiempo que gracias al apoyo de su banco comunal, pudo sembrar. Con el crédito que obtendrá, comprará abono orgánico y guano (fertilizante natural), para esparcir en sus cultivos, de papa de la variedad “yungay”, que dentro de estos meses cosechará.
texts.en: Viviana is 35 years old.  She is married to Gregorio who is also 35.  They have 5 children, 4 of whom are still studying.  They live in their own home in the town of Santa Clara as a united family.  “I started sowing crops 20 years ago but it seems like it was yesterday”, Viviana says.  Her life is centered around the care of her plots of land which is where she spends most of her day.  Her main crops are different varieties of potato.  Her good character helps her when selling her products in the central market in the city of Tarma where her customers are good payers and are aware of the quality of her goods.  What upsets her about sowing crops is when blight and pests take over her tubers, causing great losses.  However, this does not stop her.  For this reason though, she would like to be able to keep her plots of land, clean and healthy.  This is the eighth loan she has had from MFP and she is grateful that she has had the support of her community bank and been able to sow her crops.  With this loan she will buy organic fertilizer and guano (a natural fertilizer), to spread on her crops  - “yungay” variety potatoes – which she will harvest shortly.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer for her potato crops

loans.name: Ama Abokuma Sabina

texts.en: Ama Abokuma Sabina Q. sells "banku" (fermented maize dough) and rice at Abura. She is married and has five dependents. Her husband is a charcoal maker. She assists her husband by making sure that the children are in good health. The loan will be used to buy more maize and rice to cook for sale. She hopes to reinvest her profit back into her business.

loans.use: buy more maize and rice to cook for sale

loans.name: Georgina Ekua Atta

texts.en: Georgina Ekua Atta N. sells salted fish at Abura. She moves around in the vicinity to sell the fish. Georgina is married to a driver. She assists her husband in taking care of the household. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to salt to meet the demand of her customers. She hopes to use the additional income to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: buy more fresh fish to salt

loans.name: Comfort Esi Akyere

texts.en:
Comfort Esi Akyere A. sells maize and cooks yams for sale at Abura. She has been through senior high school.  She is married and has two children. Her husband is a driver. She assists her husband to take care of the household. The loan will be added to her capital to expand her yam business. She hopes to reinvest the new profits from her business.

In this photo, Comfort is displaying a few of the yams she has cooked for the day.

loans.use: add to her capital to expand her yam business

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.es: La Sra. Fabiola R. es una mujer dedicada a su hogar pero eso no impide que siempre ha contribuido en el lado economico, hace dos años empezo su negocio de venta de platillos los cuales elabora en su hogar, para  estar al pendiente de sus hijos y no descuidar su educacion, ella comenta que empezo vendiendo platillos los dias sabados con las personas de la construccion que trabajan por su colonia y poco a poco fueron pidiendole mas dias, en este momento realiza sus ventas los dias viernes sabado y domingo, ella refiere que los demas dias solo realiza encargos es decir que por adelantado le encargan la comida. El esposo de la señora Fabiola trabaja en una empresa que se dedica a la elaboracion de blocks, ladrillos y materiales para construccion. Los dias que descansa le ayuda a su esposa a la entrega de los platillos, es un negocio que les esta funcionando y piensan que vale la pena invertirle,es por eso la solicitud del credito.
texts.en: Fabiola R. is a woman who is very dedicated to her home, but this had not stopped her from always contributing on the economic side too.  Two years ago, she started her business selling dishes of food prepared in her home.  In order to watch her children and not neglect their education, she commented that she started selling food on Saturdays with the people who work in construction in her neighborhood and little by little they began to request more days.  Right now she sells on Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays.  On the rest of the days she only does orders, that is to say when they request food ahead of time.  Her husband works in a business that makes blocks, bricks, and construction materials.  The days he does not work he helps his wife to deliver the food.  It is a business that is working for them and they think that it is worth investing in, that is why they have requested the loan.

loans.use: Investment in business.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
Mariela S. vive en la ciudad de Cartagena de Indias con su cónyuge y tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 19 y 23 año; ella es la propietaria de un negocio de variedades que inició hace 14 años,   donde vende artículos para el hogar y gradualmente le ha ido adicionando artefactos de ferretería, su sistema de ventas es a crédito y tambien de contado. Ella está vinculada a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo desde hace más de 9 años y ha recibido 7 créditos, con los cuales ha logrado diversificar la línea de productos pues así como vende paraguas, impermeables, ropa para niños etc., también ha incursionado en la línea de ferretería, muebles y enseres  y con ello ha logrado no solo sostenerse sino también lograr utilidades, que le han permitido reinvertir en su negocio y ofrecer oportunidades de crédito a sus clientes.  Su credikiva es su octavo financiamiento y con el comprará artículos para el hogar , ropa para damas caballeros e infantil,   los cuales planea empacarlos y exhibirlos en  la temporada de Diciembre, de tal manera que se vendan como obsequios navideños, donde la alegría, la unidad familiar son expresadas y se comparten los  famosos aguinaldos  que ayudan con el incremento de las ventas en la microempresa de Mariela.
El mayor sueño de Mariela es   ampliar su negocio y ese es su gran desafío, además de obtener su casa propia a través del programa de construcción de comunidades que lidera la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.
texts.en:
Maria S. lives in the city of Cartagena de Indias with her husband and has two children who are 19 and 23-years-old.  She is the owner of a store with various products that she started 14 years ago where she sells articles for the home and has gradually added hardware items.  Her sales system is by credit and also cash sales.  She has been linked to the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for more than nine years and has received 7 loans with which she has been able to diversify the line of products she offers, such as being able to offer umbrellas, raincoats, children’s clothing, etc.  She has also moved into a line of hardware products, furniture, and fixtures and with this has been able to not only break even, but also to profit and this has enabled her to reinvest in her business and offer credit opportunities to her customers.  Her credikiva (Kiva loan) is her eighth loan and with it she will purchase items for the home and clothing for women, men, and children which she plans to package and display during the December season so that they can be sold as Christmas presents where joy and family unity is expressed and shared in the famous gifts that will help to increase sales in Mariela’s microbusiness.  
Mariela’s greatest dream is to expand her business and this is her great goal, as well as obtaining her own home through the community construction program led by the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.

loans.use: Hardware products and articles for the home

loans.name: Mary Ekua Mansa

texts.en: Mary Ekua Mansa E. is a single parent with one child. She is into the sale of cosmetics, dresses and slippers at Asenadze near Abura. Mary uses the income she makes from her sales to take care of herself and her child. The loan will be used to purchase more of her goods to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to build a house.

loans.use: purchase more of her goods to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Rebecca Efua Ahoba

texts.en: Rebecca Efua Ahoba A. sells fried fish, "Fante kenkey" (fermented maize dough wrappen in banana leaves), groundnut paste, onions and other items at Abura. Rebecca has been through senior high school. She is divorced and has one child. She takes care of her family with the income she makes from her sales. Her loan will be used to buy additional foodstuffs, so she can meet the demand of her customers. She hopes to buy a shop from the new profits.

loans.use: buy additional foodstuffs

loans.name: Gazpar Filemon

texts.es: El Sr.Gazpar  tiene trabajando mas de un año en una compañía Funeraria en el area de ventas y cabranza, el es divorciado con una niña la cual en ningun momento ha dejado desamparada, el siempre esta al pendiente de ella, quedo en buen termino con su pareja y se turna el cuidado de la menor, por lo mismo nunca ha dejado de darle a su casa las mejoras necesarias, para tener un hogar limpio y acojedor para el y su niña. ya que como buen padre todo lo hace pensando en el bienestar de la misma.Es por eso que el Señor Gazpar solicita este credito, para tener una mejor calidad de vida, al construir una barda en la parte trasera de su vivienda, y darle mas seguridad a la misa.
texts.en: Gazpar has been working at a funeral home in the sales division for more than a year. He is divorced and has a little girl who he has never left without shelter. He is always looking out for her. He remains on good terms with his ex-wife and they take turns caring for their daughter, and for this reason he has never stopped making improvements to his home because he wants to have a clean and cozy home for himself and his little girl. As he is a good father, all his thoughts are for her wellbeing. It is for this reason that Gazpar is requesting this loan - to have a better quality of life. He will build a fence at the back of his property so that his daughter will be safer.

loans.use: To finish building a fence in the back part of the property.

loans.name: Magaret Aba Bentsiwah

texts.en:
Magaret Aba Bentsiwah K. prepares doughnuts for sale at Abura. She is married to a plumber and has seven dependents. She has been in this business for some time now. She assists her husband in feeding, clothing and educating her dependents. The loan will help her to expand her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her dependents.

At the time of visit, Magaret had yet to prepare the doughnuts and so is showing us the flour she is going to use.

loans.use: expand her business

loans.name: Amina Adjoa Daama

texts.en: Amina Adjoa Daama K. is married and has six dependents. She has received junior high education. Her husband works with a hospital dispensary. Amina sells second-hand clothing at Asenadze near Abura. She often moves around in the locality to sell her goods. Amina will add the loan to her capital to expand her clothing business. Amina uses her income to assist her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Her profit from the loan will be reinvested back into her business.

loans.use: expand her clothing business

loans.name: Faustina Esi Tweba

texts.en:
Faustina Esi Tweba E. sells soaps and cosmetics at Abura. She is married and has junior high educational background. Faustina has been selling cosmetics and soaps for eight years. She assists her husband to take care of the home. Her loan will be used to buy additional goods, thereby expanding her business. She hopes to reinvest her new profit.

In this photo, a variety of soaps are arranged in the top section. In the lower section are cosmetics.

loans.use: buy additional goods

loans.name: Margine Del Socorro

texts.es:
Margine es madre de dos hijos, casada, y de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de ropa de dama, caballeros, ropa interior, cosméticos y zapatos.
Iniciando este negocio hace varios años, con ayuda económica de su esposo producto de su trabajo como transportista. 
Con ayuda de Afodenic atreves de los financiamiento logro comprar una vitrina para tener más visión para su negocio. Lo que está motivada para lograr crecer en inventario. Con este nuevo préstamo podrá comprar más mercadería en ropa, zapatos, tintes, pinturas, adornos con la venida de navidad.
Como planes es poder formar una tienda con más vitrinas y productos para mejorar las ventas.
texts.en:
Margine is the mother of 2 children, and is a merchant.  She sells men and women's clothing, underwear, cosmetics and shoes.  She started this business a number of years ago with financial assistance provided by her husband from his work as a trucker.

With the help of loans from AFODENIC she was able to buy a glass display case to provide more exposure for her business.  She is now motivated to increase her inventory.  With this new loan she will be able to buy more merchandise in the form of clothing, shoes, hair dyes, makeup, and decorations with the approach of Christmas.  She plans to set up a shop with more glass display cases and products so she can improve her sales.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing, makeup, hair dyes, underwear, and shoes to increase her sales

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: El Sr. Jose Luis D., es una persona sencilla y muy trabajadora , que con esfuerzos ha ido construyendo la casa donde vive, el es viudo y tiene una hijo que vive con el y seguido lo visitan sus familiares, hermanas y padres, es por eso que el ha pensado poder ampliar su casa, para poder recibirlos con comodidad, cuando lo visitan por varios dias, en ocasiones se siente mortificado porque no tiene en donde acostarlos, y piensa que con otro cuarto que agrege a la casa  el se sentira muy a gusto con su familia , por eso ha estado  construyendo poco a poco haciendole mejoras a la casa, porque piensa que asi el tambien podra dejarle una buena casa a su hijo, ya que cuando vivia su esposa, no lo pudo hacer.
texts.en: Jose Luis D. is a simple and very hard-working person who, with his hard work, has been building the house where he lives.  He is a widower and has one son who lives with him and his family frequently visit him, including his sisters and parents.  This is why he has thought about expanding his house: so that he can receive them comfortably when they visit for several days.  Sometimes he feels embarrassed because they don’t have anywhere to sleep and he thinks that with another room added onto the house he would feel much more comfortable with his family.  This is why he has been building, little by little, and making improvements to the house because this way he can also leave a good house for his son, as he was unable to do when his wife was alive.

loans.use: Expand his home

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Gifty Ekua Kwansima

texts.en: Gifty Ekua Kwansima S. sells used clothing at Asenadze near Abura. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a sprayer. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more used clothing for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: buy more used clothing for sale

loans.name: Jemiratu Adjoa Oforiwa

texts.en: Jemiratu Adjoa Oforiwa O. moves from one area to another to sell a variety of soaps. She is married and takes care of three children. She has no educational background. She has been in this soap business for some time now. Jemiratu uses her income to assist her husband in providing for the basic needs of the family. She will add the loan to her initial capital to expand her business. She plans to reinvest her profit.

loans.use: additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Philo Efua Twento

texts.en: Philo Efua Twento A. is a widow taking care of four children. She has not attained any formal education.  Philo smokes fish at Abura for sale. She sees to the well-being of her children with the income she makes from her sales. The loan will be used to purchase more fresh fish to smoke for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Philo hopes to further her childlren’s education.

loans.use: purchase more fresh fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Claire

texts.en: Claire is 31 years old and is married to a telephone company technician. She has two children, aged four and six. In her shop, Claire sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, beans, beauty soaps and electricity. She has spent five years in this business. With this loan, she will buy more rice, sugar and beans to sell. She plans to save most of her profits. She says that her business is successful because she sells products that are in demand from customers. In the future, she would like to make a 60% return on investment.

loans.use: To buy more rice, sugar and beans to sell.

loans.name: Ashito Efua

texts.en: Ashito Efua D. is married and has four children. She is into the sale of charcoal at Asenadze near Abura. Her husband is a farmer. Ashito uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits. She will use the profit gained to build a house.

loans.use: expand her business to increase her profits

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita, de 40 años, es una mujer trabajadora y muy responsable, esta casado con Fernando, de 42 años, ambos tienen 4 hijos, a los que cuida y educa en su casa propia ubicada, en la localidad de Santa Clara. La actividad económica que desempeña Margarita, es la agricultura, hace ya 10 años que se dedica al cuidado de sus terrenos de cultivo, donde siembra papa y arveja en gran cantidad, la que después de cada cosecha lo comercializa en el mercado central de la ciudad de “Tarma”. Pero en campañas agrícolas, viaja constantemente a la capital para comercializar su producción, ahí obtiene mayores ganancias. Ella menciona que le gusta trabajar en la agricultura, y aunque existan perdidas, ella afirma que  “todo depende de la atención que le brindas a los terrenos”. Por ello más adelante quiere comprar sus propios terrenos agrícolas. Es el octavo crédito con MFP y está contenta de formar uno de los bancos comunales, más sólidos de su localidad. Con el crédito que obtendrá, comprará semilla de papa, ya que desea producir 60 sacos de este tuberculo de la variedad “única”, asimismo cosechará dentro de unos meses papa de la variedad “Yungay”, por lo que necesitará abono orgánico.
texts.en: Margarita is 40-years-old and a very hard-working and responsible woman.  She is married to Fernando who is 42-years-old and the two of them have four children who they care for and raise in their own house in the town of Santa Clara.  The main economic activity that Margarita works in has been agriculture.  For the past 10 years she has cared for her cultivated land where she grows potatoes and peas in large quantities.  After each harvest, she sells them in the central market of the city of Tarma.  But during the agricultural seasons she travels constantly to the capital to sell her crop as there she receives greater profits.  She mentioned that she likes to do agricultural work, although there are losses, because, “everything depends on the attention you give to the land.” Because of this, in the future she would like to buy her own agricultural lands.  This is her eighth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and she is happy to be a part of one of the best established communal banks in her area.  With the loan that she will receive, she will buy potato seeds as she would like to produce 60 sacks of the “única” (unique) variety and she will also harvest potatoes of the “Yungay” variety in a few months, this is why she needs organic fertilizer.

loans.use: Purchase of potato seeds and organic fertilizer

loans.name: Urunana Group

texts.en: Jeannette is 23 years old. She is married and has one child, who is nine months old. Her husband is a carpenter. Jeannette is the group leader of the borrowing group called Urunana Group. Urunana means "let us join hands." Jeannette sells a variety of items in her shop, such as salt, sugar, soap and rice. She has had this business for three years. With this loan she will increase her inventory. The profits will be reinvested back into the business. She says that her business is successful because of the quality service she extends to her customers. In the future she would like to import new products.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, soap and rice to sell.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa pertenece al Banco Comunal Nobleza, tiene 35 años, es conviviente y tiene un niño de 10 años. Rosa tiene un bodega en su casa, antes era de su hermana, pero al irse de viaje Rosa se quedo a cargo del negocio, poco a poco ha ido invirtiendo y ha hecho crecer el negocio, ahora le pertenece.
Rosa solicita un préstamo porque con ello abastecerá más su negocio comprará arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite, gaseosas, detergentes jabones, leche, etc.
A Rosa le gusta Finca, porque le da facilidad de crédito y recibe capacitaciones en lo familiar, negocios, en Finca aprendió los valores a ser puntual, responsable y tambien a ahorrar.
El sueño de Rosa es llegar a tener una tienda mayorista y que su hijo sea profesional.
texts.en: Rosa is 35 years old, married with a 10 year old boy and belongs to the Communal Bank, Nobleza.  She has a store at home, which before belonged to her sister, but she left on a trip and Rosa was in charge of the business.  Little by little Rosa began investing and grew the business, which now belongs to her.  Rosa is requesting a loan because with it she will purchase rice, noodles, oil, sugar, soft drinks, detergents, soaps, milk, etc.  Rosa likes FINCA because it gives her credit and training in businesses.  With FINCA she has learned the value of being punctual, responsible, and saving.  Rosa’s dream is to have a wholesale store and for her son to be a professional.

loans.use:
comprará arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite, gaseosas, detergentes jabones, leche, etc
To purchase goods such as rice, sugar, noodles, oil, beverages, detergent, milk, etc...

loans.name: Triny Zoraida

texts.es:
Triny pertenece al Bancomunal Nobleza, tiene 35 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 15, 1 ½ de edad. Triny, se dedica a la venta de carne, empezó muy joven ayudando a su mamá, en la actualidad cuenta con 2 puestos de carne en el Mercado Central de Ayacucho. Solicita el crédito para comprar animales en la ferias para benefícialos y venderlos en sus puestos.
Desde que está en Finca, puede ahorrar, aprendió mucho en las capacitaciones.
Su sueño es que su negocio siga creciendo y educar sus hijos.
texts.en:
Triny belongs to the Nobleza (Nobility or Quality) communal bank.  She is 35 years old and married, and she has two children ages 15 and 1 ½.

Triny sells meat.  She began by helping her mother when she was very young, and she now has two meat stalls in Ayacucho's Central Market.  She is asking for the loan to buy animals at the markets to butcher and sell at her stalls.

Since she has been with Finca, Triny is able to save money, and she learned a great deal in the training sessions.

Her dream is to keep growing her business and to educate her children.

loans.use: Buy animals at the markets

loans.name: Adela

texts.es: Adela, de 37 años, es una mujer humilde y trabajadora, que convive con Jorge, de 43 años; ambos tienen 4 hijos menores de edad, a los que cuida y educa en casa de su madre, ubicada en la zona rural de Huaricolca. Ella es una mujer muy ingeniosa, comienza sus actividades con el cuidado de sus animales menores, entre ellos: cuy, gallina y carneros; los que enseba para posteriormente vender su carne en el mercado central de su ciudad. Pero la actividad principal de Adela; es la agricultura, tiene 12 años dedicándose a ello, ahí siembra en temporadas agrícolas, diversos productos como: papa, olluco, avena (productos agrícolas), los que le genera buena rentabilidad. Con la ganancia que obtiene, que adicionalmente con las ganancias que recibe de la venta de queso, puede mantener a su familia y educar a sus hijos. Pero como ella quiere salir adelante y tiene mucha capacidad para ello, está ahorrando para comprar su propia casa, con ello darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Es el séptimo crédito con MFP, y asegura que en todo este tiempo, siente que su banco comunal contribuyó con mucho éxito en el logro de sus objetivos. Con el crédito que obtendrá, comprará 15 sacos de abono, así como también invertirá en arar la tierra que tiene en su propio terreno, ya que ahí cultivará papa.
texts.en: Adela, who is 37 years old, is a humble and hardworking woman who lives with Jorge who is 43 years old. Together they have 4 young children who live and study in her mother's house located in the rural area of Huaricolca. She is a very ingenious woman who works caring for small animals including guinea pigs, chickens, and rams, which she later sells in the central market of her city. But her main work is in agriculture. She has dedicated 12 years to this work and plants during the agriculture seasons diverse products such as potatoes, olluco (a root vegetable), oats (agricultural products), things that have good profitability. With the earnings she gets, and in addition, the earnings she receives from selling cheese, she is able to provide for her family and educate her children. But, as she wants to progress and have a great capacity for that, she is saving in order to buy her own house. With that she will give a better quality of life to her children. This is her seventh loan with MFP and she is sure of everything this time. She feels that her communal bank will contribute a lot to her success in accomplishing her objectives. With this loan she will buy 15 sacks of fertilizer and she will also invest in the ploughing of the land that she has in her own field as she will grow potatoes there.

loans.use: To buy 15 sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Ana Luisa

texts.es: La señora Ana Luisa N. P. se dedica a la actividad de venta de ceviche en la plaza de armas de su Localidad Subtanjalla de manera informal, Vive con su esposo y sus dos menores hijos. Su esposo trabaja como albañil  por lo que cuentan con un ingreso adicional. La solicitante requiere del crédito para su negocio va a comprar mezas y sillas para que sus clientes tengan comodidad. Se sugiere otorgarle el crédito ya que presenta buenas referencias personales y también cuenta con experiencia acrediticia.
texts.en: Ana Luisa N. P. has a business selling ceviche (raw fish marinated in citrus juices and spiced with chili peppers), on an informal basis, in the Plaza de Armas in her district of Subtanjalla.  She lives with her husband and two young children.  Her husband works as a bricklayer so they have an additional income.  She is requesting this loan for her business to buy tables and chairs so that her customers can be more comfortable.  She has been approved to receive a loan because she has good personal references and good credit experience.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes pertenece al Banco Comunal Agua Viva, tiene 35 años, es casada y tiene un niño de 8 años.
Mercedes es de profesión docente de educación secundaria en el área de sociales trabaja en un Centro Educativo en el distrito de San José de Ticcllas. Tambien vende prendas de vestir y zapatos los días domingos en la feria de Las América distrito de San Juan Bautista, realiza este negocio hace dos años. Solicita un préstamo para la compra de zapatos variados y ropa de la estación.
Le gusta las reuniones de su Bancomunal porque puede ahorrar y las capacitaciones que recibe los hace extensivos entres sus alumnos. Su sueño es que su negocio crezca y formalizar su negocio.
texts.en:
Mercedes belongs to the 'Agua Viva' community bank.  She is 35 years old, married and has an 8 year-old child.

Mercedes is, by profession, a high school social science teacher.  She works in a school in the district of San José de Ticcllas.  She also sells clothes and shoes on a Sunday in the Las Américas market in the district of San Juan Bautista.  She has been in this business for two years.  She is requesting a loan so that she can buy shoes and seasonal clothes.

She likes the meetings of her community bank because she can save and she extends the training that she receives to her pupils.  Her dream is for her business to grow and to make her business official.

loans.use: To buy shoes and seasonal clothes

loans.name: Tiburciana

texts.es:
Tiburcina pertenece al Banco Comunal Agua Viva, tiene 52 años, es casada y tiene 7 hijos, su último hijo tiene 7 años. Tiburcina se dedica a la venta de anticuchos de carne, pollo y tripitas lo hace en forma ambulatoria en el Puente del Ejercito, con su negocio se ayuda en la manutención de su familia pues su esposo no tiene trabajo permanente, el crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de costales de papa, aceite, vinagre y demás condimentos para la preparación de los anticuchos.
Le gusta Finca porque puede acceder al crédito, pues en otras instituciones no le darían, porque es ambulante, en las capacitaciones aprendió ahorrar, trabajar y quererse.
Su sueño es poder alquilar un local para poder vender sus anticuchos y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Tiburcina belongs to the Agua Viva community bank. She is 52 years old, is married, and has 7 children. Her youngest son is 7 years old. Tiburcina sells anticuchos (grilled meat on a stick) of beef, chicken, and tripe. She does this as a walking vendor on the Puente del Ejercito (Army Bridge). Her business helps support her family, since her husband doesn't have permanent work. The loan that she is applying for will be invested in the purchase of sacks of potatoes, oil, vinegar, and other ingredients for the preparation of the anticicuchos.

She likes Finca because she can have access to credit, since in other institutions they would not give it to her because she is a walking vendor. In the training she has learned to save, to work, and to respect herself.

He dreams are to be able to rent a location where she could sell her anticuchos and for her children to have careers.

loans.use: Buy sacks of potatoes, oil, and vinegar.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa pertenece al Banco Comunal Amaquella, tiene 34 años, es conviviente desde hace 17 años, tiene un hijo de 16 años. Elsa se dedica la venta de productos cosméticos de Avon, Esika y Unique. Tiene un carro el cual lo alquila a S/.30.00 el día esto lo realiza desde hace 5 años y le ayuda en la manutención de su familia, el préstamo que solicita es para aumentar su capital, pues como se dedica a la venta de estos productos por catalogo sus clientes a veces le demoran en el pago y como ella cuenta con el capital paga de sus productos evitando así la mora, hay meses que vende hasta S/.1,000.00 y tiene una ganancia de hasta el 25%.
Su seño es adquirir otro carro para que trabaje su pareja y tener otra fuente de ingreso, lo que le gusta de las reuniones de su Bancomunal es que puede ahorrar y que su dinero está seguro, hay confianza, asimismo aprende mucho en la capacitaciones que recibe de su promotora.
texts.en:
Elsa belongs to the communal bank Amaquella. She is 34 years old and has had a partner for the past 17 years. She has a 16 year old son. Elsa works selling Avon, Esika and Unique cosmetic products. She has a car which she rents at S/.30.00 per day. She has done this for the past 5 years and it helps her maintain her family. The loan she is requesting is to increase her capital because while she sells these products from a catalogue, sometimes her clients delay in paying her and she relies on the capital from her products to avoid a default. There are months where she sells from S/.1,000.00 and has an earning of 25%. 
Her dream is to rent another car so her partner can work and allow them to have another source of income. What she likes about the meetings of her communal bank is that she can save and that her money is secure and she has confidence in it. She also learns a lot in the training that she receives from her promoter.

loans.use: To buy various cosmetics.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana pertenece al Banco Comunal Amaquella, tiene 50 años y 6 hijos.
Juana se dedica la venta de materiales de construcción como agregados arena fina, hormigón, arena de asentar, piedra chancada, ladrillos, tubos, cemento ella aprendió de ésta actividad desde muy joven pues sus padres se dedicaban a éste negocio.
Juana no almacena los agregados, sólo atiende pedidos mediante llamadas telefónicas y en esto le ayuda su esposo, tienen un volquete de 5 cubos el acarrea los agregados y reparte los pedidos a domicilio. El sueño de ambos es poder adquirir un volquete de 10 metros cúbicos, en cuanto a las dificultades si tuvo en una oportunidad solicito un crédito a su nombre para otra persona  y ésta no pago, pero ahora ya aprendió la lección y sigue trabajando con mucho animo, le gusta las reuniones de su bancomunal porque puede ahorrar y aprende mucho de las capacitaciones que imparte su promotora. Solicita el crédito para poder tener capital comprar los agregados.
texts.en:
Juana belongs to the Amaquella Communal Bank. She is 50 years old and has 6 children.

Juana is engaged in the sale of construction materials such as aggregate, fine sand, concrete, mortar, gravel, bricks, pipes, and cement. She learned this business at a young age since her parents were involved in it.

Juana does not stockpile aggregate. She responds to orders made over the telephone. Her husband helps with this. They have a 5 cubic meter dump trick. He hauls the aggregate, and she gives out the orders from their home.

They both dream of being able to acquire a 10 cubic meter dump truck. Among the difficulties she has had is applying for a loan in her own name for another person who didn’t pay. She learned her lesson, however, and continues working with a lot of spirit. She likes the meetings of her communal bank because she can save and learn a from the training given by her backers. She is applying for the loan in order to be able to have capital for purchasing aggregate.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials.

loans.name: Ulises

texts.es: Ulises, de 32 años, un hombre bueno y alegre; está casado con Julia, de 34 años, ambos tienen dos hijos, Hildebrant, de 10 y Anali, de 2 meses de edad, con los cuales vive en una casa alquila, ubicada en la localidad de Huaricolca. El trabajo primordial de él, se centra en el arado diario de diferentes terrenos de cultivo, cuya herramienta importante es un toro que tiene. Además son muy pocos los que ofrece este tipo de trabajo, por ello no tiene mucha competencia, generándole así muchas ganancias. Pero la actividad que más le gusta a Ulises, es la agricultura, ya tiene 5 años dedicándose a ello, sus principales productos se centran en la siembra de papa y arveja; las que cuida con mucha dedicación y ahínco. En cada campaña agrícola, el apoyo de su banco comunal es muy importante, ya que cada día tiene una producción de calidad. Por ello más adelante desea sembrar en mayores cantidades, para abastecer la demanda que genera sus productos. Es el tercer crédito con MFP y asegura que cada cosecha, gracias a su banco comunal, le genera mayores ganancias. Con el crédito que obtendrá, comprará 8 sacos de abono que esparcirá en sus cultivos de papa, que muy pronto comenzará a sembrar.
texts.en: Ulises, who is 32 years old, is a good and happy man. He is marred to Julia, who is 34 years old. Together they have two sons, Hildebrant, who is 10 years and Anali, who is 2 months old. They live together in a rented house located in Huaricolca. His primary job is focused on the daily plowing of different fields. His important tool is a bull that he owns. There are very few people who offer this work, so he doesn't have a lot of competition and generates a lot of income. But the activity that Ulises enjoys the most is agriculture. He already has 5 years of experience with it and his primary products are potatoes and peas, which he cares for with a lot of dedication and determination. For every season, the help from his communal bank is very important so that every day he has a quality production.
