In the future he wants to plant in greater quantities to satisfy the demand that his products generate. This is his third loan with MFP and he is sure that every harvest, thanks to his communal bank, he will generate more income. With this loan he will buy 8 sacks of fertilizer which he will spread on the potato plants that he will plant very soon.

loans.use: To buy 8 sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
Marleny es socia del bancomunal Prosperidad, tiene 24 años, Marleny tiene un puesto de venta de artesanía (chompas, Tejidos, Cerámicas en arcilla y piedra de Huamanga )este negocio es propio y lo viene realizando  con la ayuda de su mamá hace más de 10 años. 
El préstamo que solicita lo va ha invertir en la compra de artesanías como tejidos, hilos de ovino procesados y cerámicas de arcilla.
El sueño de Marleny es poder tener un local propio por el centro de la ciudad para poder seguir vendiendo las artesanía que ella ofrece. Marleny le gustan las capacitaciones que ofrece su promotora en las reuniones de su bancomunal, ya que de ello aprende mucho.
texts.en:
Marleny is 24 years old, and a member of the Prosperidad (Prosperity) communal bank.  She has a stand where she sells crafts items (sweaters, cloth, ceramics made from clay and Huamanga stone [white alabaster]).  This is her own business, and she has run it for more than 10 years, with her mother’s help.
She plans to invest the requested loan to buy crafts items, such as cloth, sheep’s wool yarn, and ceramics made of clay.
Marleny’s dream is to have her own site in the heart of the city, in order to continue to sell the crafts she offers.  Marleny likes the training provided by her sponsor in her communal bank’s meetings, since she learns a lot.

loans.use: to buy craft items such as cloth, yarn from sheep's wool

loans.name: Reina Teresa

texts.es:
Reyna  es una mujer comerciante, su negocio es la venta de carne, en donde lleva cinco años en el comercio, iniciando con poco dinero que su esposo dio, de su trabajo como mecánico.
Atreves de los préstamos en Afodenic logro comprar más cantidad de carne. Y ha logrado la mejora de su casa, ya que hizo la pared de enfrente de concreto y solo falta la parte de atrás que la cierre de pared lo que está contenta por lograr una mejor vivienda.
Con este préstamo comprara materiales de construcción como: doscientos cuarenta bloques, arena, treinta bolsas de cemento y hierro para comenzar la construcción en la parte de atrás de su casa, que esta forrada con zinc. Y que mejorara.
texts.en:
Reyna is a merchant woman.  Her business sells meat and she has spent 5 years in commerce.  Reyna began with a little money that her husband gave her, earned from his work as a mechanic.

By means of loans with Afodenic she bought larger quantities of meat.  And she has been able to make improvements on her house, constructing the front wall with concrete.  Now, she only lacks the back wall to enclose the house, then she will be content with her improved home.

With this loan she will buy construction materials, including 240 cement blocks, sand, 30 sacks of cement, and iron to commence constructing the back wall of her house, currently covered only with zinc.  That will be a big improvement.

loans.use: BUYING CONSTRUCTION MATERIALS (BLOCKS, CEMENT, SAND, AND IRON) TO BUILD A BACK WALL FOR HER HOUSE, FOR GREATER SECURITY

loans.name: Serafina

texts.es:
Serafina, es socia del Banco Comunal Prosperidad, tiene 65 años, es viuda desD. hace 16 años, es madre D. 7 hijos, ella se dedica la venta D. comida en el Mercado Santa Clara donD. ofrece desayuno y almuerzo, este negocio lo biene realizando desD. hace 40 años, actualmente su hija le esta ayudando en la atención (madre soltera).
Serafina solicita un préstamo para invertir en la compra D. Arroz, azúcar, aceite , verduras ,carne, etc.
El sueño D. Serafina es poder construir el segundo piso D. su casa, también sueña con abrir una chicharroneria en su mismo local, a Serafina le gusta mucho la metodología D. FINCA Perú por ello es socia mas D. 15 años.
texts.en:
Serafina is a member of the Prosperidad (Prosperity) Communal Bank.  She is 65 years old, a widow for the last 16 years, and mother of 7 children.  She sells food in the Santa Clara Market, offering breakfast and lunch.  She has been engaged in this business for 40 years.  At present, her daughter (a single mother) helps her with serving customers.
Serafina requests a loan to purchase rice, sugar, oil, produce, meat, etc.
Serafina’s dream is to build a second floor to her house.  She also thinks about opening a stand to sell cracklings in the same site.  Serafina is very pleased with FINCA Peru’s methodology, and for this reason has been a member for over 15 years.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, produce, meat, etc.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es: Rosalía, es una mujer luchadora D. 55 años. Hace 19 años que enviudo. Ella tiene 7 hijos, pero ahora solo vive con su hija Karina, quien es madre soltera y le da mucho apoyo, juntas viven en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad D. Huaricolca. En sus ojos demuestra el orgullo que tiene por su última hija; Mily, D. 24 años, que terminó su carrera D. enfermería. A pesar D. sus limitaciones pudo pagar los estudios universitarios D. sus hijos; ya que su dedicación por la siembra D. papa, olluco, cebada y avena (productos agrícolas), le proporcionaron buenas utilidades. En la actualidad su cosecha son muy cotizadas en el mercado central D. la ciudad y, como mujer luchadora, en campañas agrícolas, viaja a las ciudades D. Lima y Chanchamayo a ofrecer tubérculos al por mayor. Pero consiente que las campañas agrícolas no duran todo el año, está mujer luchadora, compra verduras, para vender en el mercado D. la ciudad D. Mazamari. En adelante está planeando ampliar su granja D. animales, como: cuyes, vacas y carneros. Es el décimo crédito con MFP y en todo este tiempo es reconocida en su banco comunal, como una persona responsable; por ello ocupa un cargo importante en su grupo D. trabajo. Con el crédito que obtendrá, comprará 25 sacos D. abono, ya que en este mes comenzará a sembrar.
texts.en: Rosalía is a 55 year-old woman who is a real fighter.  She has been widowed for 19 years.  She has 7 children but now only lives with her daughter Karina who is a single mother and gives her a lot of support.  They live together in their own home in the town of Huaricolca.  In her eyes she shows the priD. that she feels for her youngest daughter Mily who is 24 years old and has finished her nursing studies at university.  In spite of her limitations, she was able to pay for her children's university studies since her dedication to her work of sowing potato, 'olluco' (a native root crop), barley and oats (agricultural products), provided her with good profits.  Currently her harvests are in very high demand in the town's central market and, as the fighter she is, during the growing seasons she travels to the cities of Lima and Chanchamayo to offer her tuber crops wholesale.  However, since the growing seasons don't last all year, this hard-working woman buys vegetables to sell in the market in the city of Mazamari.  In the future, she is planning to expand her farm with animals such as guinea pigs, cows and rams.  This is her tenth loan with MFP and during all this time she has been recognized as a responsible person.  For this reason she holds an important position in her work group.  With this loan she will buy 25 sacks of fertilizer since she will begin to sow her crops this month.

loans.use: To buy 25 sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Adelia

texts.es: Adelia, de 43 años, es una mujer con muchas ambiciones, hace 20 años que convive con Cancio, de 47 años, ambos tienen 6 hijos, pero solo viven con 5 de ellos; en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Huaricolca. Ver a sus hijos profesionales y encaminarlos en la vida, es su meta. Por ello, hace ya 20 años que trabaja con ahínco en la siembra de papa, arveja y avena; que gracias a los constantes cuidados; le genera buenas ganancias. Pero consciente, que en temporadas donde hay  escasez de agua, no se puede sembrar; ella aprovecha para vender la leche que produce su 2 vacas de la raza “mantona”; con ello, asegura la estabilidad económica de su familia. Y como buena madre, siempre vela por la alimentación de sus hijos. Ella también cría animales menores; como cuyes, carneros, que enseba para utilizar la carne, para su alimentación, pero viendo su buena crianza, está planeando comercializarlos. Es el primer crédito con MFP, y asegura de la responsabilidad de su banco comunal, augura que tendrá muchos éxitos. Con el crédito que obtendrá, comprará abono para sus sembríos de papa, que en estos días, comenzará a sembrar.
texts.en: Adelia is 43 years old, and a woman with ambition.  She has lived with Cancio (47 years old) for 20 years, and they have 6 children.  They live with 5 of them in their own home located in Huaricolca.  Her goal is for her children to have a profession and be well set up for life.  For this reason she has been enthusiastic in her work, planting potatoes, peas, and oats.  Because of the way she constantly cares for her crops, this generates solid earnings.  Because there is a water shortage at times, she cannot plant, and she turns to selling the milk produced by her two "mantona" cows, thereby assuring her family’s financial wellbeing.  Good mother that she is, she always sees that her children are properly fed.  She also raises small animals, such as guinea pigs, sheep, which she fattens for their meat, for their feeding, but if they turn out well, she plans to market them.  This is her first loan with MFP, and confident in her communal bank’s reliability, she predicts that she will be very successful.  With the loan provided, she will buy fertilizer for her potato fields, where she will begin sowing very soon.

loans.use: Comprar abono

loans.name: Mujeres Con Decisión (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mujeres con Decisión está formado por 12 socias quienes con su trabajo diario buscan el éxito personal y también el de su familia, nuestras socias laboran en diferentes oficios y están muy orgullosas de ello. Viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida por sus bellos paisajes, su clima frió, su gente que mantienen su cultura y tradiciones y su gran variedad en la gastronomía.

La Señora Ruth Arévalo vive en el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, se encuentra en la banca comunal hace tres años y en este tiempo ha llegado a tener una linda amistad con todas las socias de la banca. Nuestra socia es comerciante hace 18 años, se dedica a la venta de bisutería, también vende cosméticos de la marca de Avon, Esica y Yanbal, ropa por catalogo, sus productos los vende recorriendo la ciudad, a sus amigas y conocidas. Doña Ruth tiene 30 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 14 y 6 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en el colegio y su segundo hijo en la escuela. Su esposo labora en una vulcanizadora y los fines de semana alquila equipos de sonido para todo tipo de eventos. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando. Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en productos para su negocio como ropa, cosméticos y bisutería. Su meta es llegar a tener su casa propia.

La Señora Ruth S. vive por el sector del Cebollar en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 36 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 15, 12 y 6 años de edad, sus dos primeras hijas   estudian en el colegio y su ultimo hijo en la escuela. Su esposo es de profesión mecánico automotriz.  No tienen casa propia por lo que vive en una casa prestada que es de un familiar. Nuestra socia se dedica a realizar artesanías, elabora ramos de flores para cualquier ocasión especial, labora hace 6 años de lunes a sábados, el negocio no es de su propiedad pero hay en ocasiones en donde también invierte su dinero para la compra de flores como en esta ocasión, su crédito lo va a invertir comprando flores. Su meta es  llegar a tener su casa propia. 

NOTA: La foto pequeña adjunta es de la Señora Jenny Susana Guapasaca C..
texts.en:
The communal bank "Mujeres con Decisión" ["Women with Decision"] is made up of 12 partners. With their daily work, they look for personal success and the success of their families. Our members work in different trades and are very proud of what they do. They live in different parts of the city of Cuenca. This city is known for its beautiful landscape, its cold climate, its people that maintain its culture and traditions, and its great variety of cooking styles. 

Mrs. Ruth Arévalo lives in the center of the city of Cuenca. She has been in the communal group for three years. At this time, she has a beautiful friendship with all the members of the group. This member has been a merchant for 18 years. She sells costume jewelry, as well as Avon, Esica, and Yanbal cosmetics, and catalog clothing. She sells her products throughout the city to her friends and acquaintances. Doña Ruth is 30 years old, is married, and has 2 children that are 14 and 6 years old. Her first son studies in high school, and the second studies in elementary school. Her husband works in a tire repair shop, and on the weekends he rents sound equipment for all kinds of events. She does not have her own house, so she rents one. She will use her new loan to invest in products for her business such as clothing, cosmetics and costume jewelry. Her goal is to have her own house. 

Mrs. Ruth S. lives in the sector "el Cebollar" ["The onion patch"] in the city of Cenca. She is 36 years old, is married, and has three children. They are 15, 12, and 6 years old. Her first two daughters study in high school, and her son studies in elementary school. Her husband is an automobile mechanic. They do not have their own house, so she lives in a family's rented house. This member makes crafts and arranges bouquets of flowers for all sorts of special occasions. She has been working for six years from Monday through Saturday. The business is not her own, but there are occasions, such as this one, in which she invests her own money to buy flowers. She is going to use her loan to buy flowers. Her goal is to have her own house. 

Note: The small attached photo is of Mrs. Jenny Susana Guapasaca C..

loans.use: To buy clothing, costume jewelry, cosmetics, and flowers.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es: Sabina, de 51 años, es una mujer optimista, ella es madre soltera de 2 hijos; Nataly, de 20 y Ángel, de 30, con los que vive en su casa propia ubicada en la zona rural de Huaricolca. Todos los días, desde las primeras horas, sale a pastar a los animales que comercializa; ya que es su principal actividad comercial. Ella posee, 3 toros, 5 vacas, varias cabezas de carnero, y 3 novillos pequeños que gracias a los cuidados que le brinda a diario podrán crecer fuertes y saludables. Cuando sus animales están aptos para ser comercializados, los ofrece en el camal de su localidad. Sin embargo Sabina cuenta, que en temporadas de invierno, cuando las vacas poseen más leche, ella aprovecha y elabora queso, el cual comercializa, juntamente a la leche sobrante. En adelante desea apoyar a su hija Nataly en la especialización de su oficio de cosmetóloga. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP, y en todo este tiempo, que integra su banco comunal, se siente satisfecha de apoyar en el surgimiento de sus socias. Con el crédito que obtendrá, lo invertirá en la compra de una vaca lechera, que proporciona 10 litros de leche diarios; que le costará 3 mil nuevos soles.
texts.en: Sabina is 51 years old.  She is an optimistic woman and a single mother of 2 children; Nataly who is 20 and Ángel who is 30.  She lives with her children in her own home in the rural area of Huaricolca.  Every day from very early in the morning, she goes out to graze the animals which she sells as this is her main business activity.  She has 3 bulls, 5 cows, several head of rams and 3 young bulls which, thanks to the care which she provides them with every day, will grow up strong and healthy.  When her animals are ready to be sold, she offers them to her local slaughterhouse.  However, Sabina says that in winter seasons, when the cows have most milk, she takes advantage and makes cheese which she sells together with the left-over milk.  In the future, she would like to support her daughter Nataly in pursuing further studies in her chosen profession as a cosmetologist.  This is the fourth loan which she has had from MFP and during this time, in which she has been a member of her community bank, she feels happy to have helped support her fellow members.  With this loan she will invest in the purchase of a dairy cow which will provide her with 10 liters of milk a day and which will cost her 3,000 nuevos soles.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Nuvia  Monserrate

texts.es:
Amigas Por Siempre. Este lugar es conocido por su gran vegetación pero sobre todo por sus hermosos balnearios de agua dulce que son muy visitados por turistas locales y de otras En la parroquia Ayacucho del  cantón Santa Ana se reúnen cada quince días el Banco Comunal ciudades.

La señora Nuvia tiene 39 años, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene 5 hijos, dos mayores de edad y tres menores que están en colegio. Su marido trabaja en España desde hace varios años. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el principio y le gusta por las charlas y asesoramiento que brindan los promotores en las reuniones.

Ella es una ama de casa que para sacar a su familia adelante a tenido que trabajar muy duro. Durante el día se encarga del cuidado de sus animalitos ya que tiene una pequeña granja donde cría pollos los mismos que los tiene por tres meses y luego los vende.  En las noches tiene un lugar donde prepara y vende hot dog, hamburguesas, jugos y batidos de fruta.
 
Este crédito lo quiere emplear para comprar una carreta para vender sus productos de una forma mas cómoda ya que donde vende es muy incomodo. Su sueño es tener un gran negocio.
texts.en:
Amigas Por Siempre (Friends for Life).  This place is known for its vegetation but above all for its beautiful, fresh water, seaside resorts which receive a lot of tourists from nearby and further away.  In the town of Ayacucho, in Santa Ana canton, members of the 'Ciudades' (Cities) community bank meet every fortnight.

Nuvia is 39 years old.  She is married and has 5 children from her marriage; 2 who are now grown up and 3 who are still in school.  Her husband has worked in Spain for several years.  Nuvia has been a member of her community bank from the beginning and she enjoys it because of the talks and the advisory services which they provide in the meetings.

Nuvia is a housewife who, in order to get her family ahead in life, has had to work very hard.  During the day she takes care of her animals since she has a small farm where she raises chickens.  She keeps them for three months and then sells them.  In the evenings she has a place where she prepares and sells hot dogs, hamburgers, juice and fruit smoothies.

Nuvia will use this loan to buy a cart from which she can sell her products more comfortably since where she sells now is very uncomfortable.  Her dream is to have a big business.

loans.use: To buy a food cart

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es: Adelaida, de 40 años, es una mujer fuerte y trabajadora, convive con Luis, de 42 años, ambos tienen 4 hijos menores, a los que cuida y educa en una casa alquilada en la comunidad de Huaricolca. Con la seguridad que le caracteriza, ella afirma, que lo importante en la agricultura, es comercializar en diferentes lugares. Por ello sus planes son, adquirir un camión con el que pueda trasladar su producción. Ya que su experiencia de 18 años y su buena cosecha de papa, en sus diferentes variedades, como: “tomasa” (que vende mayormente como semillas), “Color” (el cual comercializa en la ciudad de Oroya, donde tiene buenos clientes); le brindan buenos ingresos y utilidades. Pero la ganadería, es otra de las actividades de Adelaida, ella tiene varias cabezas de carnero, el cual enseba y comercializa en el mercado central de su ciudad. Es el séptimo crédito con MFP y está muy contenta de poder tener capital, el cual le permite ahorrar en más cantidad. Por ello agradece a su banco comunal, ya que le abrió las puertas al desarrollo. Con el crédito que obtendrá, comprará 23 sacos de abono, el cual en estos días sembrará, y con el dinero restante comprará semillas de habas.
texts.en:
40 year-old Adelaida is a strong and hard-working woman.  She lives with Luis who is 42 years old and they have 4 young children who she is bringing up and educating in a rented house in the community of Huaricolca.  With her characteristic confidence she states that the important thing in agriculture is to sell in different places.  For this reason, her future plan is to acquire a truck which she can use to transport her produce.

Since she has 18 years of experience and good harvests of different varieties of potato such as “tomasa” (which she sells mainly as seeds) and “color” (which she sells in the city of Oroya, where she has good customers), she makes a good income and good profits. Livestock farming is another of Adelaida's business activities.  She has several head of rams which she fattens and sells in her town's central market.  This is her seventh loan from MFP and she is very happy to be able to have access to capital which allows her to save more.  For this reason she is grateful to her community bank since it opened to doors to development for her.  She plans to use this loan to buy 23 sacks of fertilizer which she will use shortly and with the remaining money she will buy bean seeds.

loans.use: To buy 23 sacks of fertilizer and some bean seeds

loans.name: Elisa Aurora

texts.es:
En la parroquia Ayacucho del  cantón Santa Ana se reúnen cada quince días el Banco Comunal Amigas Por Siempre. Este lugar es conocido por su gran vegetación pero sobre todo por sus hermosos balnearios de agua dulce que son muy visitados por turistas locales y de otras ciudades.

La señora Elisa tiene 50 años de edad, está casada pero  aunque  ya lleva muchos años casada no ha podido tener hijos lo cual le causa mucha  tristeza. Su esposo se dedica a la albañilería y a la agricultura. Lleva en el Banco Comunal 8 ciclos y está muy contenta por los beneficios que ha recibido en este tiempo.

Se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y le ayuda a su marido en los trabajos del campo, siembran maíz, yuca, plátano y verduras, aprovechan que el río pasa por la finca de ellos y esto les permite realizar sembríos en toda época del año, trabajan todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 13h00, las verduras y productos que están listos para la venta los entregan a comerciantes en Santa Ana.

Este nuevo crédito que recibe lo va a emplear en comprar insumos agrícolas en especial urea (abono) para tener una mejor producción. Su sueño es algún día tener un hijo o adoptar uno para realizarse como mujer.
texts.en:
In the Ayacucho district, within the county of Santa Ana, the Amigas por Siempre (“Friends Forever”) cooperative bank meets every fifteen days.  This area is known for its grand vegetation, but most of all, for beautiful fresh water spas that are frequented by local and foreign tourists.

Elisa is 50 years old and married.  Even though she has been married for many years, she has not been able to have children, a fact that makes her very sad.  Her husband works in construction and in farming.  She has been with the cooperative bank for 8 cycles, and is very happy with the benefits she has received over this period of time.

She dedicates herself to household tasks, and also helps her husband with the farm work.  They plant corn, yucca, bananas and vegetables, and take advantage of the fact that the river flows through their farmland.  This allows them to plant crops in every season, and they work weekdays from 6 am until 1 pm.  They deliver the vegetables and products that are ready to the merchants in Santa Ana.

This new loan that she receives will be used to buy agricultural supplies, especially fertilizers to increase their production.  Her dream is to one day have a child, or adopt one, in order to fulfill herself as a woman.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and other agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.es: Marcelo, de 65 años, él vive solo, la única compañía que tiene son sus inquilinos que viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la zona rural de Huaricolca. Hace ya algunos años que se jubiló, pero a pesar de ello afirma “que el sentido de su vida es el campo y poder producirlo”. Ya tiene 8 años dedicándose a la agricultura, tiempo suficiente, para trabajarla y comercializarla a un buen precio. Sus cultivos de papa y avena, son muy productivos y en campañas agrícolas suele viajar a la ciudad de Tarma, donde gracias a su buen juicio en las ventas, puede terminar en menor tiempo todos sus sacos de papa. Pero él siente, que ya no tienen la fuerza de antes; por ello esta ahorrando un monto considerable de dinero, con el que comprará una casa en la ciudad y de esa manera pueda cuidar su salud. Paralelamente está pensando incursionar en el negocio de compra y venta de tubérculos, donde será comerciante mayorista. Es el décimo crédito con MFP, y como fiscal de su banco comunal, está muy contento de poder ayudar a sus integrantes a salir adelante. Con el crédito que obtendrá, comprará abono orgánico, para su próxima siembra de papa.
texts.en:
65-year old Marcelo lives alone apart from the tenants who share his house which is located in the rural area of Huaricolca. In spite of retiring a few years ago, Marcelo believes he was meant to be work the land and make it productive. He’s already spent eight years farming, enough time to plant some crops and sell the produce at good prices. His fields of potatoes and oats are very productive, and at harvest time he usually travels to the town of Tarma where, because of his sound business sense, he is able to sell his bags of potatoes in a short time.

However, Marcelo feels that he doesn’t have the strength he used to have. So he is saving a considerable amount of money to buy a house in the town and thus take care of his health. He is also thinking of starting a wholesale business buying and selling potatoes and other tubers.

This is his tenth loan with Kiva partner MFP. As the advisor to his community bank, Marcelo is very happy to be able to help his fellow members make progress. With the loan he plans to buy organic fertilizer for his next potato crop.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Viviana Narcisa

texts.es:
En la parroquia Ayacucho del  cantón Santa Ana se reúnen cada quince días el Banco Comunal Amigas Por Siempre. Este lugar es conocido por su gran vegetación pero sobre todo por sus hermosos balnearios de agua dulce que son muy visitados por turistas locales y de otras ciudades.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Viviana, ella tiene 22 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y fruto de esta linda relación tiene una hija de tres años de edad que es su más preciado tesoro. Su esposo se dedica al comercio.

Ella además de ser una muy buena madre y ama de casa se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, además tiene varios clientes que le realizan pedidos ya que la ropa que ella lleva para sus clientes es seleccionada. Trabaja los sábados y domingos  desde las 8h30 hasta las 15h00  aprovecha que su hija la deja en casa de su mamá eso días, deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente.

Este crédito es para comprar más mercadería ya que esta temporada que se avecina es muy buena, lo que más va a comprar es ropa de mujer y de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el principio,  es la fiscal de pagos del Banco y lo hace con mucho agrado. Su sueño es tener algún día su propio almacén.
texts.en:
In the Ayacucho district, within the county of Santa Ana, the Amigas por Siempre (“Friends Forever”) cooperative bank meets every fifteen days.  This area is known for its grand vegetation, but most of all, for beautiful fresh water spas that are frequented by local and foreign tourists.

This is where we find Viviana, who is 22 years old and married.  The result of this beautiful relationship is a three-year-old daughter, who is her most precious treasure.  Her husband is a merchant.

In addition to being a wonderful mother and homemaker, she dedicates herself to commerce.  She sells all types of clothing door-to-door, and also has several customers that place orders since the clothing she carries is select.  She works Saturdays and Sundays from 8:30 am to 4:00 pm, taking advantage of the fact that her mother can care for her daughter on those days.  She delivers on credit, and charges once per week.

This loan is for the purchase of more merchandise, as the coming holiday season is a good one for sales.  She wants to purchase mostly women and children’s clothing.  She has been a member of the cooperative bank since its inception and is the overseer of payments, which she does gladly.  Her dream is to one day have her own store.

loans.use: To purchase clothing, especially women and children's.

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
En la parroquia Ayacucho del  cantón Santa Ana se reúnen cada quince días el Banco Comunal Amigas Por Siempre. Este lugar es conocido por su gran vegetación pero sobre todo por sus hermosos balnearios de agua dulce que son muy visitados por turistas locales y de otras ciudades.

La señora Ana es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal, se desempeña como tesorera del Banco y le gusta por los beneficios que brinda la Fundación Espoir. Tiene 35 años de edad, es madre soltera de tres hijos de 19 – 14 y 9 años, los menores estudian en colegio y escuela. Ella estudia Educación Básica  en la Universidad a distancia de la extensión de la Universidad de Manta.

Ante la necesidad de obtener ingresos para solventar en parte los gastos de su familia se dedico a la venta de productos de Avon (productos de belleza, perfumería y accesorios de damas) trabaja todos los días desde las 8am hasta las 14h00, deja a crédito y cobra todos los fines de semana.

Este crédito es para comprar más de sus productos ya que tiene pedidos, va a  comprar productos de oferta. Sus  sueños son sacar su titulo de  maestra y  poder algún día ejercer su profesión.
texts.en:
In the Ayacucho district, within the county of Santa Ana, the Amigas por Siempre (“Friends Forever”) cooperative bank meets every fifteen days.  This area is known for its grand vegetation, but most of all, for beautiful fresh water spas that are frequented by local and foreign tourists.

Ana is a founding member of the cooperative bank, functioning as its Treasurer, and she appreciates the benefits Fundación Espoir provides.  She is 35 years old, and the single mother of three children ages 19, 14, and 9; the youngest are in school.  She studied Education at an extension of the University of Manta.

Facing the need to earn income to meet the household’s expenses, she began selling Avon products (beauty products, perfumes, and women’s accessories), working every day from 8 am until 4 pm.  She delivers on credit and collects every weekend.

This loan is for the purchase of more products, because she has many orders, and to buy products on sale.  Her dream is to obtain her teaching degree and one day carry out her profession.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products, perfumes, and women's accessories.

loans.name: El Eden Group

texts.es: Un grupo con mucho en común que es el entusiasmo por surgir en los negocios propios, así es el Edén una alcancía comunal con características D. éxito. Conformado por 9 socias hace más D. dos años y ocho meses. Cada integrante se dedica a diversos comercios, tal es así el caso D. la señora Juana S. integrante D. dicha alcancía, la señora Juana S. con 38 años D. edad madre D. dos hijos que aun dependen D. ella, vio la forma D. surgir económicamente con la venta D. comida por las mañanas y por las tarD. se dedica a la venta D. postres como son mazamorra Morada, Arroz con leche, entre otros. Lleva más D. 4 años dedicándose con esmero a este oficio el cual le ha dado muchas satisfacciones  para ella y su familia. Con el reciente préstamo lo invertirá en comprar artículos para la realización D. sus postres y algunos artículos para la campaña naviD.ña ya que se acerca  pronto. Como la señora  Juana S. el resto D. los integrantes tiene una historia en particular que contar, pero todas coinciden en el esmero y el desempeño que realizan cada día por el bienestar D. sus familias.
texts.en:
The members of the Edén community bank have much in common, especially the enthusiasm to make a success of their businesses. The 9-member group started more than two and a half years ago and run a variety of businesses.

38-year old Sra. Juana S. is one of the members and has two children still living at home. For the last four years she has maD. a living by selling meals in the mornings and desserts, such as mazamorra morada and rice pudding, in the afternoons. The work has brought her and her family many benefits. With the current loan she will buy ingredients for the desserts and other items for the upcoming Christmas season.

The other members have their own stories to relate, but all put the same care and effort into their daily lives to proviD. for their families.

loans.use: to buy dessert ingredients

loans.name: Jobertiz Leonidas

texts.es:
En la parroquia Ayacucho del  cantón Santa Ana se reúnen cada quince días el Banco Comunal Amigas Por Siempre. Este lugar es conocido por su gran vegetación pero sobre todo por sus hermosos balnearios de agua dulce que son muy visitados por turistas locales y de otras ciudades.

Para el señor Jobertiz este es su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y está muy contento porque los créditos le han ayudado mucho en su negocio y por lo fácil que es conseguir los créditos. El tiene 36 años de edad, está casado y tiene tres niñas de 12- 10 y 8 años las mismas que estudian en escuela y la mayor en primer año de colegio. Su esposa es ama de casa.

Tiene una granja donde cría pollos. Trabaja todos los días en el cuidado y alimentación de los mismos ya que requieren de muchos cuidados, los compra en la agencia de Agripac en Santa Ana, los mantiene por espacio de dos a tres meses luego los lleva  a entregar en asaderos de pollos de la localidad y también vende por libras a sus clientes, entrega además a ciertas tiendas del lugar o de Santa Ana.

Este crédito es para comprar más pollos ya que se avecina la época de Navidad y Año Nuevo y las personas en estos días compran bastante de estos productos y se ponen a buen precio. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijas y porque no tener un negocio  más grande
texts.en:
In the Ayacucho district, within the county of Santa Ana, the Amigas por Siempre (“Friends Forever”) cooperative bank meets every fifteen days.  This area is known for its grand vegetation, but most of all, for beautiful fresh water spas that are frequented by local and foreign tourists.

This is Jobertiz’s second cycle with the cooperative bank.  He is very content because the loans, and the way the credit is facilitated, have helped him a great deal with his business.  He is 36 years old, married, and has three daughters aged 12, 10, and 8 who are in school.  His wife is a homemaker.

He has a farm where he raises chickens.  He works every day feeding and tending to them, as they require great care.  He buys them at the Agripac agency in Santa Ana.  He keeps them for a period of two to three months, subsequently delivering them to the chicken roasters in the area.  He also sells poultry by the pound to customers and to certain stores in the area or in Santa Ana.

This loan is for the purchase of more chickens, as Christmas and New Year’s are approaching and people buy a great deal of his product during the season at good prices.  His dreams are to give his daughters all the best, and to have a bigger business.

loans.use: To purchase chickens.

loans.name: Moises

texts.es: Moisés, de 46 años, es un padre ejemplar, junto a su esposa Betty, de 37 años, salen adelante para poder ofrecerles una buena educación a sus 3 hijos, ellos viven solos en su casa propia, ubicado en la zona rural de Huaricolca. Como socios, ellos se distribuyen las diversas actividades económicas que realizan. Betty cuida de su pequeña tienda de comestibles, donde todos los días ofrece productos de primera necesidad. Mientras Moisés, se dedica al servicio de trasporte, en la ruta Tarma-Huaricolca. Pero la actividad que más los une a ellos es la agricultura, ahí todos los fines de semana, cuidan de sus cultivos de papa, avena y olluco (productos agrícolas), ya tienen 20 años dedicándose a ello, y juntos hacen posible mandar el dinero necesario a la capital del país, donde estudian sus hijos. Para el futuro desea comprar una casa en la capital, donde planean poner una tienda de comestibles y alquilar cuartos, de esa manera estará cerca de sus hijos. Es el quinto crédito con MFP y, está muy contento, de pertenecer a su banco comunal, donde los integrantes son personas unidas y muy solidarias. Con el crédito que obtendrá, comprará 15 sacos de abono, para esparcir sus cultivos de papa, que dentro de algunos meses cosechará.
texts.en:
46-year old Moisés is a model father. He and his 37-year old wife Betty have made a great effort to provide a good education for their three children. They live in their own house located in the rural area of Huaricolca.

Betty takes care of their small grocery store where she sell daily necessities. Moisés works in transportation, on the Tarma-Huaricolca route. However, their greatest bond lies in farming. Every weekend for the last 20 years they have worked in their fields of potatoes, oats, and olluco. This work has made it possible for them to send the necessary money to the capital where their children are studying.

In the future Moisés would like to buy a house in the capital, open a grocery business, and rent out rooms in order to be nearer his children.

This is his fifth loan with Kiva partner MFP, and he is very happy to belong to a community bank where the members are so united and supportive. With the loan he will buy fifteen bags of fertilizer to spread on his potato fields which will be ready for harvesting in a few months.

loans.use: to buy 15 bags of fertilizer

loans.name: María Dolores

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Picoaza  se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la rica cultura histórica que encierran sus montañas.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora María, ella tiene 56 años de edad y es madre soltera de  dos hijos que en la actualidad ya son mayores de edad, pero que aún viven con ella. Para la señora María este es su cuarto ciclo en el Banco y le gusta por la ayuda que le ha brindado para sacar su negocio adelante.

Tiene un bar  donde vende bebidas gaseosas, comidas rápidas y cervezas que es lo que más le gusta a sus clientes ya que en esta zona las personas se dedican bastante al comercio y en las noches acuden  a su local a conversar y distraerse un poco después de sus labores diarias. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 20h00, le ayudan sus hijos, los productos los recibe en su local.

Este crédito es para comprar bebidas tanto gaseosas como también las cervezas. Su sueño es tener un local mucho más grande para brindar más comodidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Picoaza cooperative bank meets every fifteen days in the Picoaza parish of the city of Portoviejo.  This area is known as a commercial zone, for its traditional feasts of San Pedro and San Pablo, and for the rich cultural history that its mountain ranges encircle.

This is where we find María, 56 years old and the single mother of two children who are now grown but who still live with her.  This is María’s fourth cycle with the bank, and she is glad for the assistance it has provided to help her get her business ahead.

She has a pub where she sells soft drinks, fast foods, and beer, which are the items her customers demand the most.  She is in an area where people dedicate themselves mostly to commerce, and at night they gather at her locale to chat and distract themselves a little after their daily activities.  She works every day from 6 am to 10 pm, assisted by her children.

This loan is for the purchase of beverages such as soft drinks and beer.  Her dream is to have a much larger location in order to serve her customers in a more comfortable setting.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks and beer.

loans.name: Lida

texts.es: Lida, de 41 años, es una mujer responsable, junto a su esposo, Gregorio, de 62 años, trabajan con perseverancia, para sacar adelante a sus 3 pequeños hijos, a los que cuidan y educan con mucho amor, en su casa propia ubicada en la zona rural de Huaricolca. Todas las mañanas desde las primeras horas del día, Gregorio, realiza trasporte público, en la ruta Tarma – Huaricolca; mientras que Lida atiende a su clientes, que constantemente visitan su tienda de comestibles, donde no solo vende productos de primera necesidad; sino también “leña” (que utilizan, para cocinar los alimentos), producto que tienen buena demanda en la zona. Como  hace 10 años, ambos se dedican todo el día al cuidado de sus terrenos de cultivo, donde siembran papa y avena; los que después de cosecharlos los comercializa en el mercado central de la ciudad. En adelante tienen planeado comprar una casa en el centro de la ciudad, ahí desean expandir su negocio de comestibles, así como también abrir su granja de cuyes. Es el segundo crédito con MFP y está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, donde sus integrantes son personas muy responsables. Con el crédito que obtendrá, comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico, para las 4 hectáreas de terreno agrícola, donde sembrarán papa, en estos días.
texts.en: Lida is 41 years old and a responsible woman.  She and her husband, 62 year-old Gregorio, work with perseverance to get their 3 small children ahead in life.  They care for and educate their children with a lot of love, in their own home in the rural region of Huaricolca.  Every morning from very early, Gregorio works as a public transport driver on the Tarma-Huaricola route while Lida serves the customers who constantly visit her grocery store where she sells not only basic groceries but also firewood (which they use to cook their food).  This is a product which is in great demand in the area.  For the past 10 years, Lida and Gregorio have also spent every day tending their plots of land where they grow potato and oats.  After harvesting their crops they sell them in the central market in the town.  In the future they plan to buy a house in the town center where they can expand their grocery business as well as opening a guinea pig farm.  This is Lida's second loan from MFP and she is very happy to belong to her community bank as the other members are very responsible people.  With this loan she will buy sacks of organic fertilizer for her 4 hectares of land where she will shortly sow her potatos.

loans.use: To buy sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Rosa Esther

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Picoaza  se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la rica cultura histórica que encierran sus montañas.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Rosa, ella tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tuvo tres hijos de 20 – 17  y 8 años de edad, todos estudian en Universidad, colegio y escuela. El esposo es albañil.

Se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, aunque también tiene muchos clientes que le encargan sus productos, trabaja todos los días en las mañanas una vez que sus hijos salen a sus estudios, ella recorre la localidad donde ella vive para vender o para que le hagan los pedidos, deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente, nos cuenta que lleva en este negocio como 12 años y que le va bien. Los productos los compra en Guayaquil.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar más mercadería en especial interiores de damas ya que tiene algunos pedidos.  Lleva 14 ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por las facilidades que brinda la institución. Su sueño es tener su propio almacén.
texts.en:
The Picoaza cooperative bank meets every fifteen days in the Picoaza parish of the city of Portoviejo.  This area is known as a commercial zone, for its traditional feasts of San Pedro and San Pablo, and for the rich cultural history that its mountain ranges encircle.

This is where we find Rosa, 45 years old, married, and the mother of three children ages 20, 17 and 8.  They are all studying in school or at the university.  Her husband works in construction.

She dedicates herself to commerce, selling all types of clothing door-to-door, although she also has many customers that place orders with her.  She works every morning, after her children have left for school, traveling throughout her locality to sell her products or take orders.  She delivers on credit, and collects every week.  She tells us that she has been in this business for 12 years, and that things are going well.  She purchases her products in Guayaquil.

This loan is for the purchase of more merchandise, especially women’s undergarments, for which she has some orders.  She is in her 14th cycle with the cooperative bank, and she appreciates the assistance provided by the institution.  Her dream is to have her own store.

loans.use: To purchase clothing, especially women's undergarments.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for his studies

loans.name: Cruz Katherine

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Picoaza  se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la rica cultura histórica que encierran sus montañas.

Para la señora Cruz este es su noveno ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por los créditos y por las oportunidades que brinda la institución para sacar sus negocios adelante. Además es la fiscal de reglamento del Banco. Tiene 31 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene dos niñas de 15 y dos años, la mayor esta en colegio. Su marido es comerciante.

Vende productos de Avon (productos de belleza, perfumería y accesorios de damas), trabaja cuatro días a la semana por las tardes ya que su hija estudia en las mañanas y no hay quien atienda a su pequeña hija, cuando llega su hija del colegio ella aprovecha para ir a recoger los pedidos que le realizan sus clientes mes a mes, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra semanalmente.

Este crédito es para pagar uno de los pedidos que realizo en este mes ya que tiene que pagar por adelantado para recibir la mercadería. Sus sueños son darles una buena educación a sus hijas y tener un local propio.
texts.en:
The Picoaza cooperative bank meets every fifteen days in the Picoaza parish of the city of Portoviejo.  This area is known as a commercial zone, for its traditional feasts of San Pedro and San Pablo, and for the rich cultural history that its mountain ranges encircle.

This is Cruz’s ninth cycle with the bank, and she appreciates the loans and the opportunities the institution provides to help get her business ahead.  In addition, she oversees the regulations for the bank.  She is 31 years old, married, and has two daughters ages 15 and two; the oldest is in school.  Her husband is a merchant.

She sells Avon products (beauty products, perfumes, women’s accessories).  She works four days per week in the afternoons, as her older daughter is in school in the morning and she doesn’t have anyone to watch her youngest daughter.  Once her daughter gets home from school, she goes out to collect the monthly orders her customers make.  She delivers her products on credit, and collects payments on a weekly basis.

This loan is to pay for one of the orders she made this month, as she has to pay for products up front to receive the merchandise.  Her dreams are to provide a good education for her daughters, and to open her own store.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products, perfumes, and women's accessories.

loans.name: Cruz Magdalena

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Picoaza  se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la rica cultura histórica que encierran sus montañas.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora  Cruz ella tiene 51 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene tres hijos que ya son mayores de edad y son independientes pero  dos viven cerca de su casa y el otro en Guayaquil. Su marido es chofer.

Junto con su esposo se dedican a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, recorren la ciudad y los campos en una camioneta que es de su propiedad y que les permite desplazarse por muchos lugares donde realizan las ventas, las mismas que son al contado y también deja a crédito pero solo a personas conocidas y de confianza, trabajan los viernes, sábados y domingos, la mercadería la compran en Guayaquil, su hijo que esta allá le compra y se las envía por transporte de cooperativa.

Este crédito es para comprar más mercadería. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace varios años luego se retiro y en este Banco es su segundo ciclo, le gusta porque este es un Banco muy ordenado. Su sueño es tener su propio almacén.
texts.en:
The Picoaza Community Bank meets every two weeks in Picoaza parish  in the town of Portoviejo, a place well-known for commerce, for its San Pedro and San Pablo festivals, and for its rich culture based on the surrounding mountains.

It is in this place that we meet Señora Cruz who is 51-years old, married, and has three adult children. They are all independent; two live nearby, and the other one lives in Guayaquil. Sra. Cruz’s husband is a driver. Together they sell all types of clothing. They travel to the town and into the countryside in a small truck that he owns. It allows them to get to many places to sell their goods on account. They also extend credit but only to people they know and trust. They work on Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays. The clothing is bought in Guayaquil where their son lives. He buys it and sends it to them via a transportation cooperative.

This loan is to buy more merchandise. Sra. Cruz has been with the community bank for several years. Then she withdrew, but is now in her second loan cycle with the bank. She likes the fact that the bank is very well-organized. Her dream is to have her own store.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Nury Emperatriz

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Picoaza  se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la rica cultura histórica que encierran sus montañas.

La señora Nury es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos y por los beneficios que brinda la institución a sus socias. Tiene 51 años de edad, hace varios años el compañero de su vida falleció pero de esta relación tuvo 5 hijos, cuatro de ellos son mayores, el ultimo que es menor de edad vive con ella.

Se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, aunque también tiene muchos clientes que le encargan sus productos, trabaja de miércoles a domingo, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra los días sábados. Nos cuenta que lleva en este negocio como 15 años y que le va bien por la clientela que tiene. Los productos los compra en Guayaquil cada fin de mes.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar para ir a Guayaquil a comprar su mercadería. Sus sueños son terminar su casa y construir un pequeño local para vender en su casa.
texts.en:
The Picoaza Communal Bank meets every fifteen days in Picoaza Parish in the city of Portoviejo. This place is known for being a commercial area, its traditional festivals in honor of St. Peter and St. Paul, and the rich cultural history contained within its mountains.

Sra. Nury is a founding member of the Communal Bank and enjoys the availability of loans and benefits that Fundación ESPOIR provides to its members. She is 51 years old and was married for several years before her husband passed away. This relationship resulted in five children, four of whom are adults. The youngest child is still a minor and lives with her.

Nury is a merchant, selling all types of clothing door-to-door. She also has several customers who place orders with her for these products. Nury works Wednesday through Sunday. She offers her products on credit and collects payments on Saturdays. Nury says she has been in this business for 15 years and has done well because of her customers. She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil at the end of the month.

This loan will be used to buy merchandise in Guayaquil. Her dreams include finishing the construction of her house and establishing a small store in her home.

loans.use: Purchase all types of clothing

loans.name: Briceida Andreina

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Progreso de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Ilusiones esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad, se la conoce como el sector de la cárcel ya que en esta zona queda la cárcel de mujeres de Portoviejo.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Briceida, tiene 22 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene una hermosa bebe de 9 meses de nacida. Su esposo es comerciante.

Se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h30 recorre con sus productos, los mismos que deja a crédito y que cobra en dos pagos cada quince días, o por pagos semanales, de acuerdo a las necesidades de sus clientes, nos cuenta que en estos últimos meses no ha podido salir con mucha frecuencia por que su bebe  esta pequeña pero igual sus clientes la visitaban en su casa. Además de esto su esposo tiene una tienda de víveres donde ella también vende su mercadería. Compra en Guayaquil por que allá es más barata.
 
Este crédito es justamente para ir a Guayaquil a comprar sus productos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace tres ciclos y le gusta por la oportunidad que le dan para sacar su negocio adelante. Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que vive en casa de los suegros.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Ilusiones” (Illusions) meets every fifteen days in the neighborhood of El Progresso in the city of Portoviejo. This marginalized urban area is the most populated section of the city and known for being the location of the Portoviejo Women’s Prison.

Sra. Briceida is 22 years old, married, and has a beautiful nine month old baby. Her husband is a merchant. She sells all types of clothing door-to-door. Briceida works every day starting at 8:30am by traveling with her products. She extends credit and collects two payments either on a biweekly or weekly schedule based on the needs of her customers. In recent months, Briceida has not been able to go out as much because of her small baby so her customers have been coming to her house. Her husband also has a grocery store where she can also sell her merchandise. She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil because it is cheaper.

This loan will be used to buy products in Guayaquil. Briceida has participated in three loan cycles with her Communal Bank and enjoys having the opportunity to move forward with her business. Her dream is to have her own home since she lives at the house of her in-laws.

loans.use: Purchase all types of clothing

loans.name: Carmen Isabel

texts.es:
Carmen es una madre de familia de 41 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en el distrito de La Victoria, una zona urbana situada cerca a la ciudad de Chiclayo, la mayor parte de su población se concentra en áreas marginales.

Ella cuenta con dos mototaxis (vehículo motorizado consistente en una mototaxi que lleva anexada una cabina para brindar servicio transporte de carga y pasajeros) las cuales utiliza para brindar servicio de transporte en su localidad. Una es manejada por uno de sus hijos y la otra es alquilada. Con los ingresos que ella percibe de esta actividad ella se encarga de ayudar a su esposo, que es carpintero , con el mantenimiento de los gastos de su familia.

Carmen desea brindar mantenimiento a sus unidades móviles de modo que pueda brindar un mejor servicio. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Carmen es una mujer que siempre está buscando el modo de ayudar a su familia y sacarla adelante. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una mujer alegre y servicial. Anteriormente ya ha tenido créditos con Edpyme Alternativa y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Carmen is a 41 year-old mother who lives with her husband and two children in the district of La Victoria, an urban area near the city of Chiclayo.  The majority of its population lives in marginal areas.

Carmen has two mototaxis (motorized vehicles consisting of a motorbike with a carriage on the back which is used to transport people or goods).  She uses the mototaxis to provide transport services in her town.  One is used by her son and the other is rented out.  With the income which she receives from this business she helps her husband, who is a carpenter, with the family expenses.

Carmen would like to have maintenance work done on her mototaxis so that she can provide a better service.  For this reason she is requesting a loan for 1,500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa which will help her achieve her goal.

Carmen is a woman who is always looking for ways to help her family and help them get ahead.  People who know her consider her to be a happy and helpful woman.  She has had other loans with Edpyme Alternativa and has shown herself to be punctual and responsible in making her repayments.

loans.use: Repair and maintenance expenses for her 'mototaxis'

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
Magdalena tiene 59 años D. edad, es casado y resiD. junto a su esposo y a un hijo en el distrito D. Túcume, una zona agrícola y turística que pertenece a la provincia D. Lambayeque y que se encuentra situada a cuarenta y cinco minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica desD. hace diez años a la crianza D. animales menores en su domicilio. Ella suele criar aves D. corral para venderlas a sus vecinos y negociantes D. la zona cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel D. desarrollo. El negocio le sirve para ayudar a su esposo, que trabaja como jornalero, con el mantenimiento D. la economía D. su familia.

Magdalena desea ampliar su negocio comprando más animales y alimento balanceado, asimismo desea realizar algunas mejoras en sus corrales. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Magdalena es una mujer bastante trabajadora y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria y poder seguir ayudando a su esposo.
texts.en:
Magdalena is 59 years old, is married and lives alongsiD. her husband and son in the Túcume district, an agricultural and tourist area that belongs to the Lambayeque province and is situated 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

For ten years, she has been dedicated to raising young animals in her home. She usually raises poultry to sell to her neighbors and stockists in the area when they have reached a good level of development. The business serves to help her husband, who works as a day laborer, with the economic support of the family.

Magdalena wishes to expand her business by buying more animals and food. At the same time, she wishes to complete some improvements to her pens. For this, she has seen fit to apply for the first time to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2,000 new soles that will help her achieve her objective.

Magdalena is a hard-working and responsible woman. Her greatest hope is to continue growing as a business woman and be able to continue helping her husband.

loans.use: Purchase young animals and food to grow her animal-raising and -selling business.

loans.name: María Eugenia

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Progreso de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Ilusiones esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad.se la conoce como el sector de la cárcel ya que en esta zona queda la cárcel de mujeres de Portoviejo.

Para la señora María este es su cuarto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le encantan las reuniones ya que además de aprender con las charlas educativas también se divierte. Tiene 42 años de edad, esta casada y de esta relación tuvo 5 hijos, tres de ellos ya son mayores de edad y los otros tienen 17 y 12 años los mismos que estudian en colegio. El esposo trabaja de conserje en una casa deportiva de la ciudad.

Tiene un negocio de preparación y venta de corviches, empanadas y helados de varios sabores, tiene un pequeño local en su casa donde vende todas las tardes las empanadas y los corviches ya que los helados los vende todo el día, trabaja en las mañanas en la producción de sus productos y en las tarde los vende. Nos cuenta que lleva 5 años en esta actividad y que le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar productos como maní, plátano y especias para la preparación de los alimentos. Además de una mesa y cuatro sillas para darle mas comodidad a sus clientes. Su sueño es tener un restaurante o un bar.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Ilusiones” (Illusions) meets every fifteen days in the neighborhood of El Progresso in the city of Portoviejo. This marginalized urban area is the most populated section of the city and known for being the location of the Portoviejo Women’s Prison.

Sra. María is participating in her fourth loan cycle with the Communal Bank and enjoys the meetings as well as the things she has learned from the educational seminars. She is 42 years old, married, and has five children. Three of her children are grown while the other two are 17 and 12 years of age and attending high school. Her husband works as a janitor at a sports facility in the city.

María has a business preparing and selling seafood cocktails, turnovers, and ice cream of different flavors. She has a small shop in her home where every afternoon she sells turnovers, seafood cocktails, and ice cream every day. María spends her mornings preparing the food that she will sell in the afternoon. She says she has been in business for five years and has done very well.

This loan will be used to buy more supplies such as peanuts, bananas, and spices used in preparing her food. In addition, she will purchase a table and four chairs so that her customers will be more comfortable. Her dream is to open a restaurant or bar.

loans.use: Purchase peanuts, bananas, spices, a table, and four chairs

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago tiene 40 años D. edad, es casado y tiene 5 hijos, vive junto a su familia en el anexo San Carlos, perteneciente al caserío Arbolsol, una zona rural del distrito D. Mórrope, sus habitantes tienen como principales actividades productivas a L. agricultura y L. crianza D. animales. Se encuentra ubicado a una hora y media hora D. L. ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica a L. crianza y venta D. animales desD. hace diez años. El cría chivos, cerdos y aves D. corral en algunos corrales instalados en L. parte exterior D. su domicilio, cuando sus animales ya han alcanzado un buen punto D. desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan L. zona y eventualmente también los venD. en el mercado del pueblo D. Mórrope. Este negocio es L. única fuente D. ingresos con L. que cuenta su familia por lo que trata D. mantenerlo D. L. mejor manera posible, además L. comercialización D. animales es un negocio con bastante demanda en L. zona.

Anteriormente Santiago ya ha tenido un crédito financiado por el fondo Kiva, con este dinero el pudo adquirir alimento balanceado y gracias a ello sus animales se desarrollaron D. mejor modo, pudiendo ser vendidos a mejor precio. Actualmente el se encuentra solicitando nuevamente a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en L. compra D. más animales y alimento balanceado para seguir creciendo como empresario.

Santiago se encuentra muy contento y bastante agradecido con las personas que colaboraron con el a través del fondo Kiva. Ahora el se encuentra enfrentando al futuro con optimismo y energía.
texts.en:
Santiago is 40 years old, is married and has five children. He lives with his family in the San Carlos annex, belonging to the Arbolsol village, a rural area in the Morrope district. Its inhabitants' principle work is farming and raising animals.It can be found one and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo.

He has been dedicated to raising and selling animals for ten years. He raises goats, pigs and poultry in some pens installed outsiD. his home. When his animals have reached a good point in their development, he sells them to buyers who always visit the area and he also eventually sells them in the Morrope market. This business is the only source of income for his family so he tries to maintain it in the best way possible. Additionally, selling animals is a business that generates a lot of demand in his area.

Previously, Santiago has had a loan financed by Kiva. With that money, he was able to acquire animal feed and, thanks to that, his animals developed in a better manner, allowing them to be sold at a better price. Currently, he is requesting a loan again from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2,000 new "soles" that he's thinking of using to buy more animals and feed to continue growing as a business man.

Santiago is very happy and thankful with the people that have collaborated with him through Kiva. Now he is facing his future with optimism and energy.

loans.use: Purchase young animals and food to expand his business raising and selling animals.

location.town: Anexo San Carlos - Arbolsol - Mórrope - Lambayeque

loans.name: Yesenia Ruth

texts.es:
Yesenia tiene 27 años de edad, es soltera y tiene un hijo que depende de ella. Reside en casa de sus padres, la cual se encuentra ubicada en el caserío El Pintor del distrito de Jayanca, una zona agrícola situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a mas de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace tres años a la venta de productos de belleza y cosméticos por catálogo, ella cuenta con un grupo de clientes que le compran sus productos con frecuencia, mientras más pedidos le realizan obtiene mas puntos de parte de la empresa que le provee los productos y por consiguiente obtiene mayores ganancias. Por este motivo se esfuerza por obtener cada vez mas clientes.

Yesenia desea contar con un capital estable para adquirir mas productos y contar con un stock fijo de cosméticos que permita a sus clientes adquirir los productos que necesitan rápidamente y no esperar hasta fin de mes, que es cuando le entregan los pedidos. Por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a conseguir su meta.

Yesenia es una mujer bastante responsable y luchadora. Su mayor anhelo es ver a su hijo convertido en una persona exitosa en el futuro. Las personas que la conocen le consideran una mujer amable y de confianza
texts.en:
Yesenia is 27 years old, is single and has one son who depends on her. She resides in her parents' home, which is located in the El Pintor village in the Jayanca district, a farming area in the Lambayeque province, more than an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

For three years, she has been dedicated to selling beauty products and cosmetics by catalog. She has a group of customers who buy her products frequently. The more orders she generates the more points she gets from the company that provides the products and, therefore, she obtains greater earnings. To that end, she is working to obtain more customers.

Yesenia wishes to have stable capital to acquire more products and rely on a fixed stock of cosmetics that allows her customers to acquire the products they need rapidly and not wait until the end of the month, which is when they send her the orders. For this, she has requested from Edpyme Alternativa a loan of 1,500 new "soles" that will help her achieve her goal.

Yesenia is a responsible and hard-working woman. Her greatest dream is to see her son become a successful person in the future. The people who know her consider her to be a friendly, trustworthy woman.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics to expand her business.

loans.name: Baronesa Bionet

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Progreso de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Ilusiones esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad.se la conoce como el sector de la cárcel ya que en esta zona queda la cárcel de mujeres de Portoviejo

La señora Baronesa es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que reciben para incrementar sus negocios. Tiene 62 años y está soltera pero de una relación que tuvo hace muchos años tuvo tres hijos, ya todos son mayores de edad pero el menor de ellos aun vive con ella.

Tiene una pequeña panadería donde además de pan fabrica y vende deliciosos pasteles, nos cuenta que es lo que más le gusta hacer ya que se divierte decorando sus obras que son muy apreciadas por las personas que conocen lo que ella hace. Trabaja todos los días desde las 5am hasta la noche que deja todo listo para el nuevo día, vende en su pequeño local y también entrega a una fundación todos los fines de semana.

Este crédito es para comprar harina y otros productos necesarios para la fabricación del pan y sus pasteles. Su sueño es formar una microempresa de fabricación de pasteles.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Ilusiones” (Illusions) meets every fifteen days in the neighborhood of El Progresso in the city of Portoviejo. This marginalized urban area is the most populated section of the city and known for being the location of the Portoviejo Women’s Prison.

Sra. Baronesa is a founding member of the Communal Bank and enjoys the assistance she receives to grow her business. She is 62 years old and single, but was in a relationship for many years that resulted in three children. All of her children are grown, but the youngest still lives with her.

Baronesa has a small bakery where she prepares and sells bread and delicious pastries. She says what she enjoys most is decorating her creations and they are well-appreciated by those people who are familiar with her work. Baronesa works every day from 5am until the evening hours so that she can prepare everything she needs the following day. She sells her goods from her small shop and also makes deliveries every weekend.

This loan will be used to buy flour and other necessary products for making bread and pastries. Her dream is to establish a small enterprise that makes cakes.

loans.use: Purchase flour, eggs, butter, sugar, milk, and other supplies

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda C. is from the city of Prenza, Tangub City. She is 52 years old and married, with 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Rosalinda  plants and harvests bananas for sale. Rosalinda has been in this business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

Rosalinda joined GDMPC this year to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalinda is requesting her first loan, for 5000 PHP, to be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use additional revenue generated by the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

Myra joined GDMPC this year to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myra is requesting her first loan, for 5000 PHP,  to be used to repair her existing vehicle for better service. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

texts.en:
Virgilia T. is from the city of Santa Cruz, Tangub City. She is 56 years old and widowed, with 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Virgilia  operates motor-transportation services. Virgilia has been engaged in her business for more than 5 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Virgilia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virgilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to repair her existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Virgilia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona M. is from the village of Poblacion 3,  Clarin Misamis, Occidental. She is 40 years old and married, with 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Alona runs a general store, where she sells products such as sugar, shampoo, noodles, salt, biscuits and juice packs in the local community. Alona has been engaged in her business for more than a year and earns approximately 1500 PHP a month.

Alona joined GDMPC this year to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alona is requesting her first loan, for 3000 PHP, to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.en:
Genoveva A. is from the city of Carmen Annex Ozamiz City. She is 63 years old. Genoveva is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Genoveva owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products such as candies, dried fish, and food for snacks in the local community. Genoveva has been engaged in her business for more than six years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Genoveva joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Genoveva has successfully repaid a previous loan  from GDMPC. Genoveva is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Genoveva from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

Maria has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 1500 PHP a month for these activities.

Maria is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional dried fish to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Maria from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

texts.en:
Joseph Ryane T. is from the village of Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 21 years old. Joseph Ryane is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Joseph Ryane provides motorcycle transportation services. He has been engaged in his business for more than one year and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Joseph Ryane joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Joseph Ryane is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP, which will be used to repair his existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Joseph Ryane from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:
