loans.name: Any Lorena

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Progreso de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Ilusiones esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad.se la conoce como el sector de la cárcel ya que en esta zona queda la cárcel de mujeres de Portoviejo.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora  Any, ella tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tuvo dos hijos uno de 25 y de 15 años,  los mismos que están estudiando, el mayor está a punto de incorporarse de profesional y el menor esta en colegio. Su marido es panificador.

Ella es ama de casa que también ayuda a su esposo en el negocio que es familiar, tiene una panadería, trabajan todos los días desde las 5am hasta la 22h00, en la mañana hornean el pan, luego los venden  y en el transcurso del día hornean para seguir vendiendo, en las noches   preparan la masa para el día siguiente.

Este crédito lo van a emplear para comprar harina y otros materiales que se utilizan en la preparación del pan. Está en el Banco Comunal desde sus inicios y le agrada porque no piden tantos requisitos para los créditos. Su sueño es ver que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Ilusiones” (Illusions) meets every fifteen days in the neighborhood of El Progresso in the city of Portoviejo. This marginalized urban area is the most populated section of the city and known for being the location of the Portoviejo Women’s Prison.

Sra. Any is 42 years old, married, and has two children (ages 25 and 15) who are in school. Her older child is almost at the point of becoming a professional while the younger child attends high school. Her husband is a baker.

Any is a homemaker, but she also helps her husband run the family business. They manage a bakery where they work every day from 5am to 10pm. In the morning they bake the bread to sell later. They continue baking throughout the day in order to continue their sales. At night they prepare the flour to be used the following day.

This loan will be used to buy flour and other ingredients used in making bread. Any has been part of the Communal Bank since the beginning and is pleased that there are few requirements needed to access the loans. Her dream is to see her children become successful professionals.

loans.use: Purchase flour, eggs, milk, butter, sugar, and other supplies

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es soltero, tiene 35 años de edad, y vive junto a sus padres en el caserío La Pava, distrito de Mochumí, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar como obrero agrícola desde que era muy joven, trabaja en diversos campos de cultivo de la zona. Como esta actividad no le ofrecía la estabilidad suficiente para solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar a sus padres empezó a trabajar adicionalmente en la crianza de animales y en la comercialización de leña.

Juan compra troncos de algarrobo recién talados a comercializadores de la zona y lo corta en trozos para ofrecérselos a sus clientes en “armadas” (atos de leña) de 30 unidades. El negocio de la venta de leña es de utilidad en la zona donde vive ya que la mayoría de familias cocinan sus alimentos con este producto. Adicionalmente cría animales de corral para venderlos a los comerciantes que visitan la zona eventualmente.

Juan ya ha tenido un crédito financiado por el fondo Kiva y gracias a ese dinero adquirió mas leña con lo que pudo ampliar su negocio. Ahora que se ha vuelto más conocido en el rubro y que su demanda ha aumentado planea seguir creciendo como empresario. Por este motivo ha creído conveniente volver a solicitar un crédito de 1700 nuevos soles

Juan se encuentra muy agradecido con las personas que colaboraron con el a través del programa Kiva. La ayuda recibida le ha motivado a reanudar sus fuerzas para luchar por salir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is single, is 35 years old and lives with his parents in the La Pava village, Mochumi district, located one hour from the city of Chiclayo.

He has been dedicated to working as a farm worker since he was young. He works in diverse fields in the area. Since this activity does not provide him with enough stablility to pay his personal expenses and help his parents, he began additional work raising animals and selling wood.

Juan buys carob trees recently felled from sellers in the area and cuts them into pieces to offer them to his customers in 30-unit "armadas" (bundles of wood). The business selling wood is useful in the area where he lives since the majority of families cook their food with this product. Additionaly, he raises animals in pens to sell them to vendors who visit the area.

Juan has already had a loan financed by Kiva and, thanks to that money, he acquired more wood with which he was able to expand his business. Now that he has become better known in this work and his demand has increased, he plans to keep growing as a businessman. To that end, he has seen fit to reapply for a loan of 1,700 new "soles."

Juan is very thankful for the people who have collaborated with him through the Kiva program. The help received has motivated him to resume his efforts to fight to get ahead and improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase wood to expand his business.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna D. is from Calabayan in Ozamiz City. She is 45 years old.  Edna is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Edna owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a transportation service. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating motor transport services. Edna has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Edna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from GDMPC. Edna is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Edna from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair vehicle for transport business

loans.name: Silvia Patricia

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Progreso de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Ilusiones esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad.se la conoce como el sector de la cárcel ya que en esta zona queda la cárcel de mujeres de Portoviejo.

En este lugar encontramos a Silvia, ella tiene 22 años de edad, es madre sotera de un niño de tres años que es su compañía y su adoración.  Estudia  el noveno semestre de economía en la Universidad Técnica de Manabí.

Se dedica al comercio, vende productos Avon y Esika (productos de belleza, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Además  ropa por catalogo de la marca Starchic. Trabaja todos los días desde las 9am hasta las 11am y de 14h00 a 16h00, también les vende a sus compañeras de la Universidad, deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días en dos o tres pagos dependiendo del valor del producto.

Este nuevo crédito lo va a emplear en comprar sus productos y en especial ropa de mujer que es lo más vende. Este es su tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que ha recibido ya que gracias a los créditos a logrado sacar su negocio y sus estudios adelante.
 
Sus sueños son ser una gran profesional y darle lo mejor a su hijo.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Ilusiones” (Illusions) meets every fifteen days in the neighborhood of El Progresso in the city of Portoviejo. This marginalized urban area is the most populated section of the city and known for being the location of the Portoviejo Women’s Prison.

Silvia is 22 years old and a single mother of a three year old son who she adores. She is in her ninth semester of studying economics at the Technical University of Manabí.

Silvia also sells products manufactured by Avon and Esika (beauty products, perfumes, and women’s accessories). In addition, she sells clothes of the Starchic brand through a catalog. Silvia works every day from 9am to 11am and from 2pm to 4pm. She sells to her classmates at the University. Her products are offered on credit and she collects payments every fifteen days in 2-3 installments depending on the price of the product.

This loan will be used to buy more products, especially women’s clothes that sell the most. Silvia is in her third loan cycle with the Communal Bank and enjoys the support that she has received. Thanks to the loans, she has been able to get ahead in her business and move forward with her studies. Her dreams are to become a successful professional and provide her son with the best.

loans.use: Purchase women's clothing, beauty products, perfumes, and accessories

loans.name: Eduard

texts.en:
Eduard J. is from the village of Bitibut Sapang Dalaga in Misamis Occidental. He is 34 years old.  Eduard is married and has 3 infant children. To make a living, Eduard owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a specialized retail store. 

While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, coffee, sardines, toothpaste, and other items in the local community. Eduard has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Eduard joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eduard has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & increase working capital.  

Eduard is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Eduard from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell

loans.name: Milinda

texts.en:
Milinda N. is from the village of Clarin Plaridel in Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old. Milinda is married. To make a living, Milinda owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a specialized retail store. 

While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Milinda has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Milinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Milinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. 

Milinda is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Milinda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell

loans.name: Reencuentros Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama REENCUENTROS, se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad de Lerma, Estado de México, está integrado por 12 clientas en él se encuentra la señora VIRGINIA D., quien es la tesorera, de 41 años de edad, nos platica que antes contaba con una recaudería, comenta que en ese momento no existían los créditos para apoyar a las mujeres trabajadoras como ella,y debido a los problemas que se encontró se vio en la necesidad de cerrar su negocio, tiempo después decidió invertir en una papelería la cual se encuentra ubicada en su propia casa, en este momento la invitaron a formar parte de un grupo de mujeres para solicitar un prestamo. El crédito le servirá para la compra de materia prima y con ello obtener una mayor ganancia, la ilusión que siempre ha tenido la clienta es que sus pequeños hijos puedan tener acceso a la educación universitaria.
texts.en:
This group is called “Reencuentros” (Reunions).  It is located in the Lerma community in the state of México.  It is comprised of 12 members.

Virginia D. is the treasurer.  She is 41 years old. She told us that she used to have a greengrocer business.  At the time, loans to help hard-working women like Virginia did not exist.  Due to the problems she encountered, she saw the necessity of closing her business.

Later she decided to invest in a stationery business, which is located in her house.  Then she was invited to form part of a group of women in order to request a loan.  She will use the loan to buy goods, which will give her greater income.  

Virginia has always had the dream of her children being able to have access to a college education.

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Merly Jacquelina

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Progreso de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Ilusiones esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad.se la conoce como el sector de la cárcel ya que en esta zona queda la cárcel de mujeres de Portoviejo.

La señora Merly ya lleva dos años como socia del Banco Comunal y dice que está muy contenta ya que ha conocido a muchas personas que le ayudan y le tienden una mano, además por los beneficios que le da la institución. Tiene 29 años, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual ha procreado dos hijos de 8 y 2 años de edad, el mayor estudia en la escuela. Su marido es albañil.

Es una ama de casa que tiene en su casa un negocio, elabora y vende bolos (helados de hielo en funda) de distintos sabores, trabaja en la elaboración todos los días desde las 14h00 hasta las 16h00, luego los congela y están listos para la venta. En la actualidad quiere dedicarse a la venta de ropa ya que tiene la facilidad que una amiga  le va a traer la ropa desde Huaquillas a buen precio para que ella venda y se gane un dinero extra.

Este crédito es para comprar su primera mercadería y así iniciar en este nuevo negocio. Su sueño es mejorar su casa ya que es de caña y quisiera tenerla de cemento.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Ilusiones” (Illusions) meets every fifteen days in the neighborhood of El Progresso in the city of Portoviejo. This marginalized urban area is the most populated section of the city and known for being the location of the Portoviejo Women’s Prison.

Sra. Merly has already been a member of the Communal Bank for two years and is pleased to have known many people who have helped her and given her a hand. In addition, she enjoys the benefits Fundación ESPOIR provides. Merly is 29 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two children (ages 8 and 2). Her oldest child is in school while her husband works as a mason.

Merly is a homemaker who also runs a business out of her house. She prepares and sells “bolis” (frozen treats that are sold in plastic pouches) in different flavors. Merly works every day preparing these treats from 2pm to 4pm. As soon as the treats are frozen, they are ready to sell. At the moment, Merly wants to sell clothes because one of her friends is able to bring back clothing from Huaquillas at a good price. She can sell then sell the clothes in order to generate extra income.

This loan will be used to buy her first inventory of merchandise to start her new business. Her dream is to improve her house since it is made of reeds. She would like to upgrade to a house made of cement.

loans.use: Purchase clothing in order to start a new business

loans.name: Digna Elizabeth

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Progreso de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Ilusiones esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad.se la conoce como el sector de la cárcel ya que en esta zona queda la cárcel de mujeres de Portoviejo.

La señora Digna tiene 20 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre hace 1 año, dice que todavía está en su luna de miel, todavía no han  tenido hijos porque quieren estabilizarse para darle lo mejor a su hijo que pronto quieren tener. Su marido trabaja en el Camal Municipal.

Se dedica al comercio desde hace dos años, vende frutas y verduras,  tiene un puesto  en el mercado municipal, trabaja desde las 7 am hasta las 17h00, nos cuenta que su papá tenía este negocio pero lo dejo a su cargo porque él se fue a otra ciudad. Sus productos los compra en el propio mercado a comerciantes al por mayor o a agricultores que llevan sus productos a vender.

Este crédito es para comprar más frutas y legumbres y así tener bien surtido su puesto. Está en el Banco Comunal hace ya tres ciclos y le gusta por las facilidades de pago. Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya donde viven es arrendado.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Ilusiones” (Illusions) meets every fifteen days in the neighborhood of El Progresso in the city of Portoviejo. This marginalized urban area is the most populated section of the city and known for being the location of the Portoviejo Women’s Prison.

Sra. Digna is 20 years old and has been in a common law marriage for one year. She says she is still on her honeymoon. Digna and her husband still do not have children because they want to be stable so that they can provide the best for their child which they hope to have soon. Her husband works at the municipal slaughterhouse.

Digna has been selling fruits and vegetables for two years. She has a stand at the municipal market where she works from 7am to 5pm. Digna says her father started this business but left her in charge because he moved to another city. She buys her merchandise from wholesalers and farmers who bring their produce to the market.

This loan will be used to buy more fruits and legumes so that her vending post will be well-stocked. Digna has participated in three loan cycles with her Communal Bank and enjoys the convenience of the payments. Her dream is to own a house since she currently lives in a rental property.

loans.use: Purchase fruits & legumes

loans.name: Alba Marina

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Progreso de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Ilusiones esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad.se la conoce como el sector de la cárcel ya que en esta zona queda la cárcel de mujeres de Portoviejo.

En este lugar encontramos  a la señora Alba, ella tiene 21 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre desde hace dos años, nos cuenta con mucha tristeza que su primer bebé que iba a tener falleció antes del parto, su marido es militar.

Trabaja en un almacén de pintura de lunes a viernes y   además se dedica al comercio, vende ropa por catalogo, trabaja los días sabados y domingos desde las 8am hasta las 15h00 y de lunes a viernes en las noches. Recibe los productos en una distribuidora en el centro de la ciudad.
 
Este crédito es para viajar a Baños y traer ropa para dedicarse no solo a la venta por catálogo sino también venta personal. Este es su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la seriedad de sus compañeras del Banco. Su sueño es tener una bonita familia y tres hijos a quienes darles lo mejor.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Ilusiones” (Illusions) meets every fifteen days in the neighborhood of El Progresso in the city of Portoviejo. This marginalized urban area is the most populated section of the city and known for being the location of the Portoviejo Women’s Prison.

Sra. Alba is 21 years old and has been in a common law marriage for two years. She says that she is saddened because her first child died during her pregnancy. Her husband is in the military.

Alba works at a paint store Monday through Friday and also sells clothing through a catalog. She works every Saturday and Sunday from 8am until 3pm and at nights during the work week. Alba acquires her products from a distributor in the central part of the city.

This loan will enable her to travel to Baños so that she can acquire clothing to bring back with her. Not only does she sell through a catalog, but she also obtains merchandise from other salespeople. This is her second loan cycle with the Communal Bank and she likes the seriousness of her fellow group members. Her dream is to have a beautiful family, specifically three children, for whom she can provide the best.

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Lady Marilin

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Progreso de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Ilusiones esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad.se la conoce como el sector de la cárcel ya que en esta zona queda la cárcel de mujeres de Portoviejo.

La señora Lady es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal, se desempeña como fiscal de pagos del Banco y le gustan las reuniones y las charlas. Ella tiene 50 años, está casada y fruto de esta relación tuvo cuatro hijos, tres mayores y una menor que es la que vive con ella. Su marido es mecánico. Ella aprendió corte  y confección ya que su familia que se dedicaba a esta profesión.

Es modista y tiene un pequeño taller de costura en su casa, confecciona todo tipo de ropa pero lo que más le gusta hacer es ropa de mujer y de niñas, trabaja todos los días desde las 7am hasta las 21h00 y en ciertos casos hasta más tarde, le cose a personas que llegan hasta su local y  también cose ropa y la vende hecha.

Este crédito es para comprar telas y otros materiales para la costura.  Su sueño es terminar su casa.
texts.en:
In El Progreso neighborhood, in the city of Portoviejo, the 'Ilusiones' community bank meets every fortnight.  This is a marginal urban area which is very densely populated and known as the 'jail district' since the women's jail of Portoviejo is found there.

Lady is a founding member of the community bank.  Her role in the bank is that of payment collector and she likes the bank's meetings and talks.  Lady is 50 years old.  She is married and has four children from her marriage.  Three of her children are grown up and one daughter is still living with her.  Lady's husband is a mechanic.  She learned dressmaking because her family is in the profession.

Lady is a dressmaker and she has a small sewing workshop in her home.  She makes all kinds of clothes but what she most likes making is women's and girls' clothes.  She works every day from 7.00am to 9.00pm and sometimes even later.  She sews for people who come to her business and she also sews clothes and sells them.

This loan will be used to buy fabric and other materials for her sewing.  Her dream is to finish building her house.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, buttons, zippers, etc.

loans.name: Florente

texts.en:
Florente R. Jr. is from the village of Agay-ayan, Gingoog City. He is 33 years old. Florente is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Florente owns & operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling firewood in bundles in the local community. Florente has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Florente joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Florente is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional firewood to buy and sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Florente from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional firewood to buy and sell.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita Q. is from the village of Gata, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old. Lolita is widowed and has 8 grown children. To make a living, Lolita owns & operates a specialized retail store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, candies, biscuits, toothpaste and others in the local community. Lolita is just starting this business.

In 2010, Lolita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Lolita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Mayita Dolores

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Progreso de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Ilusiones esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad.se la conoce como el sector de la cárcel ya que en esta zona queda la cárcel de mujeres de Portoviejo.

Aquí encontramos a la señora Mayita, tiene 34 años y mantiene una relación de unión libre, de la cual ha procreado tres hijos de 12 – 9 años y un lindo bebe de 9 meses el cual es su adoración al igual que sus otros hijos, los mayores están en la escuela. Su marido es albañil.

Es una ama de casa que además de cuidar su hogar y a sus hijos también se dedica al comercio, vende sabanas y edredones, trabaja tres o cuatro días a la semana desde las 8am hasta las 11am y por las noches desde las 18h00 hasta las 20h00 ya que desde las 11 tiene que hacer el almuerzo y después atender y ayudar a sus hijos, en las noches su marido se queda con sus hijos y aprovecha para hacer sus ventas. Su mercadería se la traen desde Quito ya que su suegro que vive allá se la manda.

Este crédito es para comprar mas mercadería en especial edredones ya que los que tenía los vendió y le han pedido más. Este es quinto ciclo en el Banco Comunal  y le gusta porque ha hecho buenas amigas en el Banco. Su sueño es tener algún día un almacén.
texts.en:
In El Progreso neighborhood, in the city of Portoviejo, the 'Ilusiones' community bank meets every fortnight.  It is a marginal urban area which is very densely populated and known as the 'jail district' since the women's jail of Portoviejo is found there.

Here we find Mayita who is 34 years old and lives with her common-law husband.  They have three children aged 9 – 12 and a beautiful 9 month-old baby who, along with her other children, she adores.  Her older children are in school.  Her husband is a construction worker.

Mayita is a housewife who, besides looking after her house and her children, also sells sheets and quilts.  She works three or four days a week from 8.00am to 11.00am and then again in the evenings from 6.00pm to 8.00pm since from 11.00am onwards she has to make lunch and then look after and help her children.  In the evenings her husband stays with the children and she takes advantage of this to go and make some sales.  Her merchandise is from Quito since her father-in-law lives there and sends it to her.

This loan will be used to buy more merchandise, especially quilts since she has sold those which she had and people are requesting more.  This is Mayita's fifth loan cycle in her community bank and she likes being a member because she has made some good friends there.  Her dream is to some  day own a store.

loans.use: To buy sheets and quilts

loans.name: Lecilda

texts.en:
Lecilda A. is from the village of Santiago, Gingoog City. She is 35 years old. Lecilda is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Lecilda owns & operates a food stall. She makes and sells snacks like rice cakes, biko or sweetened rice, and boiled eggs in the local community. She also serves coffee and chocolate drinks to customers. Lecilda has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lecilda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Lecilda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand product offering. Lecilda is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital for the business. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Lecilda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital for the business.

loans.name: Melesa

texts.en:
Melesa B. is from the village of Talisay, Gingoog City. She is 32 years old. Melesa is separated from spouse and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Melesa owns & operates a retail store, buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, junkfoods & instant noodles in the local community. She buys and sells fruit like watermelon, sweet bananas She also buys and sells firewood. Melesa has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Melesa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Melesa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Melesa is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital for the business. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Melesa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital for the business.

loans.name: Dolores Ernestina

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Progreso de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Ilusiones esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad.se la conoce como el sector de la cárcel ya que en esta zona queda la cárcel de mujeres de Portoviejo.

Para la señora Dolores este es su tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal, le gustan más que todo las charlas sobre salud ya de estas aprende mucho. Tiene 26 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 11 y 10 años, los mismos que están en la escuela. Su marido es albañil.

Vende productos para el hogar (planchas, licuadoras, ventiladores, camas, etc.) además de ropa y zapatos de todo tipo. Su forma de venta es por cartilla o por catalogo, enseña la revista donde están todos estos artículos y sus clientes deciden que es lo que quieren, luego ella al completar el cupo limite realiza los pedidos y entrega los productos de acuerdo al número que tengan sus clientes y cobra los productos dados todas las semanas o cada quince como prefieran sus clientes.

Este crédito es para comprar más de sus productos ya que tiene dos pedidos para realizar y necesita el capital ya que el que tenia esta invertido. Su  sueño es tener su propia distribuidora de estos productos.
texts.en:
In El Progreso neighborhood, in the city of Portoviejo, the 'Ilusiones' community bank meets every fortnight.  It is a marginal urban area which is very densely populated and known as the 'jail district' since the women's jail of Portoviejo is found there.

This is Dolores' third loan cycle with her community bank.  What she most likes about her community bank are the health talks since she learns a lot from them.  Dolores is 26 years old and lives with her common-law husband.  They have two children, aged 10 and 11, who are in school.  Her husband is a construction worker.

Dolores sells household products such as irons, blenders, fans, bed linen, etc.  She also sells all kinds of clothes and shoes.  She sells her products through a catalog.  She shows the catalog to her customers and they choose which products they want.  She then completes her quota, makes her orders, delivers the products to her customers and collects payment for the products every week or every fortnight as her customers prefer.

This loan will be used to buy more products since she has two orders to make and she needs capital because the capital she has is invested in the business.  Her dream is to have her own distribution company for these products.

loans.use: To buy irons, blenders, fans, etc.

loans.name: Lady Chita

texts.en:
Lady Chita A. is from the village of Lapasan Clarin, Misamis Occidenta. She is 24 years old. Lady Chita is single. To make a living, Lady Chita owns & operates a business providing sewing services in the local community. Lady Chita has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lady Chita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Lady Chita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Lady Chita is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This will be the second loan taken out by Lady Chita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.
About GDMPC:

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel G. is from the village of Barangay 17, Gingoog City. She is 47 years old. Maribel is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Maribel owns & operates a business making and selling home made sausage, hotdogs, and chorizo in the local community. She also buys and sells dried fish like pinikas and tamban. Maribel has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Maribel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Maribel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Maribel is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital for the business. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Maribel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion D. is a loving mother of two children. She is seen as young and strong at her 32 years of age. Consolacion has been surrounded by people buying and selling live chickens. Thanks to the knowledge she has gained from them, Consolacion dedicates herself to buying and selling live chickens, work that she learned from her humble parents. 

With experience gained over time in the purchase and sale of chickens, she has been able to bring stability to her family. The desire that Consolacion harbors in her heart is that of growing her capital in order to invest in acquiring more chickens to sell. This way, she can create more income for her family.

Above all, she hopes to offer a better quality of life for her dependent children, who support her unconditionally in her daily work. Consolacion requests a loan of 20,000 PHP. Let’s get together behind this truthful mother to help her keep bringing wellbeing and security to the members of her family.

As a dedicated member of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva micro-finance partner in the Philippines since 2008, Consolacion is thankful for secured access to capital and loans to support her entrepreneurial dreams. Consolacion hopes to diversify her revenue in the long term to support the educational needs of her children who are aged 11 and nine.

loans.use: To buy more inventory of live chickens to sell
