loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn E. is from the village of Talisayan, Misamis Oriental. She is 32 years old. Analyn is married and has three school-age children. To make a living, Analyn owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily-use products, such as shampoo, soap, junk food, toothpaste, and canned goods, in the local community. She also buys and sells gasoline by the liter and agricultural feed for pigs by the kilogram. Analyn has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2009, Analyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Analyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Analyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory, and as working capital for the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Analyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory, and as working capital for the business

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda G. is from the village of Tagbocboc, Gingoog City. She is 40 years old. Glenda is married and has three school-age children. To make a living, Glenda owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling fish like milkfish, mackerel, and salmon in the local community. Glenda has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities. In 2010, Glenda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Glenda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fish to buy and sell. Glenda is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory, and as working capital for the fish business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Glenda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory, and as working capital for the fish business

loans.name: Joram

texts.en:
Joram S. is forty years old from Khwisero and married to Linet. They have three children aged fifteen, ten and seven years old. 

Joram has a business of selling grains, most typically corn. He has been in this business for the past ten years and has grown a huge customer base over the years. He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him to purchase more corn to sell. He intends to use the profits to pay school fees for his children. 

His desire is to buy a piece of land and get into farming.

loans.use: To buy corn supplies to sell.

loans.name: Prok

texts.en: Prok T., 41, is a low-income farmer living in Kompong Tom Province. Prok T. raises ducks in a cage behind her house for extra income. She is a good and determined single mother who tries her best to feed her three children, even though she has been divorced from her husband for many years. She has one married child who lives separately, while the others are home and work in a variety of jobs. Prok T. has applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner HKL in order to purchase more ducks to raise for eggs.

loans.use: To purchase more ducks to raise for eggs.

loans.name: Mer

texts.en:
Mrs. Mer H., 60, is a widow with three sons and two daughters. She lives in a small village outside of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Mer is a farmer. She grows vegetables and transports them to sell in Phnom Penh market. Her daughter (pictured above) assists her mother in the business.   

Mer is requesting her first loan of US$500. She will use the loan to purchase a trailer to take vegetables to the market.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer to take vegetables to the market.

loans.name: Daudi Ndolo

texts.en:
Daudi Ndolo is a shopkeeper who is 48 years old. He is married to Rose Kalekye (age 50 years) who is a housewife. Together they have one 30-year-old daughter who is employed. 

Daudi’s shop is in Ngalasya market centre in Tala town, which has a good population for business. He has been running this business for the last 16 years and it generates a monthly income of Kshs 20,000. He was introduced to Kadet by the credit officer in charge of the Tala office.

Once Daudi gets the loan, he wants to buy sugar, cooking fat, flour and water containers to sell.

Daudi’s customers are happy with his business and the way he serves them with respect. He plans to save and have a wholesale business in the future.

Daudi describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: To buy sugar, cooking fat, flour and water containers to sell.

loans.name: Toir

texts.ru: Абдуллоев Тоир проживает в районе Фархор. Возраст, 23 года. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Образование среднее. Два года как занимается торговлей. У него имеется собственная торговая точка, где он продает муку и картошку оптом. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Toir Abduloev lives in the Farhor region. He is 23 years old. He is married and has two children. He has secondary education. He has been selling for two years now. He has own vendor space where he sells flour and potatoes in wholesale. He is taking out the loan to increase circulation and sales.

loans.use: To increase sales

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a farmer from Nyamira town in western Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for 25 years and employs five farmhands. His mixed farm produces tea, milk and maize which are all sold locally. He also earns income from his shop which he operates in the same region. His biggest challenge in farming has been lack of enough animal feed.

He has requested this loan of 45,000KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help him pay school fees for his child in school. In the future he would like to purchase more agricultural land to expand his farm.

Peter is 54 years old. He is married with seven children who are between the ages of 26 and 35. His youngest child is currently attending school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nicholas Mutuku

texts.en:
Nicholas Mutuku aged 44 years, sells used and new tyres in Umoja innercore. He is married to Damaris Nthenya and together they have three children,  a daughter aged 17 and two sons aged 14 and five years. He was introduced to KADET LTD by other Kadet clients.

Umoja innercore is a well-populated area and Nicholas has many clients. His business of 11 years gives him a monthly profit of Kshs 10,000, and with the loan he wants to buy more tyres, rims and tubes. If the loan boosts the business, Nicholas plans to open another shop in the surrounding estates.

Nicholas, who describes himself as honest and hard-working, has great dreams of growing his business to many shops which will enable him to give better education to his children and attain a higher standard of living for his family.

loans.use: To buy tyres, tubes and rims

loans.name: Mercy Njambi

texts.en:
Mercy has been selling shoes in Olkalou town for the last 20 years.  She is 40 years old, married to James Wahome, and they have two children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the loan to buy more shoes for sale.

In future, Mercy hopes to move into her own permanent shop from where she will be selling her shoes. She is a  very hardworking lady.

loans.use: To buy more shoes for sale

loans.name: Met

texts.en:
Mrs. Met S. (in the picture) is 30 years old and her husband, Mr. Choeun Soem is 31 years old. They have been married since 2000 and have two children--one son and one daughter. Both of them are in school. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Met has been a weaver since she was fifteen years old. Her husband is a farmer; he grows corn and tomatoes. He wants a cow to use on his vegetable farm, plowing his farmland. And when the cow gives birth, he will be able to earn more income from selling the calves or selling them when the cows grow to full size. 

Hence Met is asking for her first loan of US$ 800 for her husband’s project.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Sam-Onn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam-onn C. (in the picture) is 43 years old and her husband, Mr. Samorn Sam, 42 years old. They have been married since 1991 and have two children--one son and one daughter. Both of them are in school. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Sam-onn is a weaver. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh market. Her husband is a security guard. 

Sam-onn is requesting a loan of US$ 200 to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Muhae's Group

texts.en:
Muhae T. is the leader of the group. She is 36 and married.  Her husband works in construction. Together they are bringing up a daughter and a son. Both of them are at school. Three years ago with the initial investment of 18,000 soms, Muhae started to breed farm animals. She hopes to obtain the loan in order to purchase livestock animals for breeding.  In the future she wants to save money to start repairing their house. 

Diloram E., 48, is the treasurer of the group. She is married and has two children. Diloram is engaged in wholesale trade of fruits and vegetables. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase more fruits and vegetables for sale. 

Nozgul A. is 20 years old. She is engaged in farming. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase furniture. 

Ikromjon M., 36, is married. She has a daughter and a son.  Ten years ago with the initial investment of 20,000 soms Ikromjon, together with her husband, started to breed cattle.  With money received from the loan she wants to purchase a calf for breeding.
 
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock animals

loans.name: Yim

texts.en:
Mrs. Yim L. is a 57-year-old farmer who has been living in the province of Kompong Tom. Mrs. Yim L. is married to Mr. Keo Korn, age 66. This couple has been cultivating crops on their farmland for over ten years. Mrs. Yim L. and her husband always work together in the farm field. They are blessed with four kids; one is married and living in their own house, and three are single. 

All the main income in Mrs. Yim L.’s family is earned by her two daughters who work in a factory. Mrs. Yim L. said that her daughters go to work by hiring a taxi and walking sometimes. So Mrs. Yim L. would like to request a loan for her children to purchase a used motorbike for driving to work.

loans.use: To purchase a used motorbike for her daughters to drive to work

loans.name: Saidikrom

texts.ru: Абдуллоев Саидикром проживает в районе Фархор. Возраст, 29 лет. Женат, имеет одного ребенка. Образование высшее. Окончил университет Предпринимательства и сервиса. Занимается торговлей. Он в основном продает топлива (бензин и солярка). В этой области уже 4 года. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота во время осенних посевов, так как в это время года спрос на его товар увеличится.
texts.en: Saidikrom A. lives in the Farkhor region. He is 29 years old. He is married and has one child. He has higher education and graduated from the university of business and service. He is in sales. He mainly sells fuel such as gasoline and diesel. He has been in this business for four years now. He is taking out the loan to increase sales during the fall crop season as during this time the demand for his product increases.

loans.use: To increase circulation of goods during the fall crop season

loans.name: Tort's Group

texts.en:
Ten people make up this village bank loA.. They are located in Khmut village in Kandal province. This village bank group selected Mrs. Tort S. A., 52 years old, as the village bank president.

Mrs. Tort S. A. and her husband, Mr. Um Vy, are farmers who own a 2-hectare plot of land that they use to cultivate rice to earn a living. They do not have enough money to grow crops on their farm. So Mrs. Tort S. A. decided to ask for a loA. to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and to pay to hire laborers to plow her farm to cultivate rice. 

They are farmers who have worked very hard to raise their six children: three are seamstresses in a garment factory while and two are students in the local school, while another stays at home and helps the parents with their farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and to pay to hire laborers to plow her field

loans.name: Chen's Group

texts.en:
This village loan consists of fourteen people located in Khmut village in Kandal province. Mrs. Chen V. is a 52-year-old married woman and has been  selected as the village bank president. Each member of this village bank will use their portion of the loan to support their different purposes. 

Mrs. Chen V. and her husband, Mr. Chen Chim, are farmers who own a plot of land that they use to cultivate rice. They are also able to have some income through their two children who are working as seamstresses in a garment factory. 

But now the family  faces a problem because their house is getting old, and they do not have enough money to fix it. Thus, Mrs. Chen V. would like to ask for a loan to add to her savings to fix her house up.

loans.use: To add to her savings to fix her house up

loans.name: Mrs. Chhum Sen Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhum S. is the village bank president who has been selected by seventeen members, located in Kouk Pring village in Kandal province, who make up a village bank loan. They will each use their portion of the loan in varied ways to support their families' standard of living  She was born in 1962 and is a farmer who owns a small piece of land that she uses to cultivate rice to sell to support her family, while her husband, Mr. Ra Yorng, is a commune chief who receives only a low salary to support his family. She is the mother of a child who is a seamstress in a garment factory.

At present, Mrs. Chhum S. is not comfortable living in her house because her yard is always invaded by some animals who damage her plants near her house. So, to improve her house, Mrs. Chhum S. is requesting a loan to buy metal netting and other supplies to build a fence around her house.

loans.use: To buy metal netting and other supplies to build a fence to surround her house

loans.name: Shadiya

texts.en:
Shadiya M. is 48 years old, married and has three children. From her childhood, Shadiya was eager to study and after finishing school, she continued her studies in Medical University. After graduating, she got a job as a pharmacist. When Shadiya was 22, she got married and soon gave a birth to her son and daughter. 

In order to find a means of subsistence for their children, Shadiya and her husband went to Russia in search of a livelihood. After coming back, they were able to buy a house in Ak-Suu village. There, in 1995, Shadiya gave birth to her youngest son who is the main helper in all her activities. In order to find a means of subsistence for her family, in 2000, Shadiya decided to start her business with the initial capital of 15,000 Kyrgyz Soms.  She opened a pharmacy in her village and became a person who is held in high respect by her fellow villagers. Also, in order to find additional earnings, Shadiya started to breed cattle, and with the revenues she was able to give a good dowry to her daughter. 

Now Shadiya is applying for loan of 100,000 Kyrgyz Soms to raise her turnover, which will allow her to broaden her business. In future, she dreams of enlarging the numbers of pharmacies in order to help her customers to overcome their medical problems. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to broaden her business

loans.name: Mrs. Naut Sokea Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty people who live in Kouk Pring village in Kandal province are requesting a village bank loan. Mrs. Naut S., 31 years old, is the village bank president and has been selected as the group leader. Each group member will uS. his or her portion of the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Naut S. is a dessert seller in her local village where she is able to earn some money to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Bet Man, is a construction worker. They have four children all of whom attend school and help with their parents’ businesses. Currently, Mrs. Naut S.'s home is messy becauS. there is no lavatory to uS.. To improve her family’s standard of living, Mrs. Naut S. will uS. this loan to build a lavatory in her home.

loans.use: to build a lavatory

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita G. is 59 years old and a widow with three children. She is a resident of Malabor, Tibiao Antique, Philippines. Her husband died five years ago and she has taken on the role of being both mother and father to her children. Her eldest child is 27 years old and her youngest is nine. Because of poverty, two of her children have only completed high school, but she has never lost hope because she has still one child who is studying.

After her husband died, Clarita focused much of her time on fish vending to move on and to provide for the needs of her family. She doubled up her work efforts because she did not want her children to go hungry or get sick. Clarita hopes that at least one of her children will finish college because she knows that it is very difficult to find work without a good education.

In 2009, Clarita had the opportunity to join ASHI when ASHI ANB opened an expansion program. Clarita’s dreams were the basic requirements of membership. Her first loan was for 5,000 PHP which she used to expand her fish selling business. 

Clarita is requesting a second loan of 10,000 PHP to use as additional capital for her business. The income that she will gain will be a great help to provide for her family and support her child who is still studying. Clarita also dreams that her business will improve with the help of ASHI and Kiva, and she hopes to expand her fish selling business to the wholesale level if she has enough capital.

loans.use: to use as capital for fish selling business

loans.name: Mok Moeun's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Mok M., who is 33 years old, has been selected as the group leader for this four-member group. Members are located in Preaek Reang village in Kandal province and will use their portions of the loan in varied ways to improve family living conditions.  

Mr. Moen earns a little money to support his family as a motorbike taxi driver while his wife, Mrs. Sok Ney Vorn, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate vegetables to sell. These activities support the family. The couple has four children, two of whom are too young to work or go to school, and two of whom attend school. During this growing season, the family did not have enough money to grow vegetables. Therefore, to improve production, Mr. Mok M. is asking for a loan to plant and grow vegetables.

loans.use: to plant and grow vegetables

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia A. is 53 years old, a caring mother and the loving wife of Frede A. from Malabor, Tibiao Antique, Philippines. She is a mother who always dreams for the betterment of the family and for the good future of their children. They have two children, namely Welbert, 23 years old, and Janet, 15 years old. Welbert is an elementary graduate while Janet is in her fourth year of high school and still studying.

Lilia dreams that at least one of her children will finished college because she did not finished her studies, even elementary school, so she did not know how to read and write even her name.  (During her training in ASHI, the staff taught her to write at least her signature.) That is why she and her husband strive to give their children a bright future through sending them to school through college so that they will never experience again the nightmares of poverty.

Lilia believes that through her membership in ASHI, with its partnership with KIVA, and through their industry they will achieve their dreams in life. She finished her first loan which was Php. 5000 with a very good rating in project, repayment, and attendance because they aspire to apply for Php 10,000  this time which will be utilized as additional capital for her piggery business .

loans.use: additional capital for her piggery

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok S., 36, is a resident of Battambang Province. She runs a little store in front of Our Char primary school selling items such as desserts, sweets, ice-cream, and study materials for students from the surrounding neighborhoods. She can earn $5 per day from her business.

 Sok S. is married to Chin Lao who is 30 years old and now employed as soldier and has a proper salary. They are good parents of two children, both single and living under their roof. Sok S. is not comfortable because her house often needs to be repaired. She would like a loan to purchase housing tools to repair her old house.

loans.use: To purchase housing tools to repair her old house

loans.name: Teng's Group

texts.en:
Ten people make up this village bank loan. They are located in Chong Preaek village in Kandal province. This village bank group selected Mr. Teng L., a 26-year-old married man, as the village bank president. Each member of this village bank loan will use their portion of the loan to support their different purposes. 

Mr. Teng L. and his wife, Mrs. Khvei Vanna, are working as employees in a garment factory. With their occupations, they still don't earn enough income to improve the family's living conditions, so they want to conduct a new business: pig breeding.  Mr. Teng L. would like to ask for a loan to buy piglets for breeding and pig feed. This couple has one child who is just six months old.

loans.use: To buy piglets for breeding and pig feed

loans.name: Kat's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Khat S. is 41 years old and is a villager who lives in Chong Preaek village in Kandal province. Mrs. Khat S. is tH. village bank president, having been selected by its nine members who all live in Chong Preaek village together. 

Mrs. Khat S. is a farmer who owns a piece of land that sH. uses to cultivate rice. To support this farming, Mrs. Khat S. decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer and pesticide for her rice. SH. plans to buy motorbike repair supplies for her husband's business with any remainder of tH. loan. Her husband, Mr. Choy Ny, is 52 years old and work as a motorcycle repairman who is able to earn some income to support his family. This couple has two children who are too young to study or work.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pesticide to cultivate rice

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Khlây

texts.en:
Selling fish is an important part of 55-year-old Khlây L.’s daily routine. She always gets up early in the morning in order to buy fresh fish from the other fishermen in the rural area around her community in bulk and at a reasonable price. And she hurries up to sell it in the busy local market. 

She has a life partner in Mr. Khoun Roun who is employed as a building worker. This couple have two children. Khlây L. is a hard-working woman, and her business is getting better and better because of her good management. As a result of the increasing needs of her customers, Khlây L. is applying for a loan so she can purchase more fish to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Monika

texts.en:
Monika C.  is currently in the business of selling maize, sorghum and bread  and is requesting a loan to top up more current goods to sell.  

Monika is 34 years old and is married to a husband who is on the Ministry of Health staff. She has eight children and only out of her children goes to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house and pay school fees.

loans.use: Top up more current goods to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose G.  is currently in the business of selling local brew, charcoal and flour  and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal and flour to sell.  Rose is 30 years old and is married to a husband who is a peasant. She has seven children and six of her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcoal and flour to sell

loans.name: Soun's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Soun S. is a 23-year-old married woman, selected as the village bank president, by this village bank which consists of thirteen members. They are located in Pou Thum village in Kandal province. Each member of this village bank will use their portion of the loan to support their different purposes. 

Mrs. Soun S. is a farmer who rents some pieces of land to cultivate corn and rice. They do not have enough money to support their farm. Thus, S. would like to ask for a loan to buy rice seed and corn seed to grow crops. She wants use the rest of the loan to buy fishing supplies for her husband's fishing business.Her husband, Mr. Savuth Nuon, who is 29 years old, works as construction worker, and he is also a fisherman. With their occupations, they are able to earn some income to support their family.  This couple has two children who are too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and corn seed to grow crops

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda D. C. is a 55-year-old mother from San Angel, San Jose, Antique, Philippines. She is already a widow and she lives with her daughter Eufemia, 29 years old and a housekeeper.

Erlinda has been an active member of ASHI Antique South Branch for almost 12 years.  As a member she maintains good performance and that is why she has gotten a bigger loan through ASHI. Because of her good performance, she is able to get an incentive loan from ASHI like House Repair Loans and Educational Loans. 

With her 12 years of membership, the branch is proud to tell you that the life of Erlinda is improving, not only her standard of living but the social aspects of her life. Like other women, she encounters difficulties in life but she is a mother who never gives up because she believes that if there is a will, there is a way. Even at the age of 55, she never stops dreaming, not only for herself but for the future of her grandchildren. She wants to help her children even they  already have their own family.

Erlinda wishes to apply for Php, 45,000 because she wants to buy another tricycle for her children so that they will also have an income to support their family.

loans.use: to buy another "tricycle" (motorcycle transport vehicle)

loans.name: Sori

texts.en: Sori P.  is currently in the business of selling charcoal  and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.  Sori is 19 years old and is married to a husband who is a mechanical engineer. She has 2 children and her children do not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Saroeun's Group

texts.en:
Six people make up this group loan. They live in Preaek Touch village in Kandal province. The group selected Mrs. Saroeun S., a 39-year-old married woman, as the group's leader. Each member of the group will use their portion of the loan for a different purpose. 

Mrs. Saroeun S. is a farmer who owns 10 hectares of land where she cultivates rice and vegetables, but she lacks the money to support it. So, she decided to ask for a loan to hire laborers to plow her farm. Her husband, Mr. Phuong Da, 40 years old, works as broker who is able to earn a small income to support his family and also helps his wife on the farm. The couple has five children: one is a laborer while others are students in the local school and also help on their parents farm.

loans.use: To hire laborers to plow her farm.

loans.name: Doki

texts.en: Doki V. has a general store and is requesting a loan to stock more goods such as bags of sugar and cartons of salt to sell. Doki is 42 years old and married to a business man. She has six children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: Stock more goods such as sugar and salt to sell

loans.name: Wilfreda

texts.en:
Wilfreda A. is from the village of Tambagan, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 42 years old and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Wilfreda has a business buying and selling fish including sardines, milkfish, mackerel and salmon. She has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Wilfreda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase fish to sell. This will be the first loan she has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Mr. Yuos Song Village Bank Group

texts.en: The twenty-one people who make up this bank loan group live in Boeng Krum Kraom village in Kandal province. All of the members will use their portion of the loan to improve their businesses. Mr. Yuos S., 60, is the group's president.  He is a fisherman while his wife, Mrs. Yan Sorm, owns a general store where she sells groceries to earn money to support her family. They have two children who are seamstresses in a garment factory. Mr. Yuos S. is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets as his old ones are worn out.

loans.use: To buy a fishing net

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Visitacion P. is from the village of Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 50 years old and married with four school-aged children. To make a living, Visitacion owns a store selling fish such as sardines, mackerel and milkfish. She has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Visitacion joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI and is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the second loan taken out by Visitacion from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand the her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: for working capital and purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Mary Nduta

texts.en:
Mary Nduta G. is a 23-year-old married mother of a three-year-old child. She has been selling clothes in Kapsabet town, and she deals with both new and secondhand clothes. She has been in business for two years now and has been making an average profit of 5,000 KES per month. This has enabled her to support her family well.

Mary learned about KADET through a friend who is a KADET client. Mary has no history with any other MFI. She applying for a second loan with which she intends to purchase more new and secondhand clothes to sell so that she can meet the demand for the holiday season. Most of her customers are from her community. The majority of them are poor earners with a few middle class clients.

Her future plan is to open a bigger shop and stock a variety of new clothes such as children's wear, men's wear and ladies' wear.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothes to sell

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice I. is 38 years old and married. Her husband is a businessman. She has four children who go to school.

Alice is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to work on building a house.

loans.use: To stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Nou Saran Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank located in Boeng Krum Kraom village in Kandal province has twenty-three people who have selected Mrs. Nou S. as the bank loA.’s president. Each of the members will use their portion of the loA. for their businesses to improve their standard living.

Nou is 42 years old and married to Mr. Proeng Oem. She has three children, all of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory. Nou is a farmer who owns a three-hectare plot of land where she grows rice to sell, while her husband is a fishermA. who also earns a little money to support his family.

Now is the time to plant Nou’s field, but she does not have the money to buy rice seed, so she would like a loA. to buy some.

loans.use: To buy rice seed

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Meas R., 46 years old, is a humble villager living in Phnom Penh in the middle of Cambodia. She is married and blessed with four children. Her husband is a motorbike taxi driver.

Meas is on the cleaning staff of a garment factory and earns a monthly salary suitable to that position. Meas finds it hard to walk to work and dreams of having a vehicle to drive, but she doesn’t have the money yet to buy one. Therefore, Meas would like a loan to purchase a secondhand motorcycle.

loans.use: To purchase a secondhand motorcycle

loans.name: Chhim Ya's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhim Y. is married to Mr. Sakk Sam Oeun, 49, who works as a farmer on his plot of land to grow crops. This couple has five children, three of whom are grocery sellers, while another is a student in the local school. They live in Kbal Chrouy village in Kandal province.

Chhim is the group leader of this group loan with four members. With their portions of the loan, each hopes that they will increase their incomes so as to improve their family’s living conditions.

Mrs. Chhim Y. earns her living by selling groceries in the local village. Her profits support the family. In order to increase her income so as to improve the family’s living conditions, Chhim would like to ask for a loan to buy more groceries to enlarge her business.

loans.use: To buy more groceries

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia A. is 48 years old, married and has four school-aged children. She is from the municipality of Medina, Misamis Oriental province on the Mindanao islands. Letecia runs a sari-sari (variety) shop from which she primarily buys and sells canned goods, instant noodles, biscuits and snacks in the local community. Letecia has been in business for over ten years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Letecia joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. Letecia successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional products to sell. Letecia is requesting a new loan, her fourth from HSPFI, of 13,000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

About HSPFI:

Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc., or HSPFI, is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Violy

texts.en: Violy P. is 36 years old and married to a husband who is a policeman. She has four children, three of whom go to school. Violy is currently in the business of selling bread and sugar and she is requesting a loan to stock more bags of sugar and baking flour. With the profits from her loan, Violy hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to stock bags of sugar and baking flour

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane N. is 32 years old and is married to Peter Kamau. They have two children aged ten and seven. They live in Kakamega town, which is in the western part of Kenya. This area is highly populated and most of Jane’s customers live within Kakamega town. For the past six years, Jane has been selling second-hand clothes and earning a good profit.

Jane is applying for loan of 50,000 KES from KADET Ltd. She was introduced to KADET by a friend who is a client. She has never borrowed from a microfinance institution before. Jane intends to use her loan to buy more clothes to expand her stock for the upcoming Christmas season. In the future, Jane would like to open a boutique.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing to expand stock

loans.name: Mrs. Bun Yong Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank consists of eighteen people who live in Boeng Krum Kraom village in Kandal province. Mrs. Bun Y., born in 1961, is a village bank president and has been selected as the group leader by the other members. Each of the members will use his or her portion of the loan in varied ways to support their businesses. 

Mrs. Bun Y. is a widow with a child who works as a waiter. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice and corn to sell to support her family. Now, in her field it is time to plant rice but Mrs. Y. does not have enough capital to buy seeds. Therefore, to improve production, Mrs. Bun Y. will use her loan to buy rice seed to plant this year.

loans.use: to buy rice seed

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice D. is currently in the business of selling bread and groundnuts and is requesting a loan to stock more baking flour to bake more bread to sell.  Alice is 26 years old and is widowed. She has 3 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: Stock more baking flour to bake more bread to sell.

loans.name: Ros' Group

texts.en:
Eight members are forming a village loan. They live in Kbal Chrouy village, Kandal province. Mrs. Ros N. has been selected by the village members to be a village bank president. She is a 32 year old married man. Each members will use their portion of the loan with different purposes.

Mrs. Ros N. is a seamstress in the garment factory, where she can receive a little salary to support her family. Her husband,Mr. Kheng Bopha, work as tailor at the local. In order to support and to expand the tailor business,
Mrs. Ros N. would like to ask for a loan to buy more clothes to enlarge her husband current business. This couple has a child who is too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy more fabric to enlarge his business activities.

loans.name: Daylinda

texts.en:
Daylinda M. is from the village of Talisayan, Misamis Oriental. She is 45 years old. Daylinda is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Daylinda owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, junk foods, canned goods, & instant noodles in the local community. Daylinda has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Daylinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Daylinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Daylinda is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Daylinda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Koy

texts.en: Koy C. is 29 year old married mother, who currently lives in the best territory of Phnom Penh Capital, in Cambodia Country. She works as a tailor who sews the villagers' clothes. She also shares her sewing knowledge with her trainees for a fee. She has a life partner in her husband, who works as electrician in a private company. This couple has been married for many years, but they still have no children. Koy C. has had to pay money for taxis to go anywhere because she doesn't own a vehicle. To solve this problem, she is applying for a loan to purchase a used motorcycle for traveling.

loans.use: To purchase a used motorcycle, which will allow her to commute to her work location.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora S. is currently in the business of selling bread and groundnuts, and is requesting a loan to stock more baking flour to bake more bread to sell. Flora is 32 years old and is married to an army man. She has 4 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: Stock more baking flour to bake more bread to sell.

loans.name: Mrs. Meaon Chreb Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fourteen people make up this village loan, and they selected Mrs. Meaon C. as village bank president. She is 35 years old, and lives in BoE. Krum Kraom village in Kandal province. The members will use their portion of the loan for different purposes, to improve their families.

Mrs. Meaon C. is a fish seller in local market, where she earns a large profit to support her family, while her husband, Mr. Sopheap Lor, is a fisherman and farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support his family. Her problem is that her husband’s field is ready to grow rice, but she does not have enough rice seed to grow. So, to improve production, Mrs. Meaon C. is seeking a loan to buy rice seed. She is a mother of three children, one of whom is a washer, while the others are studying in school.

loans.use: To buy rice seed.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia K. is a 30 year old single mother to Brian Alwaka, 10 years old. She lives in Luanda town, a very busy town with a good strategic marketplace. Many people come from different places to sell their farm and horticulture products, and trade livestock. Many of these traders are customers of Lydia's business. 

She has been selling used clothes for the past two years,and earns a monthly income of Kshs 9,000. She is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD after successfully repaying the first loan, and intends to buy two bales of used clothes to sell during this peak season.

Her desire is to open up a boutique in the future and be able to pay fees for her child.

loans.use: To buy two bales of clothes to add to her stock.

loans.name: Pros' Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Pros C. is a 22 year old married woman, and she was selected as the president of a village bank of twelve members. They are located in Chong Preaek village, Kandal province. Each member of this village will use their portion of the loan to support their different purposes.
 
Mrs. Pros C. and her husband, Mr. Da Rim, are farmers who rent 1-hectare of rice field, and cultivate rice, corn and peanuts. For the rice, they do not have a water machine to pump water to fill the field. Thus, Mrs. Pros C. would like to ask for a loan to buy a water machine to support this purpose. Aside from farming, her husband is also fisherman in the local village, and is able to earn a little income to support his family. This couple has a child who is just a year old.

loans.use: To buy a water machine for the farm.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah O. is married to Henry and they have three children; Grace 22 years, Joel 18 years, and Michele 12 years old. They live in the Luanda area in Vihiga.

Leah has a secondhand stall that she has been running for the past 11 years. She is applying for her second loan from Kadet Ltd after completing the first loan successfully. She is in dire need of more clothes to add to her stock, thus the need to apply for this loan. 

Her desire is to build a business premises that she can use and also see to it that her children are well educated.

loans.use: Buy more clothes to add to her stock.

loans.name: Maria Ebonne

texts.en:
Maria Ebonne C. is from the village of Binakalan, Gingoog City. She is 22 years old. Maria Ebonne is married and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Maria Ebonne owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing motorcycle or habal-habal services. Her husband is the driver for local community members. Maria Ebonne has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Maria Ebonne joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria Ebonne has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase materials needed to provide service. Maria Ebonne is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the motorcycle. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Maria Ebonne from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tools needed for the maintenance of motorcycle.

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Clara C. is from the village of Binakalan, Gingoog City. She is 49 years old. Clara is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Clara owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, junk food, instant noodles, and canned goods in the local community. Clara has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Clara joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Clara has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Clara is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Clara from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane N. is 59 years old and has two children: Wilson Odari, 22 years old, and Ann, 16 years old. She is married to Fred Kalinga, who is 65 years old. They live in the Chavano area in Vihiga.

Jane has a cereals business that she has been running for the past 8 years. Her monthly income is Kshs 9,900. She is applying for her 4th loan from Kadet Ltd and she has a good credit history with Kadet. His profits will be used to pay school fees for her children and also cater for the family's upkeep.

Her desire is to establish a grain depot to be able to supply grains in large quantities.

loans.use: Buy more cereals to add to her stock.

loans.name: Som's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Som E. is a married woman, and was selected as the group leader by the group's five members. They are located in Kaoh Touch village, in Kandal province. Each member of this group will use their portion of the loan to support their different purposes. 

Mrs. Som E. and her husband, Mr. Matt ME., are farmers who own 2-hectares of field and a threshing machine to cultivate rice for a living. With the threshing machine, they are able to earn a little income throughing rent it to other farmers. But now their threshing machine was broken. Thus, E. decided to ask for a loan to buy spare parts for the machine.  This couple has five children who all are students and also help their parents on the farm.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for threshing machine.

loans.name: Lani

texts.en:
Lani C. is from the village of Linconcomonan, Gingoog City. She is 36 years old. Lani is widowed and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Lani owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, junk food, instant noodles, and canned goods in the local community. Lani has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lani joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lani has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Lani is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Lani from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Gulbahor's Group

texts.en:
Gulbahor R. is the leader of the group. She is 49 and a widow, and has raised two daughters. The first daughter is married and lives separately with her family, and the second daughter helps her mom with housework. Gulbahor earns money by providing sewing services; she has been sewing clothes for 30 years. She hopes to obtain the loan because she needs money to purchase fabrics and materials for sewing. In the future she wants to expand her business and open a sewing workshop.

Nigorahon S., 24, is the treasurer of the group. She is married, her husband works in construction, and together they are raising two sons. Five years ago, with the initial investment of 10000 soms, Nigorahon started to breed cattle. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase cement and wood for building a house.

Tasilhan G., 61, is married. Her husband works in a car repairing center. Together they have raised a son and two daughters. Tasilhan earns money by selling food products. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase food products for sale and construction materials for building a house.

Haethon S., 27, is married. Her husband works in construction. They have a son, who is five. In order to make money, Haethon breeds cattle. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase a bull for breeding.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and materials.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel M. is 21 years old, a single man from Kakamega town. He is a businessman and sells household items and gadgets. He has been running his current business for the past four years and gets good profit.

He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD  after completing repaying the first loan successfully. He intends to use the money to buy household items for resale e.g., flashlights, mirrors, combs, etc. The profits made will be used to pay school fees for his siblings.

His desire is to open up a retail shop and stop hawking in the future.

loans.use: Buy household items e.g., combs, mirrors, flashlights

loans.name: Yeun

texts.en:
Yeun T., 42 years old, is a housewife who lives in Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. She always works at the many duties in her house such as cooking, doing housework, and caring for her children every day. 

Yeun T. is married to 49-year-old Houk Horn, who is a construction worker. The couple is blessed with three children; all of them are single. Yeun T. depends on the income from her daughter, who works as a garment worker. Her daughter always needs to hire a taxi to go to work because she has no vehicle. Yeun T. is taking out her loan for her daughter to buy a motorcycle to drive to her workplace.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for her daughter to drive to her workplace

loans.name: Chhe's Group

texts.en:
The group loan consists of four members. They are living in Kandal village, Kandal province. This group selected Mrs. Chhe L., a 58-year-old married woman, as the group leader. All the members of this group will use their portion of the loan to support their different purposes. 

Mrs. Chhe L. and her husband, Mr. Chuon Sorn, are farmers who own a plot of land that they use to cultivate corn and rice for a living. They face a problem because they lack money to support their crops. Thus, Mrs. Chhe L. would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide to cultivate corn and rice. This couple has two children who are seamstresses in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide to cultivate corn and rice

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn H. is from the village of Linconcomonan, Gingoog City. She is 34 years old. Evelyn is widowed and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Evelyn owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing motorcycle or habal-habal services. Her husband is the driver for local community members. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Evelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase materials needed to provide service. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the motorcycle. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Evelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase tools for maintenance of motorcycle.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace A. is 51 years old and married to Jackson Owino. They have three children aged 26, 20,and 16. They live in Kakamega town.

Grace has a business of selling oranges and mangoes; she is known for supplying the sweet ones, which some people use to make orange juice. She has been in this business for the past 21 years and her monthly profit from this business is Kshs.9,700, which she been using to pay school fees for her children. She is applying for her third loan from KADET LTD  after paying the previous loans successfully. She intends to use the money to buy more fruits to add to her stock.

Her desire is to open up a retail shop in the future.

loans.use: Buy more fruits to add to her stock.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia B. is 43 years old, married and has four school-aged children. She is from the village of Tambagan within the municipality of Medina, Misamis Oriental province on the Mindanao islands. Amalia runs a specialized retail store from which she primarily buys and sells coconuts for a copra business in the local community. Amalia has been in business for over ten years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month.

In 2010 Amalia joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. Amalia successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional coconuts to buy and sell. Amalia is requesting a new loan, her third from HSPFI, of 10,000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

About HSPFI:

Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc., or HSPFI, is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.
